Title: FP&A Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join our FP&A team at Bizzdesign. Are you searching for a challenging new position within a dynamic international company? Then look no further because we might have a match!




Who are we?




Bizzdesign is a SaaS company with 25 years in the Enterprise Architecture and Strategic Portfolio Management industries, with our HQ in Enschede. Our platform helps large enterprises, including Fortune 500 companies, make better decisions through Enterprise Architecture. We recently acquired Alfabet and MEGA International, expanding our portfolio and enhancing our offerings. With over 600 people from 32 nationalities working across 19 countries, we are growing fast and making an impact.




At Bizzdesign, we pride ourselves on a culture of trust, flexibility, and no-nonsense collaboration. You will join a flat, transparent organization where autonomy is valued, and your voice matters; no layers of red tape, just smart people solving meaningful problems together. We believe in empowering our team with the freedom to work how and where they work best, supported by a strong foundation of mutual respect and accountability. If you are someone who thrives in a high-trust, low-ego environment and values results over hierarchy, you will fit right in.




What impact will you make?




As a Data Analyst in our FP&A team, you’ll be at the heart of transforming data into actionable insights that fuel smarter decisions across the business. You’ll work closely with stakeholders to translate their needs into impactful dashboards, models, and analyses that shape strategy and execution.




What will you do?




Acting as a trusted analytics partner to domain managers, providing data-driven insights and recommendations.
Building and maintaining scalable Power BI dashboards that are both insightful and future-proof.
Using Salesforce and other data sources to create meaningful reports and ensure consistent KPI definitions.
Designing and analyzing experiments with statistical models to validate ideas and guide decision-making.
Supporting the development of predictive analyses and contributing to strategies that identify growth opportunities and improve business performance.
Contributing to improving reporting tools and supporting data governance initiatives.




This role gives you the freedom to bring your expertise and ideas to life while making a visible impact on cross-departmental collaboration and decision-making.




Who are you?




You are a data storyteller with a strong technical foundation and a passion for turning numbers into business value. Curious, proactive, and collaborative, you thrive in a fast-paced, international environment and enjoy being a bridge between business and technology.




We are looking for someone with:




4+ years of experience in data analytics, ideally in a SaaS international setting.
Strong expertise in Power BI and Salesforce (must-have).
Advanced skills in SQL and Excel, with solid experience in BI tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, or similar).
A strong quantitative background (engineering, econometrics, sciences, or business analytics).
End-to-end understanding of databases, data warehouses, APIs, and data integration processes.
Ability to communicate complex insights in a clear and compelling way to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A self-starter mindset with eagerness to continuously improve processes and challenge the status quo.




What’s in it for you?




A competitive salary package, including an annual bonus
Premium pension plan to secure your future
28 vacation days with the option to buy 10 extras for ultimate flexibility
Hybrid working with 2 days a week in the office
An NS Business Card or mileage reimbursement to support your commute
Personal IT budget to upgrade your setup
Monthly work-from-home allowance to support your ideal home office setup
Supportive, collaborative team culture
Work with an international and diverse group of colleagues
Your input is valued, regardless of role or tenure

Recruitment process




In this role, you can expect the following interviewing process:

An initial screening call with our Internal Recruiter (30 minutes)
1st Interview with our FP&A and Business Applications managers (30 minutes)
Case-study development (2-3 hours)
Final Interview: CFO & peer combination (30 minutes)




Please submit your CV in English, as only this format will be reviewed.




Are you ready to start building your future with us?

Please submit your CV in English, as only this format will be reviewed.

Title: Data Analyst, Fraud
Description:
This is Adyen

Adyen provides payments, data, and financial products in a single solution for customers like Meta, Uber, H&M, and Microsoft - making us the financial technology platform of choice. At Adyen, everything we do is engineered for ambition.

For our teams, we create an environment with opportunities for our people to succeed, backed by the culture and support to ensure they are enabled to truly own their careers. We are motivated individuals who tackle unique technical challenges at scale and solve them as a team. Together, we deliver innovative and ethical solutions that help businesses achieve their ambitions faster.

Data Analyst, Fraud

The Fraud Insights team is looking for a Data Analyst specializing in merchant fraud across both direct accounts and partner platform ecosystems who is eager to join our team. As part of the First Line, our job is to support both the risk management and operational efficiency of the organization. In our team, we place a big emphasis on outside-the-box thinking, and a combination of strong analytical and interpersonal skills. The domain we work under, Merchant Fraud, requires attention to detail while maintaining a good idea of risk holistically. The success of our team is measured on two axes- first as the risk owner we are looking out to ensure we’re adapting and updating the risk coverage of our framework. Secondly, we are continuously looking to optimize our framework and make sure we’re covering the same or more risk with fewer workload.

The fraud insights team is based in Amsterdam but operates with a global perspective. From payments to newer product developments, the environment we work on is continuously changing and we cannot afford to get comfortable. We don’t stop at analysis; we solve, implement, and monitor.

From scenario design and detection methods to forecasting and reporting, we work end-to-end to protect the business. Collaboration is core to how we operate- we work closely with data scientists, engineers, investigators, product managers, and compliance to turn ideas into real-world impact.

As an analyst on the team, you’ll play a key role in shaping and executing projects, taking ownership while being the go-to person for stakeholders, supported by a team lead for alignment.

What You’ll Do

Your main focus is to detect and prevent fraud by merchants who might misuse Adyen's payment processing services and related banking products for illicit activities. This role involves understanding these payment flows and identifying fraudulent patterns at the merchant level.


Detect and Prevent Merchant Fraud- Identify fraudulent behavior by merchants misusing Adyen’s payment processing or banking products.
Develop Typologies- Build a deep understanding of merchant fraud schemes and model them effectively using data.
Design Controls- Improve detection methods and rules by collaborating with product and engineering teams, aiming for effective coverage with minimal false positives.
Deliver Insights- Build dashboards and reports to share findings, measure impact, and inform risk strategies.
Collaborate Across Teams- Work with investigators, compliance, product, engineering, and operations to bring ideas from concept to production.
Translate & Influence- Clearly explain complex topics to both technical and non-technical audiences, ensuring alignment and adoption.
Continuously Improve- Monitor effectiveness of implemented controls, contribute to process improvement, and scale our fraud prevention framework.


Who You Are


Experienced in Fraud - You have 2+ years of experience in fraud analytics, ideally in payments, fintech, or financial services.
Technical Expert – Proficient Python and SQL. Strong with BI tools like Looker. Ideally you also have experience with big data tooling, i.e. PySpark
Financial Crime Warrior – Clear and strong motivation to work in the Merchant Fraud field.
Powerful Persuader + Communicator – Able to lead discussions effectively with technical and nontechnical audiences.
Business-Aware - You know how to balance precision and recall, and make decisions that reflect both fraud risk and operational impact.
Curiosity-driven – Asks the right questions and finds out more about the content and technology we work with on their own initiative.


Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion commitments

Our unique approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity of backgrounds and cultures is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business and technical challenges are unique, and we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them - voices like yours. No matter who you are or where you’re from, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen.

Studies show that women and members of underrepresented communities apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Does this sound like you? If so, Adyen encourages you to reconsider and apply. We look forward to your application!

What’s next?

Ensuring a smooth and enjoyable candidate experience is critical for us. We aim to get back to you regarding your application within 5 business days. Our interview process tends to take about 4 weeks to complete, but may fluctuate depending on the role. Learn more about our hiring process here. Don’t be afraid to let us know if you need more flexibility.

This role is based out of our Amsterdam office. We are an office-first company and value in-person collaboration; we do not offer remote-only roles.

Our interview process tends to take about 4 weeks to complete, but may fluctuate depending on the role. Learn more about our hiring process here. Don’t be afraid to let us know if you need more flexibility.

This role is based out of our Amsterdam office. We are an office-first company and value in-person collaboration; we do not offer remote-only roles.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're seeking a Data Analyst to join our team and elevate our analytics capabilities to new heights! If you're driven by uncovering meaningful patterns in data and love turning complex information into actionable business strategies, Nmbrs offers the perfect environment to make a real impact.

Your expertise in data analytics could be the key to unlocking our next breakthrough - are you ready to shape the future with us?




About Nmbrs:

We're a fast-growing scale-up building innovative HR & payroll technology. With 150+ colleagues in Amsterdam, Lisbon, and Stockholm, we do things differently. No traditional managers, a 4-day workweek, and the freedom to make an impact.




In this role, you'll:

Handle both backend data processing and frontend visualization to deliver comprehensive analytics platforms
Create regular reports and perform methodical analysis on product, financial, and performance data from discovery to delivery
Collaborate with stakeholders across the organization to define priorities, discuss data strategy, and communicate complex insights clearly
Oversee API management, Python ETL scripts, and end-to-end data workflows from extraction to analysis
Apply proven experience in analytics strategy, data analysis, and visualization to support decision-making across all company departments







A day at work

You start your day by checking in with your squad, sharing progress and discussing any challenges. As a team, you collaborate to remove blockers and support each other.

Later, you partner with a product specialist to investigate a feature that isn't performing as expected. You identify where the relevant data is stored and use SQL to extract the necessary information for analysis.

After validating the findings with stakeholders, you co-create a Power BI dashboard to visualize the insights. You then organize a meeting with the stakeholders who requested the data to walk them through the results and support data-driven decision-making.




Some ongoing projects in your future squad:

Churn analysis and root cause investigation
Automated data centralisation using Python/API containerised solutions
PowerBI dashboards for product insights, user behaviour and priority setting
Analysis to better understand the performance of Cross-sell products and new features Revenue forecasting and customer satisfaction reporting




What you'll bring:

Have a bachelor or masters degree in a technical field (HBO or WO level) (in Computer Science is a plus)
Have at least 2+ years of work experience as Data Analyst/Business Analyst in a Saas environment (mandatory)
Have proven experience with SQL and Python. PowerBI and Azure (or similar cloud service) knowledge is nice to have (must have)
Have experience with ETL pipelines and automation (must have)
Happy to communicate with your squad and other squads, able to make the translation from data to valuable business insights and able to present it to stakeholders
Are able to work independently and in a team, to be a real Difference-maker
Have a proactive, curious approach, since without managers this is essential
Speak English fluently (fluency in Dutch is a plus)




What's in it for you:

We offer a gross annual salary of 50K to 55K including holiday allowance, depending on experience;
Nmbrs is a flat organisation in which you have the freedom and responsibility to do what you are good at and have an impact, in an agile working environment;
A personal coach who helps you with your personal and professional growth as well as a yearly budget for training and personal development;
We ensure a healthy work-life balance;
For us full-time means a 4-day workweek giving you one paid personal day to spend in a way that will benefit you the most;
We have a big and light office space close to the Sloterdijk train station, and all the floors of the office are accessible by elevator;
We work hybrid at Nmbrs
We kick off the summer by bringing all offices together for an amazing event at a very secret location to spark togetherness and innovation and celebrate with each other;
Additionally we organise fun events of different themes every month, think: game nights, movie nights, ping pong tournaments, or pizza party (all events are voluntary);
Nmbrs offers the opportunity to go on an exchange to our offices in Lisbon or Stockholm for up to 4 months.




Please note: We are not able to consider candidates who are not living and working in the Netherlands. At this moment we are not providing relocation sponsorships.




As part of our hiring process, we conduct a criminal background check for all candidates reaching the final stages. This helps us ensure a safe and secure environment for everyone.




At Nmbrs, we celebrate diversity and promote an inclusive environment where our team members from all backgrounds, ages, genders, or sexual orientations feel equally appreciated. In order to achieve this, we are committed to shaping a hiring process that provides everyone with an equal opportunity to get hired.

Show more
HTML:
We're seeking a Data Analyst to join our team and elevate our analytics capabilities to new heights! If you're driven by uncovering meaningful patterns in data and love turning complex information into actionable business strategies, Nmbrs offers the perfect environment to make a real impact.

Your expertise in data analytics could be the key to unlocking our next breakthrough - are you ready to shape the future with us?


About Nmbrs:

We're a fast-growing scale-up building innovative HR & payroll technology. With 150+ colleagues in Amsterdam, Lisbon, and Stockholm, we do things differently. No traditional managers, a 4-day workweek, and the freedom to make an impact.


In this role, you'll:

  • Handle both backend data processing and frontend visualization to deliver comprehensive analytics platforms
  • Create regular reports and perform methodical analysis on product, financial, and performance data from discovery to delivery
  • Collaborate with stakeholders across the organization to define priorities, discuss data strategy, and communicate complex insights clearly
  • Oversee API management, Python ETL scripts, and end-to-end data workflows from extraction to analysis
  • Apply proven experience in analytics strategy, data analysis, and visualization to support decision-making across all company departments



A day at work

You start your day by checking in with your squad, sharing progress and discussing any challenges. As a team, you collaborate to remove blockers and support each other.

Later, you partner with a product specialist to investigate a feature that isn't performing as expected. You identify where the relevant data is stored and use SQL to extract the necessary information for analysis.

After validating the findings with stakeholders, you co-create a Power BI dashboard to visualize the insights. You then organize a meeting with the stakeholders who requested the data to walk them through the results and support data-driven decision-making.


Some ongoing projects in your future squad:

  • Churn analysis and root cause investigation
  • Automated data centralisation using Python/API containerised solutions
  • PowerBI dashboards for product insights, user behaviour and priority setting
  • Analysis to better understand the performance of Cross-sell products and new features Revenue forecasting and customer satisfaction reporting


What you'll bring:

  • Have a bachelor or masters degree in a technical field (HBO or WO level) (in Computer Science is a plus)
  • Have at least 2+ years of work experience as Data Analyst/Business Analyst in a Saas environment (mandatory)
  • Have proven experience with SQL and Python. PowerBI and Azure (or similar cloud service) knowledge is nice to have (must have)
  • Have experience with ETL pipelines and automation (must have)
  • Happy to communicate with your squad and other squads, able to make the translation from data to valuable business insights and able to present it to stakeholders
  • Are able to work independently and in a team, to be a real Difference-maker
  • Have a proactive, curious approach, since without managers this is essential
  • Speak English fluently (fluency in Dutch is a plus)


What's in it for you:

  • We offer a gross annual salary of 50K to 55K including holiday allowance, depending on experience;
  • Nmbrs is a flat organisation in which you have the freedom and responsibility to do what you are good at and have an impact, in an agile working environment;
  • A personal coach who helps you with your personal and professional growth as well as a yearly budget for training and personal development;
  • We ensure a healthy work-life balance;
  • For us full-time means a 4-day workweek giving you one paid personal day to spend in a way that will benefit you the most;
  • We have a big and light office space close to the Sloterdijk train station, and all the floors of the office are accessible by elevator;
  • We work hybrid at Nmbrs
  • We kick off the summer by bringing all offices together for an amazing event at a very secret location to spark togetherness and innovation and celebrate with each other;
  • Additionally we organise fun events of different themes every month, think: game nights, movie nights, ping pong tournaments, or pizza party (all events are voluntary);
  • Nmbrs offers the opportunity to go on an exchange to our offices in Lisbon or Stockholm for up to 4 months.


Please note: We are not able to consider candidates who are not living and working in the Netherlands. At this moment we are not providing relocation sponsorships.


As part of our hiring process, we conduct a criminal background check for all candidates reaching the final stages. This helps us ensure a safe and secure environment for everyone.


At Nmbrs, we celebrate diversity and promote an inclusive environment where our team members from all backgrounds, ages, genders, or sexual orientations feel equally appreciated. In order to achieve this, we are committed to shaping a hiring process that provides everyone with an equal opportunity to get hired.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Drive the future of sustainable mobility - with data!

We are looking for a Data Analyst to help SnappCar make smarter choices and turning data into insights and solutions to support the shift towards a more data-driven way of working.

At SnappCar, we're on a mission to halve the number of cars on the road by making car ownership unnecessary. Our peer-to-peer car sharing platform is active in the Netherlands and Germany – and we’re growing fast. As a Data Analyst you will help us improve the product, grow the community, and accelerate the shift towards shared mobility.

About The Job

As our Data Analyst, you’ll play an important role in enhancing decision-making across departments—from product and marketing to support, finance and sales. You’ll translate data into insights, while building and improving pipelines and data models using tools like Apache Airflow and Power BI. Success in this role depends not just on technical skill, but also on an understanding of business needs and an ability to transform data into tangible business impact.

What You’ll Be Doing


Build and maintain dashboards and reports (Power BI, Mixpanel, Snowflake) that support decisions across teams
Analyze user behavior, funnels, and marketplace trends to uncover growth opportunities
Support the product and growth team with smart data models, A/B testing, and experiment design
Strengthen and scale the data stack to ensure reliable, efficient pipelines and models
Work closely with stakeholders to present insights, challenge assumptions, and drive data-informed decisions


As we’re a scale-up, your scope will be quite broad, which is a great opportunity to learn. So next to analysis, you’ll also get to work and learn on more data engineering and data science projects.

About You


2–4 years of experience in data analytics, preferably in a product-led or marketplace environment
Proficiency in SQL and experience with BI tools (such as Power BI, Looker Studio, Tableau)
Familiarity with A/B testing methodologies and statistics
Bonus: experience with Python/R and other data modeling tools
Strong communication skills – you can tell a clear story with data
A proactive mindset and a natural curiosity to dig deep into numbers
Affinity with sustainability, mobility, or the sharing economy is a plus


Ideally we are looking for someone with relevant experience under their belt (2-4 years). And most importantly: you identify yourself with SnappCar’s mission and values, and are able to work in a scale-up environment.

Next to this, we want to stress that SnappCar is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from individuals of all races, genders, ages, religions, disabilities, and sexual orientations. We value the perspectives and experiences that individuals from diverse backgrounds bring to our organization, and we strive to create a workplace where everyone feels welcomed and supported. Therefore, we encourage qualified candidates of all backgrounds to apply.

What We Bring To The Table

At SnappCar we recognize the demands of being a data analyst, and want to make sure that next to a challenging and engaging position we offer you the following:


A meaningful impact on sustainability
Competitive salary
End-of-the-Year financial bonus, based on company performance
Unlimited Holiday Policy
Snabbatical (1 month paid leave after 3 years of employment, and 3 months leave after 5 years) to give you time to recharge
8% yearly holiday pay
Free rides (SnappCar credits to save on commutes!)
A very creative, energetic and international working environment at a great HQ office in the centre of Utrecht
A supportive team driven by innovation and growth with whom we have lots of fun team days and other events.
A laptop to do your work
A yearly budget for professional growth opportunities
Travel expenses paid (so you can actually get to the office on office days)
Delicious healthy lunches on office days


Lots of fun, teambuilding and celebrating successes together!

Apply for the job

If you’re excited about using your data skills to support a greener future at SnappCar, we’d love to meet you!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our dynamic, international team. The Data Analyst plays a key role in shaping the future of our innovative startup.

We're seeking a data-driven problem solver who is passionate about delivering the best possible monitoring solution for our customers. As a valued member of our growing company, you'll make sure the cutting-edge analytical solutions are leveraged for our customer. You’ll be working closely with operational teams to present your insights and with technology teams to drive innovation further.

Key activities:


Maintain and improve internal and external reporting procedures
Process and analyse data from IoT sensors
Create compelling data visualizations and reports
Communicate findings and observations effectively
Maintain customer facing dashboards
Realize the onboarding of new customers and monitoring on the dashboard



About Us

At Villari, we are dedicated to extending the lifetime of steel structures in ports, infrastructure, and the steel industry through our certified crack detection technology. Our permanently installed wireless sensors detect even the smallest fatigue cracks in critical locations of bridges and cranes by analysing variations in the magnetic field over time. Compared to traditional methods, we offer continuous and accurate inspection, carefree installation, competitive pricing, and certified technology. Our unique and patented solution has earned the trust of esteemed customers such as Tata Steel, Rijkswaterstaat, ProRail, ArcelorMittal, and many more. We take pride in our extensive coverage of 1700 sensors deployed across 11 countries, ensuring the safety and longevity of critical steel structures worldwide.

Villari’s core values are the following:


Integrity - We are honest about what we know and what we don't know for certain. We treat our data with the greatest care and understand that this is of utmost importance in this critical industrial environment in which we operate. There is always room to address doubts and uncertainties, such that nothing is swept under the rug.
Expertise - Our company is delivering seriously high-tech service: we’re not building a new app to order pizza. The combination of fatigue crack growth, ferromagnetic flux leakage, and seamless wireless communication is our unique domain in which we work with a proud team of highly-skilled and intellectual people. Customers rely on us because we know what we’re doing.
Accountability - We take responsibility for our actions. There’s no “not my problem” or “I don’t care” attitude at Villari. Learning from each other and carrying both a collective and individual feeling of ownership is extremely important in order to be an effective and well-balanced team.
Exploration - Villari was founded on the idea that we were bold enough to take complex physics and turn it into a meaningful product for our customers. As such we’ve pushed quite some boundaries along the way and we’re not afraid to turn left where others go right. On all levels people should be encouraged to try out new things and to test “wild ideas”. We understand and accept that new ideas sometimes turn out to be unsuccessful, as this is an integral part of exploring.
Approachability - As a company, and as individuals, we want to always be open for discussion, feedback, doubts, or just a casual chat about a topic unrelated to work. This goes towards clients, suppliers, colleagues, and towards superiors and people under your supervision. We help each other out and listen when others have something to say, regardless of seniority.



These values are at the core of our business and identity and it's very important that all our employees identify with these values.

What will you bring?


Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree (HBO level) in Data Science, Software Development, Physics, or a related technical field
Basic proficiency in Python, including experience with libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, and Matplotlib
Solid understanding of data analysis methods
Strong communication skills; able to collaborate effectively across teams and departments
Proven track record of working in a highly structured and organised way. Be prepared to demonstrate this with examples from past work or internship experiences during the interview and case study
Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge of database management and SQL
Familiarity with IoT data analysis and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure)
Proficiency with Jupyter Notebooks or similar development environments
Nice to have:
Knowledge of electromagnetics (including principles of electromagnetic theory and applications)
Familiarity with Git version control and collaborative coding practices
Knowledge of IoT communication protocols / LoRaWAN
Skills & Attributes:
Excellent communication skills in English (written and verbal)
Ability to work both independently and as part of a collaborative team
Skilled in Microsoft Office applications (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)
Adaptability, proactivity, and a passion for learning in a fast-paced startup environment



What do we offer?


A gross salary between €2500,- and €3500,- per month, depending on your experience.
Contribute and experience being part of a scale-up with international ambitions.
Energetic and professional company culture, based on ownership and responsibility
25 vacation days per year
Hybrid and onsite working opportunities
Travel expenses covered
Every day we will provide a lunch at our office
Participate in the most fun company events and drinks
Show more

  • Ability to work both independently and as part of a collaborative team
  • Skilled in Microsoft Office applications (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)
  • Adaptability, proactivity, and a passion for learning in a fast-paced startup environment


What do we offer?

  • A gross salary between €2500,- and €3500,- per month, depending on your experience.
  • Contribute and experience being part of a scale-up with international ambitions.
  • Energetic and professional company culture, based on ownership and responsibility
  • 25 vacation days per year
  • Hybrid and onsite working opportunities
  • Travel expenses covered
  • Every day we will provide a lunch at our office
  • Participate in the most fun company events and drinks

Title: Data Analyst
Company: SDG Group in the Netherlands – A Division of Alten NL
Place: Capelle aan den IJssel, South Holland, Netherlands
Description:
Data Analyst – Capelle a/d IJssel - ALTEN Nederland




De functie

Als onderdeel van ons groeiend bedrijf zijn wij op zoek naar een Data Analyst om ons team te versterken en bij te dragen aan lopende klantprojecten in Capelle a/d IJssel.




Als Data Analyst omvatten je belangrijkste taken:

Analyseren, interpreteren en visualiseren van complexe datasets
Meedenken met klanten over data-gedreven verbeteringen en oplossingen
Ontwerpen van dashboards en rapportages met tools zoals Power BI of Tableau
Vertalen van businessvraagstukken naar concrete data-analyses (SQL, Python, R)
Samenwerken met multidisciplinaire teams (developers, engineers, consultants)
Bijdragen aan projecten van data-acquisitie tot presentatie en advies




Jouw profiel

Minimaal een hbo- of wo-diploma in een relevante richting (bijv. Data Science, Informatica, Econometrie)
Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke functie als Data Analyst of BI Consultant
Vaardig in SQL, Power BI, Tableau en kennis van Python en/of R
Vloeiend in Nederlands en Engels
Gewenste soft skills: analytisch denkvermogen, probleemoplossend, communicatief sterk, klantgericht en proactief




Arbeidsvoorwaarden

Je krijgt een vast contract
Je krijgt een leaseauto met tankpas
Mogelijkheid tot hybride werken
Maandelijkse netto onkostenvergoeding
27 vakantiedagen met de mogelijkheid om 10 extra dagen bij te kopen
Pensioenregeling zonder eigen bijdrage




Waarom kiezen voor ALTEN?

Impactvolle projecten in belangrijke sectoren: Draag bij aan betekenisvolle initiatieven in sectoren zoals defensie, transport, telecom en financiën, waar jouw expertise echt het verschil maakt.
Een breed klantenportfolio: Werk samen met zowel grote marktleiders als innovatieve middelgrote bedrijven en verzamel zo diverse en verrijkende ervaringen.
Versterk je loopbaan dankzij SDG's expertise: Bij ALTEN staat jouw ontwikkeling centraal. Je krijgt toegang tot doorlopende leermogelijkheden via trainingen, technische communities en evenementen. Sinds 2020 is dit verder versterkt door de integratie van SDG, erkend als pionier in Data-, Analytics- & AI-consultancy en als leider in complexe systemen en embedded technologieën.
Een cultuur van innovatie en samenwerking: Ontplooi je in een omgeving die creativiteit waardeert, kennisdeling aanmoedigt en gezamenlijk succes stimuleert.




Over ALTEN

ALTEN is een wereldwijde leider in engineering- en technologieconsultancy, en ondersteunt topklanten in hun innovatie- en R&D-strategieën. Met meer dan 57.000 medewerkers in meer dan 30 landen zijn we actief in sectoren zoals lucht- en ruimtevaart, automotive, telecom, financiën, energie en life sciences.




ALTEN Netherlands is een belangrijke entiteit binnen de ALTEN Group, met kantoren in Eindhoven, Capelle aan den IJssel, Apeldoorn, Groningen en Amstelveen. Onze 550+ consultants leveren hoogwaardige oplossingen in technologie en IT. Al meer dan 20 jaar dragen we in Nederland bij aan impactvolle projecten in hightech, defensie, transport, telecom en financiën, en ondersteunen we bedrijven in hun technologische transformatie.




Een belangrijke stap in onze ontwikkeling was de overname van SDG, erkend als pionier in Data, Analytics & AI-consultancy en expert in complexe systeemengineering. Deze strategische stap heeft onze technische expertise vergroot en ons aanbod van geavanceerde oplossingen verbreed. Door de integratie van SDG’s kennis kunnen we innovatieve oplossingen bieden die extra waarde creëren voor zowel onze klanten als consultants, in Nederland en daarbuiten.




Klaar voor jouw volgende uitdaging?

Solliciteer nu en neem deel aan boeiende en impactvolle projecten bij ALTEN Nederland!

Show more

Deze strategische stap heeft onze technische expertise vergroot en ons aanbod van geavanceerde oplossingen verbreed. Door de integratie van SDG’s kennis kunnen we innovatieve oplossingen bieden die extra waarde creëren voor zowel onze klanten als consultants, in Nederland en daarbuiten.


Klaar voor jouw volgende uitdaging?

Solliciteer nu en neem deel aan boeiende en impactvolle projecten bij ALTEN Nederland!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Kramp, we are driving innovation by accelerating the adoption of AI across our organization, increasing productivity, and transforming the way our teams work: faster, easier, and more automated through the development of lightweight GenAI applications.

We're looking for a Data Analyst who is ready to speak the language of data to drive transformation, especially in the context of deploying GenAI-powered tools across the business.

Your role:

You will lead the end-to-end analysis and interpretation of complex data sets to uncover insights that drive our AI-powered innovation. You’ll design and deliver data solutions that support GenAI application development, working closely with engineers and business stakeholders to translate needs into actionable insights. Your role involves identifying automation opportunities, building scalable dashboards and models, and ensuring data-driven decisions accelerate productivity and strategic goals. By bridging the technical and business worlds, you’ll empower teams to rapidly prototype, validate, and scale AI solutions across the organization.

Your responsibilites:


Analyze and interpret complex data sets to extract actionable insights that support AI-driven innovation and strategic decision-making.
Collaborate closely with engineers, product owners, and business stakeholders to translate business needs into analytical solutions and data models.
Design, build, and maintain scalable dashboards, reports, and predictive models that inform and accelerate GenAI application development.
Identify and prioritize opportunities for process automation and workflow optimization using AI and data-driven approaches.
Support rapid prototyping and validation of AI-powered tools, enabling quick iteration and scaling of successful concepts.
Communicate complex analytical findings clearly and effectively to non-technical stakeholders to drive data literacy and adoption.
Ensure data quality, integrity, and security across analytics workflows and support deployment in cloud environments.
Stay up to date with AI, machine learning, and data analytics trends to continuously enhance tools, methods, and business impact.



Your team:

You’ll join a small but growing team with the mission to accelerate Kramp's adoption of AI at a rapid rate, not just through presentations and trainings, but by delivering tangible business cases. We operate at the cutting edge of innovation and AI adoption, working alongside 3,500 international colleagues. Join us on a journey where strategy meets innovation, your insights shape our vision, and where “It’s that easy” becomes reality.

Who are you?

You don’t just analyze data, you connect the dots between information, intelligence, and innovation. We’re looking for someone who can translate complex data into strategic direction. You bring:


A Completed Master degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Econometrics, or a related field.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar data-driven role
You bring a background in consulting, potentially gained at a Big Four firm.
Excellent technical skills, such as in Python/ SQL with the curiosity to embrace other programming languages as your tools.
You’re the bridge between two worlds: the technical and the non-technical and thus your communication skills should be excellent.
The ability to translate complex data and AI-driven insights into clear, impactful recommendations for non-technical stakeholders.
Experience working cross-functionally to identify opportunities where AI can add value.



What do we offer?

We are an ambitious, fast-growing and financially sound organization. You can obviously expect:


Competitive salary.
25 vacation days and 12 ADV days (based on a full time contract).
Flexible working policy in hours and location (with offices in Utrecht, Varsseveld and Leek).
Travel and working from home allowance.
Profit sharing bonus.
Learning budget for training and courses to support your growth ambitions.
Generous pension plan.



Procedure and contact:

Please apply via the apply button on the careerpage. Don't hesitate to reach out to Jelle Dijkstra jelle.dijkstra@kramp.com (Talent Acquisition Specialist) if you have any questions.

About us:

Thanks to our ambitions we are active throughout Europe: a leading position in the agricultural market for parts. We heavily invest in E-Business and innovations. Our aim is to make it easy for our customers to run their business. Working at Kramp means working with over 3500 international colleagues. . The people at Kramp are enthusiastic, professional and involved. We speak our customers’ language, understand their challenges and earn their trust to exceed their expectations. Our promise “It’s that easy” is embedded in our culture and DNA.

Working at Kramp means:

… you belong here! Being part of our open business community

… your work makes a difference! Have an impact on what matters

… you will develop and realize ! Learn and realize your potential

More about Kramp: https://www.careeratkramp.com/nl-nl

Utrecht (NL)

Title: Visiting Data Analyst
Description:
About Antler

Antler backs the world’s most ambitious founders from the very start. Founded on the belief that innovation is the key to building a better future, we partner with people across six continents to launch and scale high-potential startups that address meaningful opportunities and challenges. Knowing that exceptional founders can come from anywhere with any background, we have offices in 30 cities, including New York, London, Berlin, Stockholm, Bangalore, Singapore, Seoul, and Sydney.

Our global community supports founders on deep business model validation, initial capital, expansion support, and follow-on funding. Fueled by a personal passion that goes beyond traditional investing, we have helped create and invested in more than 1,500 startups across a wide range of industries and technologies.

A better future won’t happen automatically—the world needs talented, determined, and resilient people to build it. Antler team members are part of an ambitious global community dedicated to helping the most driven founders move the world forward.

The Role

We’re looking for an exceptional talent to join our team as a Data Analyst (Intern) — a role at the intersection of data, automation, and decision-making.

Your mission: help us work smarter, faster, and more data-driven. You’ll shadow the investment and operations team to automate repetitive tasks, crunch data to derive new insights, and create tools/dashboards that give us — and our founders — an unfair advantage.

How you’ll make 10x impact:


Automate the repetitive — Identify inefficiencies and build workflows, scripts, and integrations to eliminate them
Turn raw data into insights — this requires you to pull, clean, structure, and analyze data from multiple sources
Contribute to founder selection, residency operations, and portfolio support initiatives
Collaborate with a tight-knit team across Berlin and Amsterdam in a fast-paced, international environment


What you should bring:


Experience with coding and data analysis (Python preferred, but any language is welcome — university projects count as experience too)
Strong analytical and communication skills
A bias to action and the ability to work independently and in teams
Clear interest in startups, tech, and venture capital
Fluency in English (both in written and verbal communication)


Skills to excel in this role:


High standards for accuracy, speed, and clarity
Resourceful and able to figure things out fast
Quick to learn, adapt, and execute without hand-holding


The track record speaks for itself:

Proven to be a strong stepping stone — our alumni have gone on to:


26% join Antler full-time
21% go on to MBB Consulting
21% become startup Founders
21% become Founders’ Associates
5% join other top-tier VC funds
5% pursue other roles


Duration: 3–6 months

Location: Berlin & Amsterdam

Start date: As soon as possible

If you want to fast-track your career in tech or venture capital, work with exceptional founders, and be part of a high-energy international team —please apply.

Powered by JazzHR

Title: Data & BI Analist
HTML:
Vacature: Data & BI Consultant


Bij Scope Data & AI groeit ons consulting team en daarom zijn we op zoek naar enthousiaste collega's. Als Data & BI Consultant ga je bij onze opdrachtgevers aan de slag om met data gedreven oplossingen de bedrijfsvoering te verbeteren. Dit op het snijvlak van Data Management - Data Engineering - Process mining - Business Intelligence en Reporting & Analytics.


Je speelt een cruciale rol in het analyseren, interpreteren en optimaliseren van datastromen. Deze uitdaging wordt ondersteund vanuit onze organisatie, waarvoor je werkt op basis van een vast dienstverband.


Jouw Profiel:

  • Je hebt een afgeronde HBO- of WO-studie in Informatica, Bedrijfskunde of een vergelijkbare richting;
  • Je hebt o.a. ervaring met één of meerdere BI-tools, zoals MS PowerBI, Tableau en Qliksense;
  • Ervaring met data-architectuur, data-modellering, databases, en data-integratie is een vereiste;
  • Kennis van SQL, en ervaring met MSBI (SSIS,SSRS, SSAS) zijn essentieel;
  • Je hebt expertise in datawarehousing principes (MS Azure, AWS, Google) en ETL-processen;
  • De Scrum methodiek spreekt je aan;
  • Data modellering heeft geen geheimen voor jou;
  • Uitdaging en dynamiek zijn voor jou de basis ingrediënten voor een fijne werkdag;
  • Naast een analytische denker ben je ook ondernemend en communicatief vaardig in zowel Nederlands als Engels.


Aanbod:

  • Een fantastische kans bij een groeiende organisatie met een 'wees-vooral-jezelf-mentaliteit';
  • Quality time en plezier in het werk;
  • Ontwikkeling van jouw cv met gestimuleerde ontwikkelmogelijkheden, kennisdeling, en persoonlijke begeleiding;
  • Een salaris tussen de €.3000,- en €.6000,- per maand op basis van een fulltime dienstverband;
  • Leerzame projecten bij aansprekende opdrachtgevers;
  • Goede primaire en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden.


Reageren bij Scope Data:

Wij zijn benieuwd naar jou! Neem gerust contact met ons op om een afspraak te maken via telefoonnummer 088 - 20 549 60 of stuur een e-mail naar info@scopedata.nl.


Scope Data & AI: voor professionals en oplossingen in Data & Analytics - Consultancy, Projectmanagement, Interim Services, Werving & Selectie.

Title: Junior Data Analist
HTML:
ErasmusTalent.nl is een online vacatureplatform voor Studenten, Trainees, Junior & Medior Professionals op HBO/WO-niveau met 0-5 jaar ervaring.


Voor onze Partner Veneficus zoeken wij een Junior Data Analist met interesse in Data en IT.


Kickstart jouw carrière als Data Analist – word trainee bij VF Talent Academy!

📍 Locatie: Randstad | Vast contract | €2.600 p/m | Hybride werken

Ben jij (bijna) klaar met je studie en zie je jezelf puzzelen met data, slimme oplossingen bedenken en écht impact maken met jouw analytische skills? Dan hebben wij dé springplank voor jouw carrière. 💥


Bij VF Talent Academy word jij in één jaar klaargestoomd tot volwaardig Data Analist. Hoe? Met een stevig traineeship waarin jouw groei centraal staat. Denk: leren van toptrainers, coaching op maat, soft skill weekends én direct aan de slag bij een toffe opdrachtgever. Jij leert. Jij groeit. Jij maakt verschil.


Wat ga je doen?

  • Je start met een intensieve bootcamp vol technische en persoonlijke trainingen;
  • Daarna draai je mee bij een opdrachtgever als volwaardig Data Analist;
  • Je wordt continu begeleid door een Learning Consultant en een Personal Coach;
  • Je werkt aan echte vraagstukken, in een echte werkomgeving, met echte impact;
  • Is er na een jaar nog steeds een klik? Dan kun je direct in dienst treden bij de opdrachtgever.


Jij bent...

  • (Bijna) afgestudeerd aan een hbo- of wo-opleiding, liefst in een bèta richting;
  • Nieuwsgierig, analytisch en hebt al wat geproefd van Python, R of Matlab;
  • Niet bang om in het diepe te springen;
  • Flexibel en woonachtig in (of bereid te verhuizen naar) de Randstad;
  • Op zoek naar een plek waar je kunt groeien, leren én plezier maken.


Wat krijg je van ons?

  • Een vast contract vanaf dag 1 (ja, écht);
  • €2.600 bruto p/m + vakantiegeld, thuiswerkvergoeding, bonusregeling én pensioen;
  • Een NS-Businesscard, Swapfiets & laptop;
  • Een ontwikkelpad dat jouw technische én persoonlijke skills versterkt;
  • Werken waar jij wil: hybride of zelfs remote;
  • Regelmatige borrels, terugkomdagen en een team dat altijd voor je klaarstaat;
  • Én: een vrijwilligersdag waarop jij iets goeds doet voor een ander.


Wie zijn wij?

Veneficus. Optimizing Intelligence.

Wij maken bedrijven slimmer met data en helpen beslissers het verschil te maken. En dat begint bij mensen zoals jij. Ambitieus, analytisch, leergierig – klaar om impact te maken.


Klaar voor een carrière in data?

Kijk hier voor een uitgebreid vacatureprofiel en om direct te solliciteren: Junior Data Analist


Op zoek naar meer uitdagende vacatures? Bekijk ze op www.erasmustalent.nl/vacatures!


Solliciteren via ErasmusTalent:

1️⃣ Vul je gegevens in en solliciteer via ons platform.

2️⃣ Het bedrijf laat je snel weten of je door bent.

3️⃣ Niet geselecteerd? Geen zorgen! We helpen je graag verder.

Title: DIGITAL DATA ANALYST (M/F/D)
Description:
We are a community open to everyone. One global team where everyone counts.

Join the Canyon team and work at the cutting edge of the bike industry, with a job as versatile and exciting as the bikes we develop. All in an open, international atmosphere where teamwork, collaboration, true innovation, and a dynamic workplace are all part of our everyday. Ready to ride with us?

THE ROLE

Canyon is a digital-first, direct-to-consumer brand – and data is at the heart of how we grow, optimise, and innovate. As a Digital Data Analyst, you'll combine business acumen with deep technical expertise to generate robust analytics, scalable reporting, and actionable insight. You’ll work across Digital, Marketing, Sales, and BI to build analytical products, engineer efficient data pipelines, and enable decision-making at speed and scale.

YOUR JOB AS PART OF THE CANYON CREW


Partner with business stakeholders to scope analytical use cases and deliver structured, data-driven solutions
Analyse KPIs spanning e-commerce performance, customer journeys, traffic acquisition, conversion, and product engagement
Build robust dashboards and scalable reporting tools using data from GA4, CRM, ERP, and marketing platforms
Convey data-driven insights and business recommendations through clear and actionable presentations, up to C-level audience
Develop and maintain performant cloud-based data pipelines to enable reliable access to clean, transformed datasets
Integrate external and internal APIs to enrich existing data sources and improve attribution, segmentation, and targeting
Perform advanced data wrangling, SQL scripting, and transformation tasks across large, complex datasets
Apply statistical techniques and modelling to identify trends, forecast outcomes, and support optimisation initiatives
Ensure data accuracy and integrity through validation rules, QA processes, and source-to-report consistency checks
Collaborate with Data Engineers and Scientists to evolve our tooling and infrastructure
Evolve into advanced analytics / data science topics (e.g., predictive modelling, experimentation, ML enablement)


How You Become Part Of The Race


Master’s degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a closely related technical field; please attach diploma
:3–5 years of experience in analytics-heavy roles (e.g. Consultant, Data Analyst, …) with direct technical ownership; please attach references if available
Expert-level SQL and comfort working with cloud platforms (e.g. BigQuery, GCP)
Proficiency in Python or R for scripting, modelling, or data transformation
Experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, Power BI) and web analytics (GA4, Adobe, etc.)
Strong understanding of data structures, ETL concepts, and data integration workflows
Sharp analytical thinking, structured problem solving, and a bias for clean, repeatable solutions


HIGHLIGHTS ON YOUR CANYON TOUR

The Canyon Crew 

In our global team, we combine energy and transparency and promote a feedback culture as well as Canyon events, along with inspiring crew rides. Welcome to a career that is more than just a job! 

Feel Canyon  

Unlock your passion for cycling with us! Enjoy exclusive discounts on bikes, gear, and apparel as part of our commitment to fueling your cycling journey. 

Compensation 

Experience a rewarding career with a competitive market-based salary, generous paid time off and we contribute to your private pension scheme as we care for your future. Your satisfaction is our priority as we build a thriving work environment together. 

Working Model 

Join us for a career that prioritizes life-work integration through flexible and hybrid work options. Experience a family-friendly environment where balance is not just a goal but a way of professional life. 

Working Culture 

Be part of our journey in creating an inclusive workplace where your voice matters. Your well-being is our highest priority and together with you we unlock the Canyon spirit. 

Job Variety 

Explore a diverse career path with us, where you can delve into various departments with operational, strategic, creative, or technical roles. Experience a wide range of job opportunities that consistently challenge and inspire you.  

Impact 

Embark on a career shaping the future of mobility in a global environment. Join us as we prioritize innovation, fun and sustainability, always putting our customers first, with the shared goal of building the best bikes for a forward-thinking world.

Title: Data analist
Description:
Als Data analist bij Incentro speel je een sleutelrol binnen onze Data Solutions-cel, bestaande uit 40+ data experts. Samen helpen we klanten zoals PostNL, Bol, Simon Loos en Veiligheidsregio’s met hun data-uitdagingen.




Je bent de schakel tussen business & IT en zet je analytische skills in om waardevolle inzichten en visuele dashboards te creëren. Je werkt met on-premise en cloud data warehouses en BI-tools binnen AWS, GCP en Azure om data te verzamelen, verwerken en visualiseren.




Wat ga je doen

🔹 Gegevens verzamelen, analyseren en interpreteren om trends en patronen te ontdekken.

🔹 SQL gebruiken om databronnen voor te bereiden en datamodellen en dashboards te ontwikkelen.

🔹 Klanten adviseren over data-gedreven strategieën en optimalisaties met data-analyses en visualisaties.

🔹 Ondersteunen bij het embedden van dashboards en de eerste stappen richting self-service BI.




Je werkt samen met een multidisciplinair team van engineers, architecten en analisten. Samen modelleer je logische datamodellen op basis van gegevens uit lokale databases en cloud-omgevingen (AWS, GCP, Azure). Vervolgens presenteer je heldere dashboards en data-storytelling met verschillende BI-tools.




Altijd in ontwikkeling

Bij Incentro blijf je groeien! Met een onbeperkt opleidingsbudget behaal je certificaten, vergroot je je expertise en deel je kennis via MeetUps en kennissessies. Je persoonlijke field manager helpt je bij je professionele ontwikkeling en carrièrepad.




Wie ben jij?

✅ 3+ jaar ervaring als Data-analist of BI-analist

✅ Ervaring met BI-tools zoals Amazon QuickSight, Power BI, Looker (Studio) of Tableau

✅ Sterke SQL-skills (pre als je ervaring hebt met Python en/of R)

✅ Ervaring met cloud platforms (Azure, AWS en/of GCP is een pre)

✅ Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal is essentieel voor deze functie




Wij bieden jou

een vast contract bij de start
de mogelijkheid om 32u tot 40u per week te werken
een salaris tussen de €3.500,- & €5.000,- + 8% vakantiegeld
een onbeperkt opleidingsbudget, zónder studieschuld
een elektrische leaseauto naar keuze of een extra €520,- bruto én km-vergoeding
een NS-Business Card voor je zakelijke reizen (én prive reizen, indien je geen gebruik maakt van een leaseauto)
27 vakantiedagen, 10 bij te kopen, vrije invulling religieuze vakantiedagen
een premievrij-pensioen
elke 4 jaar €2.250,- budget to pick-your-own laptop & gear
de mogelijkheid om aandeelhouder worden (en zo samen met 150+ andere collega's mede-eigenaar te zijn van Incentro)
mastery money: een jaarlijkse uitkering van €650 om jouw potentieel te ontketenen. Jij kiest wat jou helpt om het beste uit jezelf te halen: een cursus Spaans, een vakantie of nieuwe hardloopschoenen. It’s up to you!
maandelijkse onkosten- & sportvergoeding en een tegemoetkoming voor het inrichten van je thuiswerkplek
een team waar serieuze aandacht is voor diversiteit & inclusiviteit en waar je ondersteunt wordt bij zowel fysieke als mentale gezondheid.
Show more
HTML:
Als Data analist bij Incentro speel je een sleutelrol binnen onze Data Solutions-cel, bestaande uit 40+ data experts. Samen helpen we klanten zoals PostNL, Bol, Simon Loos en Veiligheidsregio’s met hun data-uitdagingen.


Je bent de schakel tussen business & IT en zet je analytische skills in om waardevolle inzichten en visuele dashboards te creëren. Je werkt met on-premise en cloud data warehouses en BI-tools binnen AWS, GCP en Azure om data te verzamelen, verwerken en visualiseren.


Wat ga je doen

🔹 Gegevens verzamelen, analyseren en interpreteren om trends en patronen te ontdekken.

🔹 SQL gebruiken om databronnen voor te bereiden en datamodellen en dashboards te ontwikkelen.

🔹 Klanten adviseren over data-gedreven strategieën en optimalisaties met data-analyses en visualisaties.

🔹 Ondersteunen bij het embedden van dashboards en de eerste stappen richting self-service BI.


Je werkt samen met een multidisciplinair team van engineers, architecten en analisten. Samen modelleer je logische datamodellen op basis van gegevens uit lokale databases en cloud-omgevingen (AWS, GCP, Azure). Vervolgens presenteer je heldere dashboards en data-storytelling met verschillende BI-tools.


Altijd in ontwikkeling

Bij Incentro blijf je groeien! Met een onbeperkt opleidingsbudget behaal je certificaten, vergroot je je expertise en deel je kennis via MeetUps en kennissessies. Je persoonlijke field manager helpt je bij je professionele ontwikkeling en carrièrepad.


Wie ben jij?

✅ 3+ jaar ervaring als Data-analist of BI-analist

✅ Ervaring met BI-tools zoals Amazon QuickSight, Power BI, Looker (Studio) of Tableau

✅ Sterke SQL-skills (pre als je ervaring hebt met Python en/of R)

✅ Ervaring met cloud platforms (Azure, AWS en/of GCP is een pre)

✅ Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal is essentieel voor deze functie


Wij bieden jou

  • een vast contract bij de start
  • de mogelijkheid om 32u tot 40u per week te werken
  • een salaris tussen de €3.500,- & €5.000,- + 8% vakantiegeld
  • een onbeperkt opleidingsbudget, zónder studieschuld
  • een elektrische leaseauto naar keuze of een extra €520,- bruto én km-vergoeding
  • een NS-Business Card voor je zakelijke reizen (én prive reizen, indien je geen gebruik maakt van een leaseauto)
  • 27 vakantiedagen, 10 bij te kopen, vrije invulling religieuze vakantiedagen
  • een premievrij-pensioen
  • elke 4 jaar €2.250,- budget to pick-your-own laptop & gear
  • de mogelijkheid om aandeelhouder worden (en zo samen met 150+ andere collega's mede-eigenaar te zijn van Incentro)
  • mastery money: een jaarlijkse uitkering van €650 om jouw potentieel te ontketenen. Jij kiest wat jou helpt om het beste uit jezelf te halen: een cursus Spaans, een vakantie of nieuwe hardloopschoenen. It’s up to you!
  • maandelijkse onkosten- & sportvergoeding en een tegemoetkoming voor het inrichten van je thuiswerkplek
  • een team waar serieuze aandacht is voor diversiteit & inclusiviteit en waar je ondersteunt wordt bij zowel fysieke als mentale gezondheid.

Title: Retail Data Analyst
Description:
Discover a world where we empower frontline teams, optimise retail operations, and innovate to create seamless shop experiences for our customers in Retail Operations & Training.

Share your talents

As our new Retail Data Analyst, you’ll play a crucial role in driving commercial performance by turning data into clear, actionable insights. Through your work, you'll help shape decisions across commercial programs, sales, and operational planning—making a tangible impact on our Retail business.

You have a passion for transforming complex data into simple, compelling stories. Whether you’re diving into country-level KPIs, analyzing training or promotions, or advising internal teams on dashboarding solutions, your insights will directly influence strategic actions across our Retail markets. Strong project management and stakeholder engagement skills will be essential, as you’ll either lead or support key initiatives, always working alongside a collaborative and ambitious team.

In This Role You Shine By


Analyzing and preparing data from PowerBI to uncover trends, relationships, and opportunities for improvement.
Translating insights into clear summaries and dashboards tailored to a non-technical audience.
Evaluating retail performance (e.g., campaigns, commercial moments and events, short shelf-time items) and share actionable recommendations to steer future- and interim results.
Deep diving into key topics affecting shop floor performance and retail programs.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to align on forecasting, stock levels, promotions, innovations, and long-term planning.
Continuously optimizing and supporting the reporting processes for accuracy, transparency, and impact.


Bring all of you

High on energy, low on ego, and with lots of humor. You’re hands-on, proactive, and driven by both your own success and that of your team. You combine a brand-first mindset with a data-driven approach, contributing to the growth of Rituals as an iconic well-being brand.


2–5 years experience in a retail environment is essential
Strong stakeholder management skills—building trust, aligning priorities, and communicating clearly across teams and partners.
Solid project management capabilities—planning, prioritizing, and driving initiatives forward independently and in a team.
High attention to detail and accuracy, with a strong numeric and analytical skill set.
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment.
A proactive, hands-on mentality and a structured way of working.
Excellent written and spoken communication skills in English.
Comfort navigating change, ambiguity, and business challenges with optimism and resilience.


About The Team

Together with 7 colleagues you are part of our young and ambitious Retail Commercial Development Team which is part of the bigger Retail & Training team at our Central Head office in Amsterdam. Our team consist of a fun mix of people with various backgrounds and areas of expertise. We all have a huge sense of commitment, we love to connect with each other, exchange ideas and knowledge.

Rituals offers a challenging role in an eager and diverse team, where empowering your colleagues (and vice versa) is part of the deal. Although our proposition encompasses attractive benefits and a compensation package, the international scope and impact of the position may appeal to you even more. You will spend (quite some of) your time at our Amsterdam HQ. We hope you can appreciate the view of one of the most iconic Amsterdam canals.

The Next Steps


Our recruiter will contact you within 10 working days
First interview with the Hiring Manager follows
Online assessment
A second interview with Team Members
In the event of a positive outcome, you will receive a proposal with the terms of employment


If you have any questions, reach out to Camilla at camilla.milson@rituals.com. Please note, applications via email will not be accepted.

Benefits of working at Rituals


Training, coaching & development opportunities
Staff discount on Rituals products
Attractive bonus
Numerous health & wellbeing initiatives
Company & team events
Show more

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Job Description - Data Quality Analyst

About the Role

We are looking for a Data Quality Analyst (DQA) to join a leading international financial services organization. The role is based in Amsterdam and reports directly to the Head of Data and Valuation Management.
As a DQA, you will play a critical role in ensuring the integrity, governance, and quality of data across core information systems. This position is both client-facing and internally focused, contributing to client onboarding, process improvements, and stakeholder collaboration.

Responsibilities

Own and monitor the data architecture and ensure ongoing data quality across systems.
Measure and maintain data quality standards in alignment with governance requirements.
Act as a facilitator between internal stakeholders and external market participants, including vendor management.
Contribute to both client-driven and internal projects, driving process improvements and efficiencies.
Maintain and develop the Data Governance framework and oversee the Data Dictionary.
Support client-facing activities, including onboarding new clients and handling queries from existing clients.

Requirements

Must-Have Skills & Experience:

2+ years' experience in data structuring, data models, and governance frameworks.
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Finance, Economics, or Business Administration.
Strong technical skills in Excel; knowledge of Visual Basic and SQL is an advantage.
Strong organizational skills with the ability to work independently.
Excellent stakeholder management skills, with the ability to build relationships locally and internationally.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Fluency in Dutch and English (both written and spoken).
Nice-to-Have Skills:
Knowledge of investment strategies, reporting systems, and investment procedures.
Experience with SimCorp Dimension or Bloomberg.
Understanding of performance and risk analysis methodologies.
French language skills (advantageous).

Contract & Benefits

Contract type: Permanent

Hours: 40 hours per week (full-time)

Location: Amsterdam

Additional benefits:

Participation in discretionary performance bonus
Full employer contribution to pension
Net home working allowance + internet allowance
28 + 1 holiday days, with option to buy additional hours
International working environment with strong collaboration culture
Modern office in central Amsterdam with supportive colleagues

Hiring Process & Timeline

Two-stage interview process.
Interviews expected to begin in early September (hiring manager returns 3rd September).
Target start date: October-November 2025 (flexible).




Desired Skills and Experience

Data Quality

Data Governance

Data Modeling

Data Architecture

Data Management

Data Analysis

Data Dictionary

SQL

Excel

Visual Basic (VBA)

SimCorp Dimension (if applicable)

Bloomberg Terminal (if applicable)

Reporting & Analytics



Venquis is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.
