Responsibilities:

  • Collect, analyze, and interpret data to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that inform our business strategies
  • Build, maintain, and automate dashboards and reports to track KPIs, including ROAS, CPA, conversion rates, CLTV, and customer retention metrics
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams, such as marketing, product, and finance, to provide data-driven insights that support campaign performance and strategic marketing decisions
  • Provide ad hoc analysis to address specific business questions
  • Ensure data quality and accuracy by regularly validating and cleansing datasets
  • Communicate findings effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through reports, presentations, and storytelling

Qualifications:

  • Proven experience in data analysis, preferably with a focus on e-commerce
  • Proficiency in SQL and Excel
  • Proven experience in data visualization tools (e.g. Looker Data Studio, Looker, Power BI or similar)
  • Hands-on experience with cloud-based data warehouses and architectures (familiarity with Google BigQuery is a strong asset)
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
  • Effective communicator with the ability to convey complex data insights clearly

What will set you apart:

  • You have a genuine hunger for success in all parts of your life
  • You thrive taking action, taking responsibility and getting things done before deadlines
  • You’re able to self-manage based upon the overall scope and work required
  • You’re able to diagnose and solve technical problems quickly
  • You're able to work as part of a team and actively contribute to conversations
  • A willingness to learn and grow with the business

CVs should be in English

Powered by JazzHR

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Immediate Joiners Preferred !!




About Designit:

Hello, we’re Designit. We are a 30yr old global strategic design firm, part of the Wipro family. From our roots in Denmark, we grew across Scandinavia, driven by the values and principles of Nordic design. As one of the world’s largest strategic design firms, we help our clients across numerous sectors to create products, services, and experiences that improve the way we all live, work, and do business. Our studio is Bangalore is part of the global Designit team of 700+ creative-strategists across 20 locations. From here we collaborate to create innovations, launch initiatives, and engage the world for our clients. We absolutely fundamentally believe that we’re better together. Whether you’re an intern or a senior, everyone has their own ideas, perspective and passion to bring to the mix. Come meet our teams, see what we’re working on, and explore life in our offices (and wfh!).




Are you passionate about data and analytics, and eager to drive business value through actionable insights? Do you thrive in dynamic environments and love turning complex data into clear, impactful solutions?

We’re looking for an exceptional Data Scientist to join the team in Copenhagen. You will play a pivotal role in our Customer Insights initiatives, helping us understand customer behaviours and enhance decision-making across the organization.

Would you like to…

Lead and steer data tracks of projects, conducting exploratory data analysis (EDA) to uncover trends and insights within large datasets
Develop and maintain AI-driven codebases, including predictive models, classification algorithms, and clustering techniques
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to seamlessly integrate AI and data science solutions into business operations
Provide BI expertise by creating and maintaining dashboards using tools like PowerBI
Translate complex data findings into clear, concise, and actionable insights for stakeholders at all levels of the organization
Develop and implement data models to support business intelligence and reporting initiatives

We would like you to be…

Highly proficient in SQL and PySpark, with experience in data modeling for business intelligence
Experienced in traditional Machine Learning projects, including predictive modeling, classification, and clustering
Skilled in Python for data analytics, with the ability to implement and optimize models
Hands-on with Databricks or Dremio for large-scale data processing and analysis
Strong in data visualization, particularly with PowerBI or similar dashboarding tools
Familiar with Natural Language Processing (NLP) concepts and their application in customer insights (a plus)

Would you like to join…

A team that values creativity, collaboration, and continuous learning
An environment where your insights directly impact business decisions and customer satisfaction
A culture that encourages innovation and the sharing of ideas




Want to know more?

Check out our open jobs around the world.

https://www.designit.com/

Designit is committed to ensuring that all candidates have an equal opportunity to be considered for employment. Please let us know if you need any reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Turn data into insights that drive smarter decisions across a global organization

Are you passionate about transforming data into business value? Join our Global IT team and help shape how BioMar uses data to inform decisions and drive strategic progress across our global organization. Your work will bring clarity to complex questions and help colleagues make better decisions every day.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to support our journey toward becoming a more data-driven organization. You’ll play a key role in unlocking the full potential of our BI platform, BioMetrics, built on Microsoft Azure and using Tableau for reporting and visualization. BioMetrics connects people with the data they need to move the business forward.

At BioMar, the role of Data Analyst is titled IT Solution Lead, and this will be your official title once you join us.

Make a difference in how we turn business questions into actionable answers

In this role, your focus will be on delivering the right data in clear, interactive dashboards and reports that bring business matters into sharp focus. By designing BI solutions that are not just informative but truly actionable, you’ll help colleagues quickly grasp key insights and take the right steps to move the business forward.


Partner with colleagues across the business to understand and translate their needs into data requirements
Design and maintain insightful dashboards, reports, and visualizations using Tableau or similar tools
Use strong problem-solving skills to work through complex business challenges and data
Improve reporting processes and ensure data quality across our BI platform
Align BI products with strategic goals and business value


Bring your experience and curiosity to build better data solutions

You are someone who thrives in complexity, takes ownership, and enjoys working closely with diverse colleagues. You know that successful BI is about more than just numbers - it’s about making things easier to understand, easier to act on, and more impactful. You are proactive, structured, and committed to continuous improvement.


At least 5 years of experience working with data and BI in a professional setting
Hands-on experience with Tableau or similar tools, as well as SQL and Azure-based environments
A structured communicator who can work with both technical and non-technical colleagues
A relevant academic degree in IT, Business Intelligence, Computer Science, or similar
Fluent in written and spoken English; Spanish is a plus, but not required


Be part of a collaborative, forward-thinking environment

At BioMar, innovation and collaboration are at the heart of everything we do. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to influence how data is used across our global company - and help us meet our mission of advancing sustainable aquaculture.

You’ll work with dedicated professionals across disciplines and regions in a supportive environment that values learning and initiative. We offer flexibility, professional development, and a chance to make your mark on a company with purpose.

Ready to apply or have questions?

We look forward to hearing from you. If you have any questions about the position, feel free to reach out to our HR Business Partner, Emilie Louise Svenning, on +45 2065 2997. The application process is ongoing, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. Please include your CV when applying.

About BioMar

More than half of the seafood consumed globally comes from aquaculture. At BioMar, we are committed to developing and delivering efficient, sustainable, and healthy aquaculture feed solutions. Innovation and partnerships are at the heart of everything we do, and we are proud that our highly skilled people share this commitment. With feed factories in 13 countries across 4 continents, we supply feed to over 90 countries, supporting more than 45 different species of fish and shrimp. Join us on our journey to innovate aquaculture.

Powered by Partnership. Driven by Innovation.
Show more

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you thrive at the intersection of data and strategy? Are you excited about turning complex analytics into impactful marketing insights? Then you might be our new Marketing Data Analyst, ready to join our dynamic and international marketing team!

First, who on earth is Dalux?

Dalux is an innovative Contech company committed to push the boundaries of how technology can secure a smarter and more efficient construction and real estate industry. Today we provide our user-friendly digital tools and BIM Technology (3D information models) to leading contractors and advisors in more than 147 countries. And we are not slowing down our expansion journey anytime soon, so this is a great time to join us and directly influence the future of Dalux! Today we are present in 24 countries and counting, and therefore this is a great time to join us, and directly influence the future of Dalux!

Awesome! But what will my new role be?

In this role, you’ll work at the intersection of data and marketing, analyzing and interpreting data from a wide variety of marketing channels such as ads, social media, website performance, webinars, events, and more. Your insights will drive decision-making, shape marketing strategies, and optimize performance across the organization.

Your responsibilities will include:


Collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data from various marketing sources (e.g., Google Analytics, Google Ads, social platforms, events, webinars).
Developing and maintaining dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, SQL, and Access.
Providing actionable insights to optimize campaign performance and achieve marketing goals.
Collaborating with Performance Marketing and other teams (Content, Events, Commercial Revenue Operations) to align on data-driven strategies.
Monitoring and reporting on KPIs, campaign ROI, and trends to guide both short-term and long-term planning.
Identifying areas of opportunity and proposing data-informed strategies for growth and efficiency.


Sure, sounds exciting! How can I be considered for this role?

You have +5 years of experience in marketing data analysis or a related field, with proficiency in Power BI, SQL, and Microsoft Access. Strong knowledge of Google Analytics and Google Ads dashboards, as well as analytical and problem-solving skills, are essential. Experience visualizing data for non-technical stakeholders and strong collaboration skills are also key.

Preferred qualifications include experience in performance marketing or commercial revenue operations, familiarity with A/B testing, and additional data visualization tools.

If you’re collaborative, curious, and eager to learn, you’ll thrive in our supportive and creative environment.

Why Choose Dalux?

At Dalux, we care—not just about our work and customers but about each other. We believe in creating a work environment that is light-hearted, informal, and welcoming, with room for everyone. Forget fancy titles and rigid dress codes; we’re here to make your work life both rewarding and enjoyable.

At our HQ in Østerbro, you’ll join a team of 17 skilled colleagues dedicated to driving high customer engagement. Networking with our users is our passion, and we deliver great content, engaging events, and cutting-edge ConTech insights.

Being part of a social company, you’ll also enjoy activities like wine tasting, running club, knitting club, and more. At Dalux, your personal and professional growth is important to us.

Application deadline:

As soon as possible

Title: Analysts/Senior Analysts | EY-Parthenon Data & Analytics
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At EY, we’re all in to shape your future with confidence.

We’ll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.

Join EY and help to build a better working world.

Are you passionate about understanding what drives business performance, the latest technology, and M&A? Are you excited about finding new and innovative ways to solve problems? With Data & Analytics team you will have the opportunity to be part of a new wave of business analytics within the world of M&A, helping our clients get to faster and deeper insights than ever before.

Your new role as Analyst/Senior Analyst

As part of the EY-Parthenon Data & Analytics team you will help our clients uncover the key drivers behind their businesses by building new solutions, analysing structured and unstructured datasets and bridging the gap between business and technology. Whether you are working with a private equity client looking to sell a portfolio company or guiding a corporate client through their first ever acquisition – no project is ever the same and every transaction presents its own unique set of challenges and analyses.

The one area that will be consistent throughout is the use of data driven solutions to analyse large and complex datasets – building sophisticated transaction driven analyses to help address our clients’ challenges in fast-changing markets. The central driver of the Data & Analytics group is a constant ambition to improve the M&A process, recognizing the significant untapped value that sits in the ever-growing volume of data our world is generating.

You will be a part of a Nordic-wide team, a group with a diverse set of backgrounds including data science, engineering, finance, and accounting (amongst others). You will have the opportunity to work on projects across the Nordic countries, as well as abroad, working side by side with talented and driven colleagues who will give you the support and guidance to succeed from day one.

Your Skills & Qualifications

We’re looking for enthusiastic analysts and senior analysts who thrive in fast-paced, dynamic environments, eager to combine technical and financial expertise to foster innovation and deliver valuable insights to our clients. To excel in this role, we imagine you have:


A recent degree or up to 4 years of postgraduate experience.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
A passion for continuous learning and staying on top of emerging technology trends.
An analytical mindset and enjoy tackling complex challenges.
The ability to collaborate effectively within diverse teams, embracing colleagues from a wide range of technical and personal backgrounds.
Experience or interest in data modelling, processing and visualization using tools such as Python, R, SQL, Power BI and/or Tableau.
Familiarity with Microsoft Fabric, Snowflake, Databricks, AI/ML, Git, or Cloud technology is a plus, though not required.


We welcome talented individuals of all genders and backgrounds and are committed to creating an environment where everyone can thrive.

What We Offer

At EY we put our colleagues at the centre, where you will have the ability to have a large impact on developing your career based on your own personal interests and goals – regardless of whether that includes industries and clients or developing your knowledge within specifics tools, technologies, and areas. On top of this you will receive opportunities to get involved in our exciting projects such as volunteer work, recruiting, and engagement with our student relations teams.

Feel free to read more about what EY can offer via our career page, on social media and on our career blog.

Sounds interesting?

Send your CV, cover letter and university transcript. Selections and interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis.

If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Mathias Gade at +45 2529 4545.

To help create an equitable and inclusive experience during the recruitment process, please inform us as soon as possible about any disability-related adjustments or accommodations you may need.

EY | Building a better working world

EY is building a better working world by creating new value for clients, people, society and the planet, while building trust in capital markets.

Enabled by data, AI and advanced technology, EY teams help clients shape the future with confidence and develop answers for the most pressing issues of today and tomorrow.

EY teams work across a full spectrum of services in assurance, consulting, tax, strategy and transactions. Fueled by sector insights, a globally connected, multi-disciplinary network and diverse ecosystem partners, EY teams can provide services in more than 150 countries and territories.
Show more

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are Is What We Do.

Deel is the all-in-one payroll and HR platform for global teams. Our vision is to unlock global opportunity for every person, team, and business. Built for the way the world works today, Deel combines HRIS, payroll, compliance, benefits, performance, and equipment management into one seamless platform. With AI-powered tools and a fully owned payroll infrastructure, Deel supports every worker type in 150+ countries—helping businesses scale smarter, faster, and more compliantly.

Among the largest globally distributed companies in the world, our team of 6,000 spans more than 100 countries, speaks 74 languages, and brings a connected and dynamic culture that drives continuous learning and innovation for our customers.

Why should you be part of our success story?

As the fastest-growing Software as a Service (SaaS) company in history, Deel is transforming how global talent connects with world-class companies – breaking down borders that have traditionally limited both hiring and career opportunities. We're not just building software; we're creating the infrastructure for the future of work, enabling a more diverse and inclusive global economy. In 2024 alone, we paid $11.2 billion to workers in nearly 100 currencies and provided healthcare and benefits to workers in 109 countries—ensuring people get paid and protected, no matter where they are.

Our momentum is reflected in our achievements and customer satisfaction: CNBC Disruptor 50, Forbes Cloud 100, Deloitte Fast 500, and repeated recognition on Y Combinator’s top companies list – all while maintaining a 4.83 average rating from 15,000 reviews across G2, Trustpilot, Captera, Apple and Google.

Your experience at Deel will be a career accelerator. At the forefront of the global work revolution, you'll tackle complex challenges that impact millions of people's working lives. With our momentum—backed by a $12 billion valuation and $1 B in Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) in just over five years—you'll drive meaningful impact while building expertise that makes you a sought-after leader in the transformation of global work.

Responsibilities


Collaborate closely with Product Managers, Product Operations and Dev teams on different problems to create actionable insights
Monitor product and feature release performance, define baselines, success metrics and provide recommendations for optimisation
Develop/apply extensive domain knowledge in your dedicated product areas in order to proactively derive meaningful recommendations and insights that drive and inform product strategy
Analyze market data, identify customer behavior and trends
Help design and evaluate A/B tests to improve customer journeys
Create and promote effective self-service analytics infrastructure for your product areas
Develop user friendly dashboards and high quality data visualizations that drive actions and support decision making
Explore large and complex datasets to create actionable insights
Build data models in dbt with the support of Analytics Engineers to create the cleanest data structures and KPIs for your product areas
Make intelligent choices for the adoption of new technologies based on your extensive experience
Contribute to the development and growth of fellow product analysts by proactively sharing knowledge, providing mentoring, etc.


Qualifications


Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Economics or equivalent degree
5+ years’ experience in product analytics team
Hands on experience in at least one modern BI tools (preferably Looker)
Proficiency in SQL and product analytics tools (mixpanel / heap / amplitude)
Solid experience with Data Modelling (DBT)
Excellent multitasking and problem-solving abilities
Effective communication skills and experience dealing with stakeholders of varying seniority
Experience with Snowflake and LookML is a plus


Total Rewards

Our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all.

Some things you’ll enjoy


Stock grant opportunities dependent on your role, employment status and location
Additional perks and benefits based on your employment status and country
The flexibility of remote work, including optional WeWork access


At Deel, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that values diversity and positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of race, religion, sex, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy or maternity or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Unless otherwise agreed, we will communicate with job applicants using Deel-specific emails, which include @deel.com and other acquired company emails like @payspace.com and @paygroup.com. You can view the most up-to-date job listings at Deel by visitingour careers page.

Deel is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects different abilities, backgrounds, beliefs, experiences, identities and perspectives.

Deel will provide accommodation on request throughout the recruitment, selection and assessment process for applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodation, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team at recruiting@deel.com of the nature of the accommodation that you may require, to ensure your equal participation.

We use Covey as part of our hiring and/or promotional processes. As part of the evaluation process, we provide Covey with job requirements and candidate-submitted applications. HTML:
Who We Are Is What We Do.

Deel is the all-in-one payroll and HR platform for global teams. Our vision is to unlock global opportunity for every person, team, and business. Built for the way the world works today, Deel combines HRIS, payroll, compliance, benefits, performance, and equipment management into one seamless platform. With AI-powered tools and a fully owned payroll infrastructure, Deel supports every worker type in 150+ countries—helping businesses scale smarter, faster, and more compliantly.

Among the largest globally distributed companies in the world, our team of 6,000 spans more than 100 countries, speaks 74 languages, and brings a connected and dynamic culture that drives continuous learning and innovation for our customers.

Why should you be part of our success story?

As the fastest-growing Software as a Service (SaaS) company in history, Deel is transforming how global talent connects with world-class companies – breaking down borders that have traditionally limited both hiring and career opportunities. We're not just building software; we're creating the infrastructure for the future of work, enabling a more diverse and inclusive global economy. In 2024 alone, we paid $11.2 billion to workers in nearly 100 currencies and provided healthcare and benefits to workers in 109 countries—ensuring people get paid and protected, no matter where they are.

Our momentum is reflected in our achievements and customer satisfaction: CNBC Disruptor 50, Forbes Cloud 100, Deloitte Fast 500, and repeated recognition on Y Combinator’s top companies list – all while maintaining a 4.83 average rating from 15,000 reviews across G2, Trustpilot, Captera, Apple and Google.

Your experience at Deel will be a career accelerator. At the forefront of the global work revolution, you'll tackle complex challenges that impact millions of people's working lives. With our momentum—backed by a $12 billion valuation and $1 B in Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) in just over five years—you'll drive meaningful impact while building expertise that makes you a sought-after leader in the transformation of global work.

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate closely with Product Managers, Product Operations and Dev teams on different problems to create actionable insights
  • Monitor product and feature release performance, define baselines, success metrics and provide recommendations for optimisation
  • Develop/apply extensive domain knowledge in your dedicated product areas in order to proactively derive meaningful recommendations and insights that drive and inform product strategy
  • Analyze market data, identify customer behavior and trends
  • Help design and evaluate A/B tests to improve customer journeys
  • Create and promote effective self-service analytics infrastructure for your product areas
  • Develop user friendly dashboards and high quality data visualizations that drive actions and support decision making
  • Explore large and complex datasets to create actionable insights
  • Build data models in dbt with the support of Analytics Engineers to create the cleanest data structures and KPIs for your product areas
  • Make intelligent choices for the adoption of new technologies based on your extensive experience
  • Contribute to the development and growth of fellow product analysts by proactively sharing knowledge, providing mentoring, etc.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Economics or equivalent degree
  • 5+ years’ experience in product analytics team
  • Hands on experience in at least one modern BI tools (preferably Looker)
  • Proficiency in SQL and product analytics tools (mixpanel / heap / amplitude)
  • Solid experience with Data Modelling (DBT)
  • Excellent multitasking and problem-solving abilities
  • Effective communication skills and experience dealing with stakeholders of varying seniority
  • Experience with Snowflake and LookML is a plus

Total Rewards

Our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all.

Some things you’ll enjoy

  • Stock grant opportunities dependent on your role, employment status and location
  • Additional perks and benefits based on your employment status and country
  • The flexibility of remote work, including optional WeWork access

At Deel, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that values diversity and positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of race, religion, sex, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy or maternity or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Unless otherwise agreed, we will communicate with job applicants using Deel-specific emails, which include @deel.com and other acquired company emails like @payspace.com and @paygroup.com. You can view the most up-to-date job listings at Deel by visitingour careers page.

Deel is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects different abilities, backgrounds, beliefs, experiences, identities and perspectives.

Deel will provide accommodation on request throughout the recruitment, selection and assessment process for applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodation, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team at recruiting@deel.com of the nature of the accommodation that you may require, to ensure your equal participation.

Certain features of the platform may qualify it as an Automated Employment Decision Tool (AEDT) under applicable regulations. Title: Data Analyst – Business Improvement
Place: Esbjerg, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to be a part of a dedicated team working with Business Improvements across of Semco Maritime? Do you have a solid understanding of data, and do you have what it takes to match this with business needs? Do you want to work in a dynamic organizational setting, where every day is different? If so, we want to hear from you!

Your position

In your new position as Data Analyst in the Business Improvement department, you will be a valuable member of a dynamic team working with business improvements through digital transformation. You will work closely together with the business and develop needed digital improvements supporting Semco’s growth strategy.

Your place of work will be in Esbjerg, Denmark. The position is full-time, and you can expect Attendance at our office in Esbjerg on daily basis.

We are a team where a mindset for continuous improvement and optimization are key. As well as being agile towards supporting the business needs.

Your Tasks & Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst, you will be part of a team developing the needed digital data tools supporting Semco Maritime growth.

Your Tasks Will Include But Are Not Limited To


Support the organization with ad-hoc data analyses
Operational automation of manual workflows
Management of individual stakeholder needs
Maintenance of existing portfolio of solutions


Your Profile & Qualifications

We are looking for a newly graduated with relevant education, with solid understanding of data. It will be beneficial if you have knowledge of the entire Microsoft Power Platform like Power BI, Power apps, Power Automate etc.

You have a great overview, the ability to see the big picture, a structured approach, and are a team player.

You find it easy to work independently and take the initiative. You have drive and are motivated by a fast-track environment. You have a positive mindset and care deeply about the success of your work, your colleagues and the wider objectives set by the organization. You are able to communicate with others on a good and efficient basis and engage in the development of the department.

We expect you to have excellent written and verbal communication skills in Danish and English.

Technical Skills Knowledge of or basic understanding of concepts relating to the Microsoft power platform

MS Power Platform


MS Power Automate – Not mandatory, but beneficial
MS Power BI – Intermediate or above average.
MS Power Apps


Other Relevant Skills


SQL – basic
Excel incl. Power Query and VBA Coding


Welcome to Semco Maritime

At Semco Maritime, we create change. For people. For projects. And for the global energy sector. With us, you will join a community of over 2,500 of the most dedicated thinkers and doers in the energy industry who are driving real change and making their own personal mark on the global energy landscape.

While everyone knows why the energy transition is vital, we are concerned with the journey. How to get there. By providing the answers needed to make change real. Because we believe that global energy ambitions can only be realized through hard work and clever pragmatic solutions. This is what we do. This is what we invite you to participate in.

Safety is at the core of everything we do, and we are committed to protecting our people, partners, and the planet as we work towards a sustainable energy future.

So yes, working for us will change the energy sector – and may well change you too.

Care to join the movement?

Change. With us.
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Aiming for new heights

At Scalepoint, we aim for the stars. Our ambition is clear: we want to conquer the world. We successfully help insurers help their customers. We support 26 insurers in five countries around Europe.




We’re on the lookout for a Business Intelligence Analyst who’s eager to turn complex data into clear insights and real business impact. In our BI team, you won’t just be building dashboards—you’ll be shaping how we understand our customers, track our performance, and make decisions.




You’ll join a tight-knit team who live and breathe data, partnering with stakeholders across the company to deliver reporting, analysis, and tools that matter. One day you might be delivering a KPI dashboard for a customer meeting, the next you’re helping Finance ensure invoicing runs flawlessly. Whether it’s deep-dive analysis, data modelling, or enabling self-service reporting, you’ll be right at the heart of it—working closely with our Insights & Reporting Lead, our Head of BI, and our development teams.




What kind of geek are you?

At Scalepoint, you will meet other geeks. They love to go to work – just like you. We’ll be looking forward to working with you if you are a world champion when it comes to:




Analytical mindset

You love making sense of complex data—finding the story in the numbers and turning it into dashboards or reports that spark better decisions, sharper insights, and greater value for both our customers and our business.




Fast learner

New tools and systems don’t scare you—they excite you. You don’t need to know everything we use today, but you have the curiosity and drive to pick it up quickly. You’ll be working with Microsoft Fabric, Power BI, Excel, MSSQL, and whatever new tech helps us get the job done.




Collaborative problem-solver

You thrive in a team setting and see challenges as puzzles to be solved together. Whether you’re working with developers, product managers, or customer-facing teams, you bring your skills, ideas, and a can-do mindset to move projects forward.




What to dive into

At Scalepoint, there’s always room for developing and exploring great ideas. We know it takes high ambitions to conquer the world.

You’re ambitious and full of ideas—and you’ll get the space to put them into action. Working closely with your teammates, you’ll dive into:

Designing and implementing solutions that make end-users self-reliant and confident in using data.
Developing and building BI tools that maximize our team’s impact across the business.
Collaborating directly with customers to understand reporting needs, translate them into practical solutions, and continuously evolve the value we deliver through data.
Driving knowledge sharing so insights and best practices travel across the whole organization.




You must be able to read & write Danish and English. You have preferably worked in a similar role, but most importantly you have something unique to offer and a drive to make a difference at Scalepoint.




Are you ready to jump on our ride? Submit your application and CV now. We will review the applications and conduct interviews continuously.




If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact Head of Business Intelligence, Morten Vang-Pedersen, by phone at +45 27908047




About us

Scalepoint spirit in everyday life

Come as you are. That’s how we prefer it. You can easily leave dress codes, permanent lunch buddies, and corporate business attitudes at home. Our office is filled with kudos and high fives – and we believe that everyone is doing their best.




We have employees from 11 nationalities across our offices in Copenhagen, Poland and Switzerland. 63% of us ride a cycle to work. 42% eat vegetarian meals during lunch. 38% are parents. And 52% don't regularly work out. But our sport and events team tries to keep us moving by offering activities such as climbing, mountain biking, running and padel tennis. However, we cannot change the fact that we have a very generous attitude to sweets and cake. But that’s ok; there's a lot to celebrate at Scalepoint.




We look forward to hearing from you!




Show more

Title: Product Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who We Are Is What We Do.

Deel is the all-in-one payroll and HR platform for global teams. Our vision is to unlock global opportunity for every person, team, and business. Built for the way the world works today, Deel combines HRIS, payroll, compliance, benefits, performance, and equipment management into one seamless platform. With AI-powered tools and a fully owned payroll infrastructure, Deel supports every worker type in 150+ countries—helping businesses scale smarter, faster, and more compliantly.

Among the largest globally distributed companies in the world, our team of 6,000 spans more than 100 countries, speaks 74 languages, and brings a connected and dynamic culture that drives continuous learning and innovation for our customers.

Why should you be part of our success story?

As the fastest-growing Software as a Service (SaaS) company in history, Deel is transforming how global talent connects with world-class companies – breaking down borders that have traditionally limited both hiring and career opportunities. We're not just building software; we're creating the infrastructure for the future of work, enabling a more diverse and inclusive global economy. In 2024 alone, we paid $11.2 billion to workers in nearly 100 currencies and provided healthcare and benefits to workers in 109 countries—ensuring people get paid and protected, no matter where they are.

Our momentum is reflected in our achievements and customer satisfaction: CNBC Disruptor 50, Forbes Cloud 100, Deloitte Fast 500, and repeated recognition on Y Combinator’s top companies list – all while maintaining a 4.83 average rating from 15,000 reviews across G2, Trustpilot, Captera, Apple and Google.

Your experience at Deel will be a career accelerator. At the forefront of the global work revolution, you'll tackle complex challenges that impact millions of people's working lives. With our momentum—backed by a $12 billion valuation and $1 B in Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) in just over five years—you'll drive meaningful impact while building expertise that makes you a sought-after leader in the transformation of global work.

Responsibilities


Collaborate closely with Product Managers, Product Operations and Dev teams on different problems to create actionable insights
Monitor product and feature release performance, define baselines, success metrics and provide recommendations for optimisation
Develop/apply extensive domain knowledge in your dedicated product areas in order to proactively derive meaningful recommendations and insights that drive and inform product strategy
Analyze market data, identify customer behavior and trends
Help design and evaluate A/B tests to improve customer journeys
Create and promote effective self-service analytics infrastructure for your product areas
Develop user friendly dashboards and high quality data visualizations that drive actions and support decision making
Explore large and complex datasets to create actionable insights
Build data models in dbt with the support of Analytics Engineers to create the cleanest data structures and KPIs for your product areas
Make intelligent choices for the adoption of new technologies based on your extensive experience
Contribute to the development and growth of fellow product analysts by proactively sharing knowledge, providing mentoring, etc.


Qualifications


Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Economics or equivalent degree
5+ years’ experience in product analytics team
Hands on experience in at least one modern BI tools (preferably Looker)
Proficiency in SQL and product analytics tools (mixpanel / heap / amplitude)
Solid experience with Data Modelling (DBT)
Excellent multitasking and problem-solving abilities
Effective communication skills and experience dealing with stakeholders of varying seniority
Experience with Snowflake and LookML is a plus


Total Rewards

Our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all.

Some things you’ll enjoy


Stock grant opportunities dependent on your role, employment status and location
Additional perks and benefits based on your employment status and country
The flexibility of remote work, including optional WeWork access


At Deel, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that values diversity and positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of race, religion, sex, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy or maternity or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Unless otherwise agreed, we will communicate with job applicants using Deel-specific emails, which include @deel.com and other acquired company emails like @payspace.com and @paygroup.com. You can view the most up-to-date job listings at Deel by visitingour careers page.

Title: Freelance AI Agent Assistant
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

If you're a professional who works with AI Data Annotation and friendly user of LLMs, Mindrift offers a unique opportunity to apply your editing, annotating, fact-checking and creative skills to an AI training project.

This is a freelance role for a project, and your typical tasks may include:


Conduct high-quality web searches to verify facts, gather supporting data, and cross-check AI responses.
Perform fact-checking and intent verification to ensure AI responses align with the user's goals.
Carefully review and flag any inaccuracies, inconsistencies, or irrelevant answers.
Provide structured feedback on AI-generated content to help improve model performance.
Work effectively with large language models (LLMs), understanding their capabilities and limitations, and applying best practices when interacting with them
Prompt generation with a purpose to receive the best quality result of LLMs


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You are currently enrolled in or completed a Bachelor's degree or higher
You have professional and/or educational experience in data annotation, demonstrate a deeper-than-user-level interest in AI, and possess intellectual breadth and curiosity
You are skilled in web searching, fact-checking, intent-checking, able to work with LLMs and have great attention to detail
Your level of English is upper-intermediate (B2) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

If you're a professional who works with AI Data Annotation and friendly user of LLMs, Mindrift offers a unique opportunity to apply your editing, annotating, fact-checking and creative skills to an AI training project.

  • Conduct high-quality web searches to verify facts, gather supporting data, and cross-check AI responses.

Title: Commercial Data & Analytics Intern
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Bavarian Nordic, we are committed to saving and improving lives by unlocking the power of the immune system. Our commercial product portfolio includes market-leading vaccines against smallpox, mpox, rabies, tick-borne encephalitis, typhoid fever, and cholera. We excel in R&D innovation, manufacturing, and commercialization, striving to improve people's health and quality of life worldwide, protecting our tomorrow. Join us in our mission to make a difference.

As part of our growth journey, we are looking to strengthen the Commercial Operations Team with a full-time Commercial Data & Analytics Intern. The position can be located in either Denmark, Switzerland, or Germany. The role will work in collaboration with the commercial teams to support data analysis and produce and maintain dashboards to track KPIs.

Join our team and let's make a difference together.

Key responsibilities:


Analyze field force and sales performance data to uncover actionable insights
Build, maintain, and enhance Power BI dashboards to improve reporting and transparency
Track SF performance KPIs to support sales managers' activities and improve sales execution
Ensure data consistency and data quality by performing checks and validations
Support the Data & Analytics team with ad hoc analysis and reporting tasks
Respond to data and analysis requests from commercial stakeholders across departments


Qualifications, preferred skills, and experience:


Bachelor’s degree/completion of a Master´s degree in Statistics, Business, Econometrics, Data Analytics, or a related field
Proficiency in Power BI, including data modeling and DAX, and Excel
Comfortable working with large datasets and complex data structures
Familiarity with CRM systems and marketing automation tools is a big plus
Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently
Excellent communication skills and a collaborative mindset
Relevant previous experience is a strong plus


The position is for a min. of 6 months.

We offer the opportunity to work in an international company with unique technology and a dedicated workforce. We welcome people who share our passion with a willingness to make a difference. We offer a dynamic and flexible work environment and an opportunity to develop your personal and academic competencies.

Caught your interest?

If you are ready to take on a pivotal role in a growing organization and drive meaningful change in healthcare, apply now and join Bavarian Nordic in our mission to improve health outcomes and foster sustainable growth.

Founded in 1994, we have +30 years of experience developing life-saving vaccines. We are a global leader in smallpox and mpox vaccines. Our commercial product portfolio contains market-leading vaccines against rabies, tick-borne encephalitis, cholera, typhoid, and Ebola. We are headquartered in Denmark and have manufacturing, research, and sales offices across Europe and North America. Our values – our Bavarian Nordic DNA, as we like to call it – are what guide our actions every day. We act as persistent pioneers, embrace change, value being boosted by the team, and believe in protecting lives every day. If that is also a part of your DNA, we invite you to join us in Bavarian Nordic! Bavarian Nordic is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

www.bavarian-nordic.com
Show more

Title: Associate Consultant – Analytics Engineering (Student Position)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for undergraduates or graduates that want to work on exciting projects, with fantastic colleagues and the newest technologies while providing value by working directly with our clients in cross-functional teams.

Are you our new Associate Consultant within Analytics Engineering?

We are looking for excited, proactive, and curious Associates who want to be part of an exciting journey.

Associate Consultants at Intellishore bear a vital role in our business. From the beginning, you will apply and develop your analytical, interpersonal, and development skills. You will work side by side with skilled consultants and have the opportunity to contribute to a creative company culture where the skills and inputs of all employees are greatly valued. Development is at the core of Intellishore, and we have dedicated plans for each Intellishorian and internal academy sessions for upskilling and knowledge sharing.

We always look for ambitious and caring personalities as we are an office full of people trying to make a difference for customers ranging from Life Science to Retail and Entertainment.

Who is Intellishore?

Intellishore was founded in 2013 with the idea of providing clients with a seamless combination of strategic and technical support. Today, we are more than 80 skilled, entrepreneurial, and passionate employees from many different backgrounds; strategy consultants, engineers, economists, marketers, and data scientist.

We are Intellishorians; a family, a unique collective of very skilled professionals who have jumped at the chance to be part of a larger journey.

What are we looking for in our new Associate?

We realize that you are still learning and need support, but you also need responsibilities that will push you further and develop your skills in the realm of digital transformation. Do not worry about whether you have too much or too little experience. We are always looking for curious and passionate people to join our family, and your title will be matched your level of seniority and expertise.

As You Will Be Supporting Our Experienced Consultants On Multiple Cases, No Day Is The Same, But Here Is What You Can Expect


Work with a team of experienced consultants
Work either with PowerBI, Qlik and other data visualization technologies, or work more with data engineering tools such as dbt, Databricks or Snowflake or even data science and AI depending on your personal interests.
As you develop skills and confidence, you will increase your responsibilities, and we will help you grow by tailoring a career model that urges you to apply the skills you already have and those you will gain at Intellishore
Part-time (Approximately 15-20 hours a week)
Preferably you have approx. two years remaining of your studies but it isn’t an absolute must



What can we offer you?

1 | Challenging projects

Exciting and challenging consultant role in strategic and technical client projects where you have the opportunity to work with different technologies

2 | Entrepreneurial work environment

A dynamic and entrepreneurial environment with ambitious colleagues where you get a lot of experience as an Associate

3 | Exciting industry

Unique opportunity to get a deep insight into the world of AI, Data & Analytics!

4 | Strategic seminars

Strategic seminars (in previous years, we've been to South Africa, Japan, England, Dubai, Iceland, & Germany)

5 | Flexibility

We offer a high level of flexibility in the position for you to balance your studies and work-life

6 | Amazing colleagues

We are a group of friendly people who really like our colleagues and love spending time with each other both at the office or outside of the office

Strategic Seminar

Every year all the Intellishorians leave behind their daily tasks to assemble for the annual Strategic Seminar to experience a change in scenery, strengthen their abilities to work together as a team, and gather inspiration to help set the overall direction of Intellishore and the work we do for our clients.

Just one more time. Why should I join Intellishore?

We are on an exciting journey to change the world of data & analytics. So, if you want to be part of an exciting journey with a bunch of crazy but pretty cool and friendly people, then don't hesitate to reach out. This is the opportunity of a lifetime to be part of something truly remarkable.

Want to know more

If you are interested in applying for this position, fill out the formula below. Applicants will be invited to interviews on a rolling basis.

We acknowledge that a change in career path requires careful consideration and that timing is crucial. Therefore, you are always welcome to reach out as you see fit.

For more information about the position, please reach out to Sofie Freund: sofie.freund@intellishore.dk / +45 93 98 17 27.

At the moment, we are not taking applications from outside of the EU.
Show more

For more information about the position, please reach out to Sofie Freund: sofie.freund@intellishore.dk / +45 93 98 17 27.

At the moment, we are not taking applications from outside of the EU.

Title: Quantitative Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Quantitative Researcher – Energy!




Do you want to apply your quantitative skills to some of the most dynamic and complex markets in the world, and work at a company (40 people) where you can have a REAL impact? Then this could be the role for you!




A leading quant research team is looking for a talented Quantitative Researcher to help design, test, and implement trading strategies in the fast-moving European energy markets with a mission to play a role in the energy transition to cleaner power.




What You’ll Do:

Research & Innovate: Develop and refine systematic trading models for power and gas markets, leveraging both market data and fundamentals.
Analyse Data: Identify patterns and extract signals from large, complex, and often noisy datasets.
Collaborate: Work closely with other researchers and engineers to test ideas, improve strategies, and bring research into production.
Own Your Impact: Take responsibility for the full research cycle – from idea generation, to modelling, to live trading.




The Team:

You’d be joining a modelling team made up of 14 other Quant Researchers and Engineers, all among the best in their field. They come from 8 different countries, and their expertise spans statistics, applied mathematics, economics, and machine learning. It’s a highly collaborative environment where curiosity and rigorous thinking are valued, and where every day is about learning, challenging assumptions, and getting better.




The culture is super flat. There are no layers of management — you’re given ownership, responsibility, and a voice from day one.




What They're Looking For:

PhD in a quantitative field (statistics, applied mathematics, physics, economics, or similar).
Experience in gas or power markets OR in forecasting key energy fundamentals like wind or solar power production or demand
Experience working with large, messy datasets, and building models from them.




What They Offer:

They offer a hybrid set up, with time split between office and home. On top of your base salary, there’s a bonus structure, pension, and benefits such as healthcare. Base salary range is the equivalent of 120–160k euros.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Maternity Cover (7 months)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Scheduling isn't simply filling shifts. It's finding the sweet spot that enables businesses to grow and team members to enjoy the perfect work/life balance.






At Planday from Xero, we aim to use Agentic AI to build a future where managers can seamlessly free up invaluable time for their business and teams. We're not just building software: we're on a mission to make shift work more human, to change work/life balance from a luxury to a reality for all shift workers. We're using advanced technology to help humans reach their full potential. At work and in life.






Founded in 2004, Planday is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark and helps create perfect schedules for hundreds of thousands of users across the world.






As a Data Analyst, you'll be reporting directly to our Head of Data & Analytics and will play a strategic role in transforming complex data into actionable insights that directly fuel our business growth and critical decisions.


You'll craft compelling data narratives, turning raw information into valuable assets that guide product development and key strategic choices.


Collaborating across teams, you'll uncover pivotal metrics and deep customer insights, empowering informed decisions throughout Planday. Through impactful visualizations and persuasive communication, you'll ensure these insights resonate with stakeholders at all levels.


Furthermore, you'll leverage advanced analytical techniques to pioneer predictive modeling and automation, fostering a culture of data-driven innovation that is central to Planday's continued success.






This role is a maternity cover role for about 7 months.







What you'll do

Collaborate cross-functionally with product, commercial, and leadership teams to define, track, and report critical metrics, delivering comprehensive customer insights.
Design and maintain robust data models that transform raw data into high-value assets, ensuring accuracy and quality.
Develop impactful, hands-on solutions, visualizations, and dashboards across the business, primarily utilizing Tableau to communicate insights effectively.
Leverage proficiency in Python, R, and SQL for advanced data manipulation, statistical analysis, and ensuring high data quality.
Apply advanced statistical analysis techniques for summarizing, interpreting, and predicting data, alongside machine learning concepts for predictive modeling techniques.
Translate complex data into clear, actionable narratives through compelling data storytelling, impactful presentations, and strong interpersonal communication.
During your time with us we’re expecting key projects to include: Product-Market-Fit analysis, customer lifecycle insights, as well as supporting product teams.







Success looks like

Exceptional data models that consistently deliver accurate, high-quality data assets, underpinning strategic initiatives.
Proactive delivery of actionable insights and critical metrics that directly lead to informed decisions and tangible business improvements for product and commercial teams.
Development and implementation of intuitive and highly impactful visualizations and dashboards that significantly elevate data-driven decision-making across Planday.
Insights and recommendations that are consistently trusted and acted upon by product and commercial teams, stemming from rigorous analysis and robust data practices.
Clear and compelling communication of complex data insights, fostering understanding and alignment among stakeholders, resulting in measurable positive business impact.
Proactive problem-solving and innovative thinking in addressing data-related challenges, leading to continuous improvement and advancement in our analytical capabilities.
Successful exploration and implementation of advanced analytical techniques, including machine learning, to unlock new opportunities and generate groundbreaking insights.







What you'll bring with you

Proven experience in Python, R, and advanced SQL (including window functions, CTEs) for advanced data management and statistical analysis.
Proficiency in crafting compelling data stories, leveraging visualization tools like Tableau to transform complex datasets into clear, impactful visualizations that resonate with diverse stakeholders.
Proven capability in product opportunity sizing, metric development, and building robust metric trees to guide product strategy and evaluation.
Demonstrated ability to lead and optimize data wrangling and cleaning processes across multiple, complex projects.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of translating complex data insights into compelling narratives through data storytelling and high-impact presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.
A highly analytical mindset, consistently identifying and solving complex data challenges with innovative solutions that directly drive data-driven strategic decisions.
Practical application of machine learning fundamentals to solve specific business problems through predictive modeling.







At Planday, we offer you

Benefits like pension, health insurance and generous vacation
Flexible remote work
Strong social culture with lots of team and company activities
Meaningful work – everyone at Planday contributes to improving the lives of shift workers around the globe
Healthy work-life balance and autonomous approach to work. We trust in you and your abilities







Finally, our offices are not just workplaces (although they are pretty nice and well-located, we have to say!). Plandayers are open and welcoming and at Planday, everyone has the freedom and support to show their true self at work.






At Planday, we firmly believe that diversity and inclusion are the cornerstones of innovation and a vibrant workplace culture, and we highly value the strength that diverse backgrounds offer.






As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to create an equitable experience for all our candidates throughout the process. Please let us know if you need reasonable accommodation during the application or interview process.


All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to any personal characteristics.

Show more

You'll craft compelling data narratives, turning raw information into valuable assets that guide product development and key strategic choices.

Collaborating across teams, you'll uncover pivotal metrics and deep customer insights, empowering informed decisions throughout Planday. Through impactful visualizations and persuasive communication, you'll ensure these insights resonate with stakeholders at all levels.

Furthermore, you'll leverage advanced analytical techniques to pioneer predictive modeling and automation, fostering a culture of data-driven innovation that is central to Planday's continued success.



This role is a maternity cover role for about 7 months.



What you'll do

    • Collaborate cross-functionally with product, commercial, and leadership teams to define, track, and report critical metrics, delivering comprehensive customer insights.
    • Design and maintain robust data models that transform raw data into high-value assets, ensuring accuracy and quality.
    • Develop impactful, hands-on solutions, visualizations, and dashboards across the business, primarily utilizing Tableau to communicate insights effectively.
    • Leverage proficiency in Python, R, and SQL for advanced data manipulation, statistical analysis, and ensuring high data quality.
    • Apply advanced statistical analysis techniques for summarizing, interpreting, and predicting data, alongside machine learning concepts for predictive modeling techniques.
    • Translate complex data into clear, actionable narratives through compelling data storytelling, impactful presentations, and strong interpersonal communication.
    • During your time with us we’re expecting key projects to include: Product-Market-Fit analysis, customer lifecycle insights, as well as supporting product teams.



Success looks like

    • Exceptional data models that consistently deliver accurate, high-quality data assets, underpinning strategic initiatives.
    • Proactive delivery of actionable insights and critical metrics that directly lead to informed decisions and tangible business improvements for product and commercial teams.
    • Development and implementation of intuitive and highly impactful visualizations and dashboards that significantly elevate data-driven decision-making across Planday.
    • Insights and recommendations that are consistently trusted and acted upon by product and commercial teams, stemming from rigorous analysis and robust data practices.
    • Clear and compelling communication of complex data insights, fostering understanding and alignment among stakeholders, resulting in measurable positive business impact.
    • Proactive problem-solving and innovative thinking in addressing data-related challenges, leading to continuous improvement and advancement in our analytical capabilities.
    • Successful exploration and implementation of advanced analytical techniques, including machine learning, to unlock new opportunities and generate groundbreaking insights.



What you'll bring with you

    • Proven experience in Python, R, and advanced SQL (including window functions, CTEs) for advanced data management and statistical analysis.
    • Proficiency in crafting compelling data stories, leveraging visualization tools like Tableau to transform complex datasets into clear, impactful visualizations that resonate with diverse stakeholders.
    • Proven capability in product opportunity sizing, metric development, and building robust metric trees to guide product strategy and evaluation.
    • Demonstrated ability to lead and optimize data wrangling and cleaning processes across multiple, complex projects.
    • Exceptional communication skills, capable of translating complex data insights into compelling narratives through data storytelling and high-impact presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.
    • A highly analytical mindset, consistently identifying and solving complex data challenges with innovative solutions that directly drive data-driven strategic decisions.
    • Practical application of machine learning fundamentals to solve specific business problems through predictive modeling.



At Planday, we offer you

    • Benefits like pension, health insurance and generous vacation
    • Flexible remote work
    • Strong social culture with lots of team and company activities
    • Meaningful work – everyone at Planday contributes to improving the lives of shift workers around the globe
    • Healthy work-life balance and autonomous approach to work. We trust in you and your abilities



Finally, our offices are not just workplaces (although they are pretty nice and well-located, we have to say!). Plandayers are open and welcoming and at Planday, everyone has the freedom and support to show their true self at work.



At Planday, we firmly believe that diversity and inclusion are the cornerstones of innovation and a vibrant workplace culture, and we highly value the strength that diverse backgrounds offer.



As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to create an equitable experience for all our candidates throughout the process. Please let us know if you need reasonable accommodation during the application or interview process.

All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to any personal characteristics.

Title: Data specialist/Statistician – based in Luxembourg
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.

The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Secretariat General (SG) – Economic Department (ECON) – Economic Studies Division (ES) – Statistical Unit (SU) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, a Data specialist/Statistician*.

This is a full-time position at grade 4 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.


Internal benchmark Associate Economist


Panel interviews are foreseen as from the end of August 2025 .

Purpose

You will maintain economic databases, statistics, as well as contribute to economic and econometric analysis to derive recommendations that help shape strategic decision-making of the EIB in order to contribute to policy formulation and dialogue.

Operating Network

The unit is positioned in SG/ECON/ES but serves the needs of the whole department. The unit designs, develops and maintains all databases, manages the contractual agreements with private database providers, offers statistical and econometric support to ECON staff, maintains the ECON server and various data toolkits posted on the EIB website and organises the sharing of data through secured and restricted web access with external collaborators.

In addition, the unit contributes to automatize processes related to country, policy and research work, provides technical support related to the ratings of sovereigns and banks as well as to local currency pricing. Relatedly, it manages control functions and critical report declarations such as EUC and ICF. You will report to the Head of the Statistical Unit, under the overall supervision of the Head of the Economic Studies Division and the Director of the Department.

Accountabilities


Maintain the Department’s data-architecture, including databases, tools and interfaces.
Support and contribute to statistical, econometric and economic analyses.
Support the technical implementation of tools for surveys and data analytics based on surveys.
Communicate analytical results visually and contribute to standardizing reporting and presentation outputs in a way that can be understood by non-experts.
Contribute to the development of tools to standardize the presentation of economic output of the department.
Collaborate with the assigned IT team on the solutions of the process simplification and automation.
Liaise with relevant counterparts within the Department, the Bank as well as in other national, EU, and international institutions and think tanks.
Contribute through database development and relevant analysis to the policy dialogue and the analysis of key models and policy papers and presentations as well as for other internal and external stakeholders.
Propose improvements of processes, procedures, methodologies and working methods.


Qualifications


University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in econometrics, quantitative economics, mathematics, statistics, information technology;
At least 3 years of experience in statistical analyses, database management and econometrics, for example acquired working in the relevant units of an international or EU institution, statistical office, consulting, government, banking, academia;
Programming skills (Python, R, SQL, VBA, MiKTeX, JavaScript) and knowledge of relevant software for data management and analysis (Stata, RStudio, SAS);
Knowledge of applied quantitative methods;
Knowledge of economic concepts and standard relevant macroeconomic and microeconomic data series and sources
Previous experience in integrating big data in economic analysis and/or knowledge of survey statistical methods would be an advantage;
Experience in written, visual and oral communication of complex quantitative analyses;
Ability to deliver under time pressure when needed;
Excellent knowledge of English and/or French and a good knowledge of the other (**). Working knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.


Competencies

Find out more about EIB core competencies here

To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here

(**) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.

We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.

We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.

This is an open campaign to consecutively fill an open position. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

Title: Senior Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our client is looking for a Senior Analyst with a sharp investigative mindset and a passion for ethical business practices to join our growing team.

This role can be based in Berlin or Copenhagen, or can be based remotely within Europe.




What You’ll Do:

• Lead or support integrity due diligence, investigations, and business intelligence assignments

• Work closely with our global subcontractor network and freelance researchers

• Scope and develop proposals for new assignments

• Help train and mentor new hires and junior analysts

• Contribute to research innovation, knowledge development, and marketing efforts




What We’re Looking For:

• 1-3 years’ experience in business intelligence, integrity due diligence, or corporate investigations

• Experience in the Nordics (emerging markets experience a plus)

• Full professional English + working proficiency in a Scandinavian language

• University degree in Politics, IR, Security, Social Sciences, Law, or related fields

• Strong analytical, organisational, and communication skills

• A collaborative and independent work ethic - even in remote settings
