Title: Analyst
Description:
Do you enjoy simplifying complexity, working with many stakeholders, and helping people succeed through better digital tools? Are you able to listen, challenge, and guide decision-making in areas where opinions are strong and diverse? Do you see the value in working with data?

If so, BESTSELLER TECH is looking for you to join our Master Data team as our new Analyst.

YOUR TEAM

Join BESTSELLER TECH’s Master Data team – a dedicated and collaborative group based in Brande and Aarhus. We meet weekly in person, thrive on strong partnerships, and take pride in building and owning our own systems. Together, we make sure data is structured, governed and geared for the future.

You’ll work closely with teams across sourcing, retail coordination, country admin, TECH and finance. Our current priorities include improving data quality, reducing duplicates, cleaning up outdated processes, and assigning clear ownership across core entities. Long-term, we’ll also explore new technologies to strengthen our foundation further.

YOUR ROLE

As our new Analyst, you will bridge business and technology to improve the way BESTSELLER handles its most critical data—covering customers, suppliers, users, and locations. Your core mission will be to understand how our business works, identify where we can do better, and collaborate with developers to create sustainable and scalable solutions.

You will take part in the entire lifecycle: from early dialogue and process understanding to defining user stories, supporting testing, and guiding rollouts. You'll help us turn manual, fragmented work into structured, automated processes that support our brands and functions worldwide.

More specifically, you will


Analyze business needs and system landscapes to propose efficient, scalable solutions.
Collaborate across global teams to align on priorities and outcomes.
Participate in or lead workshops to align expectations, challenge assumptions, and uncover root causes of data challenges.
Support the delivery and rollout of features, including communication, documentation, and change support.
Help drive a more data-driven culture through knowledge sharing, training, and structured guidance with our stakeholders.
Assist in driving and expanding a shared Data Governance framework across Master Data entities.


YOUR PROFILE

You are a people-oriented problem solver with a curious mindset and a passion for meaningful change. You thrive in complex environments and feel energised by the opportunity to improve how things work – and how they could work better. You’re confident facilitating dialogue across diverse teams and turning input into action. You ask the right questions, challenge assumptions, and make progress – even when perspectives vary.

We imagine you bring:


Experience working with data – such as modeling, structuring, and organizing complex datasets.
A strong analytical mindset and the ability to uncover improvement opportunities through business process analysis.
Solid communication skills and an ability to guide stakeholders.
Comfortable educating users and stakeholders about master data management principles and how to apply them in daily operations.
Experience with SQL and process design or system development is an advantage.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.


WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU

If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact Jacob Zachariasen at +45 52 15 10 61. To apply, send us your CV as soon as possible and no later than 1st of September 2025. We review and interview candidates on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to close the job ad once we find the right candidate.

Location: Brande or Aarhus.

About Bestseller Tech

We are more than 400 people strong, located in Denmark, Spain and Rwanda. We are excited about what we do, but there’s more to us than our tech stack. We are young at heart and thrive in a flat organization. Our teams are agile and empowered with end-to-end responsibility. We want to be at the forefront of the newest technologies, and we move forward together. Every day. If you want to play a significant part in empowering our business, then welcome to BESTSELLER TECH. BESTSELLER TECH is part of the worldwide fashion company BESTSELLER. For more information, please go to www.bestseller.com.

Title: Junior Partner Analyst
Place: Glostrup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Vil du arbejde med samarbejde, analyse og procesoptimering – og være bindeled mellem Verisure og vores eksterne partnere? 

Hos Verisure søger vi en struktureret og proaktiv Junior Partner Analyst, der vil spille en vigtig rolle i samarbejdet med vores eksterne servicepartnere og sikre fremdrift i vores daglige drift og leverancer. 

Om rollen 

Som Junior Partner Analyst bliver du en central del af teamet, der samarbejder med seks eksterne servicepartnere og deres montører. Du vil få ansvar for at understøtte og udvikle samarbejdet gennem løbende dialog, opfølgning på performance og koordinering på tværs af afdelinger. Rollen kræver både struktur, relationsarbejde og analytisk sans. 

Du vil være tæt på vores partnere og deres performance, og fungere som deres primære kontaktperson i dagligdagen. Din opgave bliver at omsætte vores strategi til konkrete processer og tiltag, sikre implementering og drive fremdrift. Du får ansvar for at definere og forbedre processer, og det forventes, at du proaktivt finder løsninger, når situationer falder uden for standardprocedurer – hvilket ofte er tilfældet i en kompleks hverdag med mange interessenter. 

Dine opgaver 
Opbygge og vedligeholde samarbejdet med eksterne partnere 
Udføre daglige analyser af datasæt og KPI’er med fokus på performance management og optimeringsmuligheder 
Koordinere og håndtere daglige henvendelser og udfordringer fra partnere – herunder aktivt stakeholder management 
Formidle nye processer og tiltag på en tydelig og letforståelig måde 
Deltage i mindre projekter og bidrage til løbende udviklingsinitiativer 
Din profil 
Du er nyuddannet eller i starten af din karriere med en relevant videregående uddannelse 
Du har stærke samarbejds- og kommunikationsevner og trives i en udadvendt rolle 
Du arbejder struktureret og trives med at finde løsninger i en kompleks og omskiftelig hverdag 
Du har erfaring med – eller stor interesse for – dataanalyse, gerne med Excel som arbejdsredskab 
Du er proaktiv og motiveres af ansvar og muligheden for at løbe selvstændigt med opgaver 
Vil du være en del af Verisure og være med til at gøre en forskel? 

Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, kan du kontakte HR Business Partner, Simone Holmer på simone.holmer@verisure.com. 

Vi vil løbende gennemgå ansøgninger og afholde interviews, så vi opfordrer dig til at søge stillingen hurtigst muligt.  

Hos Verisure arbejder vi for at fremme en mangfoldig og inkluderende arbejdsplads. Vi tror på, at diversitet i tanker og baggrund kun gør vores teams stærkere og mere innovative. Vi forpligter os derfor til en kultur præget af diversitet og inklusion med lige muligheder for alle, og opfordrer alle uanset baggrund, kultur, køn, alder og erfaring, til at ansøge om at blive en del af vores team. Vi er mennesker, som beskytter mennesker, og sammen står vi endnu stærkere i vores mission om at skabe tryghed for vores kunder.    

Om Verisure 

Hos Verisure udfører vores medarbejdere noget fantastisk hver eneste dag. Ved at beskytte det, der betyder mest, ændrer vi livet til det bedre for vores kunder. Vi er den førende europæiske udbyder af professionelt overvågede sikkerhedsløsninger med 24/7 respons og service, og vi er til stede i 18 lande i Europa og Latinamerika. Vi integrerer produktudvikling, design, salg, installation og en 24/7 professionel overvågningsløsning. Vi har en dokumenteret historie, som går 35 år tilbage, og vi har gennem årene vist kontinuerlig vækst - også i Danmark. Siden 2017 har vi i Danmark vækstet eksplosivt, og vi har spændende planer om at fortsætte med at udvide, transformere og føre markedet ind i fremtiden.   

Vores succes afhænger af vores medarbejdere, og vi investerer i dem hver eneste dag. Hos Verisure bliver du en del af en førende virksomhed inden for branchen.  

Show more

Vi vil løbende gennemgå ansøgninger og afholde interviews, så vi opfordrer dig til at søge stillingen hurtigst muligt.  

Hos Verisure arbejder vi for at fremme en mangfoldig og inkluderende arbejdsplads. Vi tror på, at diversitet i tanker og baggrund kun gør vores teams stærkere og mere innovative. Vi forpligter os derfor til en kultur præget af diversitet og inklusion med lige muligheder for alle, og opfordrer alle uanset baggrund, kultur, køn, alder og erfaring, til at ansøge om at blive en del af vores team. Vi er mennesker, som beskytter mennesker, og sammen står vi endnu stærkere i vores mission om at skabe tryghed for vores kunder.    

Om Verisure 

Hos Verisure udfører vores medarbejdere noget fantastisk hver eneste dag. Ved at beskytte det, der betyder mest, ændrer vi livet til det bedre for vores kunder. Vi er den førende europæiske udbyder af professionelt overvågede sikkerhedsløsninger med 24/7 respons og service, og vi er til stede i 18 lande i Europa og Latinamerika. Vi integrerer produktudvikling, design, salg, installation og en 24/7 professionel overvågningsløsning. Vi har en dokumenteret historie, som går 35 år tilbage, og vi har gennem årene vist kontinuerlig vækst - også i Danmark. Siden 2017 har vi i Danmark vækstet eksplosivt, og vi har spændende planer om at fortsætte med at udvide, transformere og føre markedet ind i fremtiden.   

Vores succes afhænger af vores medarbejdere, og vi investerer i dem hver eneste dag. Hos Verisure bliver du en del af en førende virksomhed inden for branchen.

Title: Data & Analytics Consultant
Description:
Er du fascineret af at arbejde med data og omsætte det til værdifulde indsigter og tiltag for dine kolleger? Som Data & Analytics Consultant i Telenor får du mulighed for at supportere vores kundevendte kanaler med rapportering. Lige nu er vi i gang med en større datatransformation, hvor vi skal udskifte vores nuværende BI-værktøj med Google Looker Studio, og klæde forretningen på til fremtidens data-setup. Det kan du få en stor rolle i at bidrage til, og skabe de bedste forudsætninger for nem, korrekt og retvisende rapportering. Interesseret?

”Hvis du har en stor interesse for data, modulering og BI, vil du virkelig trives hos os. Vores opgave er at understøtte vores samarbejdspartnere i Telenors kundevendte kanaler med hurtig, rigtig og nem rapportering, så de kan lægge deres energi og fokus i vores kunder. Du får samtidig rig mulighed for at sætte dit præg på brugen af data i fremtidens Telenor, idet vi skal overgå til en ny BI platform, som du får en stor aktie i både at skulle udvikle og drifte.”

– Christian Frost Pedersen, Head of Channel Management

Vi transformerer og optimerer data for at fremme værdien for Telenor

I rollen som Data & Analytics Consultant, bliver du en del af Channel Management teamet, hvis formål er at understøtte Telenors kundevendte kanaler med brugbar og intuitiv rapportering, og sikre at ledelsen kan tage datadrevet beslutninger. Du vil være med til at udvikle og vedligeholde datamodeller til dashboards og KPI’er, som dagligt bruges af Telenors Kundeservice, Retail, Partnere og stabsfunktioner. Det er en brugerbase på flere hundrede kollegaer, som hver dag anvender dit arbejde. Med din assistance og dataindsigt, kan dine kolleger fokusere på at give vores kunder den bedst mulige oplevelse.

I transformationen, hvor vi skal udskifte vores nuværende rapporteringsplatform, Qlik Sense, med Google Looker, vil du få en central rolle i at sikre en god balance mellem den daglige drift og overgangen til det nye setup. Derfor er der også rig mulighed for, at du kan udvikle dig – både fagligt og personligt –, når vi i samarbejde i teamet skal forme den måde hvorpå, vi arbejder med data og rapportering fremadrettet.

Det tætte samarbejde med forretningen er en vigtig del af stillingen, og du bliver en central sparringspartner for vores stakeholders. Med forretningens behov som omdrejningspunkt skaber du løsninger, der giver mening i praksis og understøtter gode brugeroplevelser. Derfor er det vigtigt, at du trives med at være tæt på brugerne, forstår hvordan data skaber værdi i praksis og tilpasser dine løsninger derefter.

Du kan sætte dig ind i dine samarbejdspartneres behov og bearbejde data på en brugbar måde

Ligesom os, er du engageret i at udforske data. Om det er analyser, visualiseringer, eller opbygning af datamodeller, så er du i dit es. Du har en dybdegående forståelse for data, hvilket giver dig evnen til at sætte dig ind i store datamængder og omsætte det på en brugbar og anvendelig måde. Samtidig er du motiveret for at forstå, hvordan forretningen fungerer og arbejder, og du bruger den viden til at finde de bedste løsninger, som skaber værdi for dine samarbejdspartnere.

Vi forestiller os, at du som minimum har erfaring med Python og SQL, og måske har arbejdet med enten Qlik Sense og Google Looker Studio. Vigtigst er dog, at du er interesseret i at sætte fremdrift i egne opgaver, kan kaste dig ud i nye ting, og at du går op i at lære og udvikle dig. Det kommer til udtryk i din nysgerrighed, hvor du gerne går på oplevelse efter måder, hvorpå tingene kan optimeres. Samtidig betragter du modgang som en mulighed for at lære og vokse.

En arbejdsplads fyldt med Fantastiske forbindelser

Du bliver en del af en foranderlig organisation, hvor der, på tværs af forretningen, venter engagerede og dygtige kolleger, som kontinuerligt arbejder for at udvikle fremtidens teleselskab. Vi arbejder agilt, fokuserer indsatsområder ved hjælp af Kanban og praktiserer Tight-Loose-Tight som ledelsesfilosofi.

Som en del af Channel Management får du 12 engagerede kollegaer, der arbejder på tværs af en bred række arbejdsopgaver indenfor driftsoptimering og rapportering. Vi har et mindset om at tingene skal være nemme, automatiske og selvdrevne, så de kan driftes med et minimalt fingertryk. Det er afspejlet i vores kultur, hvor vi hele tiden skubber til hinanden og udforsker muligheder for ny viden og læring. Vi trives i at være sociale sammen og prioritere fælles dage på kontoret. Samtidig arbejder vi ud fra vores "Flexible Work"-koncept, som tilbyder fleksible rammer og mulighed for hjemmearbejde.

Du kan læse mere om os her.

Interesseret?

Hvis du er blevet nysgerrig og vil vide mere, kan du kontakte Head of Channel Management, Christian Frost Pedersen på mail: chfp@telenor.dk eller på tlf.: 60 50 72 27.

Sidder du med en følelse af, at det lige er dig, vi leder efter, søger du blot via linket her på siden. Vi ser frem til at modtage dit CV og dine svar på vores ansøgningsskema.





Fantastiske forbindelser

Telenor er mere, end du tror. Med høj energi når vi vores ambitiøse mål i tværfaglige teams. Som mennesker er vi ligetil og udvikler hinanden.

Vi udfordrer os selv og markedet ved at gå nye veje med vores innovative tankegang og teknologier. Med de nyeste løsninger og det mest effektive netværk skaber vi små mirakler i en verden, der aldrig står stille.

Vores formål er at hjælpe mennesker med en sikker og stabil forbindelse til det, der betyder noget for dem. Vi er meget mere end simkort og smartphones. Vi er den digitale livsnerve, der forbinder mennesker, virksomheder og samfund.

Det giver dig spændende opgaver og større ansvar i en hverdag fyldt med fleksibilitet, frihed og Fantastiske forbindelser.

Udvikler | Udfordrer | Forbinder
Show more

Title: Senior Specialist, eCommerce Analytics & Insights
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about driving eCommerce growth through data-driven insights and digital innovation?

If you have a strategic mindset, a deep understanding of digital analytics, and a talent for turning complex data into clear, actionable insights, you might be the perfect fit for our Senior Specialist, eCommerce Analytics & Insights role at Pandora’s Global Office in Copenhagen.

As a Senior Specialist in eCommerce Analytics & Insights, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our digital performance. You’ll lead the development and implementation of best-in-class website analytics practices, ensuring that data is not only accurate and reliable but also deeply embedded in our commercial decision-making processes.

You will act as the key liaison between Adobe data engineering teams and the broader analytics community, translating business needs into technical solutions and ensuring seamless collaboration across functions. Your insights will directly influence strategic initiatives, helping Pandora deliver exceptional digital experiences and drive measurable business impact.

In this role, you’ll also champion data governance, oversee data quality assurance, and lead the creation of advanced dashboards and visualizations tailored to senior stakeholders. You’ll work closely with regional eCommerce teams and internal partners to anticipate and exceed their analytics needs, while fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation. We are looking for a highly analytical, commercially minded individual with a strong foundation in digital analytics, stakeholder management, and data storytelling. If you thrive in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment and are passionate about the power of data to drive growth, we’d love to hear from you.

Key responsibilities:


Define and evolve best-in-class commercial website analytics practices aligned with Pandora’s digital transformation agenda
Act as the primary bridge between Adobe data engineering and commercial analytics teams
Integrate Adobe Analytics insights into core business workstreams to influence strategic decisions
Drive data integrity initiatives across all tracking and reporting mechanisms. Analyse, document and resolve inconsistencies while controlling business impact through stakeholder management. Lead advanced data analysis and visualization efforts, delivering insights through dashboards and reports with multi-system data inputs.
Build strong partnerships with regional eCommerce and internal teams to elevate performance reporting and consolidate strategic data needs into clear technical development requirements.
Promote continuous learning and innovation within the analytics function
Mentor colleagues and elevate the organization’s analytical maturity



Ideally, you have:


4–5 years of experience in website analytics, with at least 4 years owning or managing analytics systems
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Engineering, Economics, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
Proven ability to translate complex commercial needs into actionable analytics improvements
Experience with Adobe Analytics (certification is a plus)
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI
Strong understanding of eCommerce KPIs and the commercial impact of digital analytics



Furthermore, we hope to see that you are:


A strategic thinker with exceptional critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy in data interpretation
A clear communicator who can translate data into compelling stories for diverse audiences
Skilled at building trust and partnerships across technical and commercial teams
Proactive, self-motivated, and accountable for delivering results
Proficient in Microsoft Office, especially Excel and PowerPoint



Your new team

Pandora is a company with a big heart, and we take great pride in treating our people well. You’ll join a passionate, ambitious team within an international, high-impact function.

Additional Information

Global Career Band: 5A

Did we get your attention?

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you! We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design, we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand, specialising in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.

Recognised by the Financial Times as one of Europe’s Best Workplaces and ranked #1 among Danish companies, Pandora is committed to building an inclusive and diverse workplace. We believe that reflecting the diversity of society in how we engage with our customers is essential to fulfilling our purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We are dedicated to nurturing a culture where everyone feels respected, valued, and empowered to thrive.
Show more

Title: Quantitative Research Analyst
Description:
Huge opportunity for sell-side researchers to join a buy-side firm with clear progression to trader and PM seats at a leading commodities firm.




Overview

Join an asset modelling team building in-house pricing libraries for commodity options. Design, implement and productionise stochastic models that drive valuation, optimisation and risk for complex optionality in commodity assets.




The Firm

Build best-in-class, proprietary optimisation models rather than buying off the shelf.
High autonomy, pragmatic culture and genuine work–life balance. Open to remote working.
Clear path to broaden into options trading or complex risk ownership as the platform scales.
Team track record in profitable commodity trading with ambition to lead model-driven decision making.




What you will do

Develop and extend options pricing libraries for commodities, with calibration and sensitivities.
Build stochastic models for assets and storages, including model choice, assumptions and risk implications.
Implement automatic differentiation to compute Greeks and accelerate calibration.
Partner with risk and trading to embed models into decision making and PnL attribution.
Own code from research to production with testing, performance tuning and documentation.




Requirements

Strong mathematics background in stochastic calculus and probability, with ability to apply theory.
Experience pricing exotic derivative libraries, not just using black-box libraries.
Solid coding skills in Python; exposure to C++ or Java is a plus.
Front-office quant experience in derivatives pricing or complex risk preferred.
2+ years professional experience.
MSc or PhD in a mathematic or quantitative field.
Experience with automatic differentiation frameworks for Greeks.
Options risk management know-how and interest in trading around complex risk.
Familiarity with energy options is a plus, not required.




Fit clarifications

Not e-trading or market making. Focus is modelling and valuation for options optimisation.
Backgrounds from front-office banking or competitors working on storage modelling are relevant.




Location

Denmark primary site. Flexibility for limited remote work.




Compensation

Base €80 - €120k
Bonus: capped at 200% of base. Potential formulaic PnL cut on the asset book at 0.X% depending on seniority and scope.

Show more

  • Denmark primary site. Flexibility for limited remote work.


Compensation

  • Base €80 - €120k
  • Bonus: capped at 200% of base. Potential formulaic PnL cut on the asset book at 0.X% depending on seniority and scope.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
SYBO is part of the Miniclip family and known for the widely popular game, Subway Surfers, the most downloaded mobile game in the world, with over four billion downloads. Located in the heart of Copenhagen, we aim to create playful moments that inspire our fans to care.

We’re on the hunt for a sharp-minded, insight-hungry Game Analyst to join one of our flagship game teams, Subway Surfers, a genre-defining title with an evergreen player base and a whole lot of heart.

This role will combine hands-on analysis with strategic influence, helping shape the future of Subway Surfers through data-driven insights. This isn’t just about crunching numbers, it’s about understanding our players behind them. That means diving deep into player behaviours, running tests with purpose, and guiding product decisions that create long-term joy.

You won’t be doing it alone. You’ll partner with a kind, curious, and dynamic team. And yes, we walk the talk on work-life balance. No heroics here, just smart strategies, shared wins, and the occasional Friday celebration.

Responsibilities


Partner with the Lead Analyst to deliver actionable insights on game performance, player behaviour, and content updates
Own the design, execution, and readout of A/B tests, including defining success metrics and interpreting results
Lead advanced analyses on player behavior, retention, engagement, monetization, and live operations.
Build and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualisations in Looker for both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Query and process large datasets using Google Cloud Platform (GCP) tools, ensuring accuracy and timeliness of reporting
Define and create player segments based on behavioural, demographic, and engagement data to enable targeted analysis, personalised experiences, and strategic decision-making
Partner with Product Managers, Designers, and Engineers to influence feature development and live-ops strategies. with data-backed recommendations
Advocate for data-driven culture,help establish best practices in game analytics


Life at SYBO

In your first month...

You’ll get familiar with our game, tools, data models, and team rituals. You’ll dive into past analyses, learn our approach to segmentation and game economy design, and start contributing to ongoing experiments and reporting. Expect lots of support, onboarding sessions, and good conversations with game designers, product folks, and other analysts.

Within 3 months...

You’ll be leading your first couple of A/B tests, providing insights on economy balancing, and segmentation strategy. Get ready to start owning dashboards, delivering insights that drive content and feature decisions, and partnering closely with the game team to define KPIs and hypotheses.

By 12 months...

You’ll have made a measurable impact on player experience, game economy health, and decision-making speed. Your work will be deeply embedded in how we build and iterate the game, and you’ll be known as a go-to person for both sharp insights and strategic thinking. You’ll have helped us level up our analytical maturity and you’ll probably have taught us a thing or two along the way.

Requirements


Proven experience in game analytics or related data-heavy roles, ideally within free-to-play mobile games
Proficiency in SQL, Python/R, and data visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, or similar). Strong foundation in statistics and experiment design.
Understanding of A/B methodology, ideally with practical experience or strong statistical knowledge
Deep interest in gaming, with curiosity to understand player motivations, behaviors, and monetization strategies.
Clear communicator who translates complex insights into compelling stories and effectively influences decisions across technical and non-technical stakeholders


Bonus Points


Familiarity with LookML or experience building custom data models in Looker


About SYBO

We're SYBO, the mobile games studio behind the legendary Subway Surfers, with over 4 billion downloads worldwide! Join our team in the heart of Copenhagen, where creativity flourishes in our new, innovative studio.

If you join us, you'll have the opportunity to dive into engaging and creative projects alongside a diverse group of collaborative colleagues from over 40 countries across the globe.

We truly believe you perform your best, when you have the equipment you need - and our IT team is always there to ensure you have access to the latest tools and the right gear, enabling you to be at your best.

We also pride ourselves in taking care of your well-being, offering a delicious lunch buffet, a variety of healthy snacks, mental health activities, massages and regular social events to keep the energy flowing.

Not in Copenhagen? Not a problem! We have in-house relocation specialists who will help you relocate, and feel right at home in Copenhagen and at SYBO!
Show more

Title: Data Scientist (Randers SV, DK, 8940)
Description:
14/08/2025

Group CFO

DNK-Randers, Danish Crown Vej

Data Scientist

Do you believe there’s a connection between bacon and data? Do you want to be part of a team whose mission is to turn data into delicious insights?

At Danish Crown, we believe that just as bacon is a key product in our portfolio, data is the essential ingredient that drives our innovation and success, helping us to optimize processes, predict trends, and maintain our leadership in the industry – and we’re now looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our team and help us in this journey ahead of us.

Responsibilities

As a Data Scientist at Danish Crown, you will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets to uncover valuable insights, developing predictive models, and working closely with cross-functional teams to drive data-informed decision-making. You will be involved in various projects, such as:


Commodity, livestock, and product forecasting.
Object detection and tracking in real-time video feeds from production sites.


Success starts with a team

You will become part of the Data Science team within the Data, Analytics & AI space in the Global IT department. We work on multiple initiatives for various business units, with tasks around delivering data analysis and insights, modelling of complex data sources, and research and implementation of machine learning and deep learning models for tasks such as time-series forecasting, image recognition, or natural language processing, amongst others.

We are curious about the latest developments in our space, and therefore actively encourage everyone to have an innovative mindset and propose their ideas for further incubation.

Key Responsibilities

You’ll be part of helping Danish Crown become a data-first organization. Your main tasks will include:


Providing actionable insights, identify trends and measure performance by conducting advanced statistical and other analyses.
Developing analytical solutions by creating, testing and implementing complex models and algorithms.
Implementing scalable, sustainable solutions addressing business needs in collaboration with AI/ML and Data Engineers.
Explaining the design, functioning and output of analytical models/solutions to consumers.
Staying up to date with the latest trends and advancements in data science and machine learning.


Who are we looking for?

A passionate and detail-oriented colleague with a knack for uncovering insights from data, thriving in a collaborative environment and always eager to learn and apply new technologies.

With a strong analytical mindset, you enjoy solving complex problems and your excellent communication skills allow you to effectively convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders.

Additional Qualifications


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar role.
Strong programming skills in Python. SQL is a plus.
Strong knowledge of machine learning algorithms and statistical modeling techniques.
Fluent in English. Understanding of Danish can be a plus.
Familiar with cloud platforms and version control.


Appetite For More?

If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact Manager, Data Science Global IT, Francesc Joan Riera at (+45) 60 90 67 72.

We review candidates continuously, so let us know why you are the right candidate for the job and send it together with your CV. We aim for a start, as soon as possible – will wait for the right person.

We are a food company owned by Danish farmers supplying high-quality food to customers and consumers worldwide. From butchers to business developers, we're more than 24,000 colleagues, all committed to lowering our carbon footprint and becoming climate-neutral by 2050 for better food and a brighter future.
Show more

Title: AI Healthcare Data Specialist
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Ambu A/S is currently looking for an AI Healthcare Data Specialist to be based in Augsburg, Germany.

In Ambu we develop single-use endoscope solutions and the digital space is a fast growing part of the buisiness. The potential improvements that can be achieved with AI solutions are extraordinary. At the heart of these AI application lies the data and this is where you come in. We need your help to ensure the highest quality of data and annotatios for our deep learning models and your help to prove their performance in the clinic.

In this position you will join Ambu’s Algorithms team, a team of data specialists and deep learning engineers, with the common goal of bringing the best possible digital solutions to the doctors. The Algorithms team is currently based entirely at the Ambu headquarter in Ballerup, Denmark, but it is the company strategy to build up and expand our team in Augsburg, Germany. We believe it to be vital that you get integrated into the team quickly, therefore we expect you to start out your journey in Ambu, by spending 3 weeks at the headquarter in Denmark – getting introduced to the company, the work and the team. In addition, we expect that you travel at least 4 times to Denmark during the first year.

Key Responsibilities As AI Healthcare Data Specialist

Your work will be organised in an AI project team, where you in close collaboration with another AI Healthcare Data specialist will be responsible for getting the data. The focus will be on the clinical and data related tasks regarding user interaction, workflow understanding, data collection and annotation, clinical trials, implementation in products, and clinical documentation.

You will primarily...


Identify user needs and evaluate AI solutions to improve clinical workflow.
Design, establish and drive clinical data collection studies
Identify, define and communicate data and label needs/requirements
Ensure data quality and control
Clinical documentation package, including clinical risk related documentation


Experienced In Data Acquisition And Data Management

We are looking for an experienced candidate with a minimum of 5 years of experience working with clinical data collection studies. We imagine you may hold a Master of Biomedical Engineering or a similar field. Ideally, you have experience working with data annotation and anonymization. It is essential that you have a keen interest in AI and a drive for making clinical products. Desirable skills for this position are:


Knowledge of quality assurance in medtech
Experience working with medical personel
Experience in running clinical studies
Experience in data management, annotation and anonymization
General programming skillset – as a minimum in Python
General knowledge of deep learning theory and applications


As a person, you are highly motivated, self-driven, structured and with a strong sense of detail.

It is essential that you have excellent communication and English skills, both written and oral.

Ambu – a visionary and international workplace where your efforts matter

Ambu is a company that expands rapidly and has ambitious growth targets. We meet these targets through interdisciplinary teamwork between motivated and highly skilled employees. Your contributions and efforts are crucial to our success and by joining us you will get the opportunity to work in an international head office with an informal working environment.

We offer great opportunities for personal development. Furthermore, we offer a wide range of professional, social and financial employee benefits in addition to exciting job challenges and continuous professional and personal development.
Show more

Title: Lead Data Analyst - Payments Data
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 30308

Welcome to Group Technology, where we pride ourselves on engineering solutions and direct Nordea’s transformation by providing a holistic technological view and structured understanding of the bank, and its surrounding environment to enable the Customer Vision and the Business Strategy.

Nordea is a place where traditions meet tomorrow. We're not just a bank, we're a tech employer on a mission to evolve finance securely and responsibly. Together, we impact millions of people’s daily lives by ensuring they can access our solutions anytime, anywhere, while safeguarding their personal data and wealth. Join us in making an impact on the banking industry.

About This Opportunity

To strengthen our team we are looking for an experienced Lead Data Analyst (Expert IT Analyst) who has skills to do hands-on data and requirement analysis work. The right candidate also understands other aspects of software development: Are we making solid architectural decisions? Are we able to improve our tech stack? Are we focusing on right things?

Your main responsibilities will be around the consolidation and harmonization, sourcing, storage and distribution of Payments Data to other solutions. It also includes integrations supporting different End2End payment flows in Nordea's target payment architecture.

What you’ll be doing:


Contributing to solution design, maintainability and architecture of applications
Designing both near real-time data pipelines and pipeline for traditional analytics
Interacting with product owners and stakeholders to clarify, elicit and translate requirements into implementation specifications
Data mapping, data modelling, solution design and working with Information architects
Performing quantitative data analysis with the aim to understand identified issues and to explain implications, and recommend solutions
Collaborating with developers and engineers, and properly document your design & solutions
Engaging with many different stakeholders, so the person we are looking for, is communicative and has skills to build relationships
Eliciting requirements (functional and non-functional) by co-operating with different stakeholders in a complex environment
Be responsible for requirements documentation (inc. use cases) and quality improvement
Accessing complex and distributed datasets, and perform statistical analysis


The role is based in Copenhagen / Taastrup (DK) or Helsinki (FI).

Who You Are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:


Are a team player who takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships and loves sharing knowledge
Have a consultant mindset – actively participate in multiple initiatives at once
Can communicate constructively, and contribute to a productive work environment and good atmosphere in the team
Are an experienced analyst, always seeking the best solution


Your experience and background:


5-7 years of experience from designing data intensive solutions, data architectures and integration patterns
Understanding the importance of requirement elicitation techniques / analysis
Expert in ensuring that business requirements gets translated into functional and non-functional specifications
Excellent skills in SQL (Oracle, MSSQL or similar RDBMS)
Understanding of practices like Domain driven design, Event sourcing architecture patterns, microservices architecture and clean code
Understanding of CI/CD, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, REST, Maven and JUnit and also to have experience building distributed, highly available and high throughput applications
Degree in computer science and engineering, mathematical modelling or similar
Excellent written and spoken English communication skills, and familiar with international collaboration with different stakeholder groups


It is beneficial if you have:


Knowledge of the banking sector and payment domain (ISO20022 standard, SEPA and Swift messages)
Experience in one or more cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/Google)


What We Offer

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.

People are driven by many different factors. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.

A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.

Hybrid working model – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.

Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 31/10/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Finn Abildgaard at finn.abildgaard@nordea.com. Please note that we will proceed with potential candidates already during the application period.

We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.

We build relationships. We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.

We learn and develop. We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.

We lead change. We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.

We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.

Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don’t apply for jobs unless they tick all the qualification boxes. If this is part of why you hesitate to apply, we would like you to reconsider and give it a chance. Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think.
Show more

We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.

We build relationships. We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.

We learn and develop. We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.

We lead change. We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.

We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.

Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don’t apply for jobs unless they tick all the qualification boxes. If this is part of why you hesitate to apply, we would like you to reconsider and give it a chance. Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think.

Title: Business Insights & Report Specialist
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Business Insight & Reporting Specialist with expertise in Power BI Reporting/Front-end to join our Data & Digitalization team. This role will be instrumental in developing, maintaining, and optimizing reporting solutions that drive business insights, using a combination of tabular models and diverse data sources. The individual will also be a key player in implementing our data strategy. 
 

The role:

This role will focus on designing dynamic performance reports and dashboards, mainly using Power BI, to provide valuable insights for business evaluation and strategic planning. The right candidate will collaborate with senior leadership from all departments and IT teams to ensure data integrity and accessible reporting.

Furthermore, you will:

Design and deliver Power BI reports and dashboards highlighting KPIs on a strategic, tactical and an operational level.
Provide regular and ad-hoc reporting to support the whole business to become more data driven.
Collaborate with teams to align reports with organizational goals.
Develop interactive reports and dashboards integrating data from multiple sources using Power BI.
Ensure reports are accessible and actionable, supporting business users in decision-making.
Maintain comprehensive documentation for reports, models, and data processes.
Implement controls to ensure data quality and manage access protocols.
 


The Team:

The Data & Digitalization team consists of three sub-departments: Applications, Data Strategy & Governance and BI & Architecture. You will be in the BI & Architecture team with four colleagues. All of them are located at the Aarhus office. However, you will be working closely together with Data Strategy & Governance and Applications. You will be working with and reporting for the senior leaders to support strategic decision-making based on Power BI reports.


Qualifications:

The ideal candidate will have strong experience in Power BI Front-end development, with a demonstrated ability to track, analyze, and communicate financial and operational performance metrics to support informed decision-making across the business.
 

Furthermore, you have:

A Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Business Intelligence, Finance, Data Science, UX Design, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in Power BI front-end, financial reporting, or business intelligence, with a strong focus on performance management reporting.
Proven expertise in Power BI, including creating visually compelling, report and dashboards development, data modelling, DAX, and Power Query.
Worked with tabular models and the creating of semantic models.
In-depth knowledge of financial and operational performance metrics and experience reporting on KPIs such as revenue, margins, costs, and profitability.
Excellent problem-solving skills with a proactive approach to identifying and addressing reporting issues.


What will make you stand out:

Power BI certification (e.g., Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate).
Experience with Microsoft Fabric.
Understanding of SQL for querying data sources and enhancing reporting capabilities.
 


We offer

At Stibo System, we offer more than just a job. We put people first and inspire you to become the best version of yourself.

We care about our colleague’s work-life balance, and we offer flexibility through a hybrid work model

International: A growing global company, worldwide career opportunities, and multicultural teams

Well-being: A caring and inspiring environment, promoting a happy and healthy lifestyle through a wide range of facilities and activities
 



Join Stibo Systems, where we embrace 'All Kinds of Data Minds.' 

Stibo Systems is a global company with a Nordic heritage. We help companies transform into digital leaders through market-leading multidomain master data management that delivers transparency. Through our solution, large brands (our customers) connect data across their products, customers, stores, employees, suppliers, digital assets and much, much more.


Our people are key to our success and at Stibo Systems, you'll find an environment that values data driven, creativity, curiosity, and analytical thinking. We're committed to making you feel trusted, invested in, and connected, fostering a workplace where every data mind thrives. Be part of our journey to digital leadership!


Interested?

We invite candidates for interviews on a continuous basis, so please apply as soon as possible.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Azure Data Engineer




Som Data Engineer hos cVation bygger du dataplatforme, datawarehouses og MLOps løsninger i skyen for vores kunder. Vi bruger teknologier som Databricks, Fabric, Spark, Azure Machine Learning, Data Factory og Azure Synapse. Vi søger profiler med erfaring inden for enten MLOps, datawarehouses eller dataplatforme, som vil bygge innovative dataløsninger.




cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloudløsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. cVation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development. Vi sætter en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet, og tager desuden principperne fra DevOps og software engineering med i vores dataprojekter, hvilket betyder, at tests, Infrastructure as Code og automatisering er i fokus.




Hvilken rolle får du?




Du kommer til at arbejde på et af vores dataprojekter med et projektteam bestående af arkitekter, software udviklere og DevOps specialister. Du vil have fuldt fokus på ét projekt og være tilknyttet ét team ad gangen.




Din rolle bliver at




rådgive om og bygge datawarehouse/dataplatformsløsninger i skyen
rådgive om og bygge løsninger indenfor MLOps
bidrage til design og implementering af den optimale Azure infrastruktur
sikre, at alt opsætning og provisionering sker som infrastructure as code, fx. Terraform
fuldautomatiseret overvågning og skalering af løsninger




Hvad forventer vi af dig?




Du har en videregående uddannelse i software engineering, human centered AI el lign. fra DTU, ITU eller KU samt erfaring i data engineering
Du har enten fullstack MLOps erfaring, kan skrive Python og har lyst til data engineering-delen - eller måske kommer du i stedet med erfaring i at bygge datawarehouse og dataplatforme.
Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure
Du har erfaring med - og vil gerne blive klogere på - flere af følgende teknologier: Data Factory - Databricks - Fabric - Spark - Azure Synapse - Azure Machine Learning - MLflow - Data Warehouse - Data platform - Python - Azure DevOps, Powershell, Azure CLI, ARM templates, YAML, Bicep, Terraform, Git
Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
Du er flydende i skrift og tale på dansk og engelsk, og trives med at have den daglige kontakt med kunden
Du har evnen til at omsætte kundebehov til handling




Det vil være en fordel, hvis:

Du er vant til at arbejde som konsulent i et udviklingsteam i tæt samarbejde med arkitekter og software udviklere




Som person er du selvstændig, ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og serviceminded. Du er drevet af at lære nyt og vild med at holde dig ajour med de nyeste metoder og teknologier. Du er engageret og motiveret i alt hvad du foretager dig. Hvis du også er glad for at sparre med dygtige kollegaer og trives med at løfte i flok, vil du passe perfekt ind hos os.




Hvad tilbyder vi?




Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, udvikle og forbedre cVation.




Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?




Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.




Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.




Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.




Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag. Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig.




Interesseret?




Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Hvis du har under 5 års erfaring, bedes du også vedhæfte dine karakterblade i samme fil som dit CV. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.




Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:




Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com




Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Show more

Title: Student Assistant - Machine Learning
Place: København SV, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
In this role, you will be an integral part of our Data Insights and AI team, working closely on real-world projects that drive data-driven innovation. You’ll be involved in both the development and ideation of Machine Learning solutions, contributing to projects such as healthcare demand forecasting, staff allocation optimization, and service/vehicle demand prediction.


About The Job


Key Responsibilities:



ML Solutions Development: Assist in designing, implementing, and testing machine learning models for business applications including time-series forecasting, demand prediction, and resource optimization. Use Python libraries such as pandas, scikit-learn, Prophet, and TensorFlow to build robust ML solutions.
Model Development: Conduct comprehensive analysis on historical patterns, resource utilization, and operational metrics. Develop and validate predictive models that directly impact business decision-making and operational efficiency.
End-to-End ML Pipeline: Participate in the full ML lifecycle from data pre-processing and feature engineering to model training, validation, and deployment. Create interactive dashboards and applications to visualize predictions and insights.
Collaboration & Continuous Improvement: Work as part of a multidisciplinary team to integrate ML solutions. Propose innovative solutions to complex technical challenges while contributing to improving patient care and operational efficiency.


What We Offer:


Real-World Experience: Work on diverse projects that provide practical exposure to cutting-edge technologies.
Professional Development: Enjoy mentorship, regular feedback, and opportunities to boost your technical and soft skills.
Innovative Environment: Join a supportive team that values creativity, collaboration, and fresh perspectives.
Flexible Scheduling & Competitive Compensation: Gain valuable work experience while balancing your academic commitments.
Career Growth: Our Student Assistants have a proven pathway to transition into full-time roles within our organization.



About You


Qualifications:


Currently enrolled in a master’s program with a focus on Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, or a related quantitative field.
Proficiency in Python with experience in ML libraries such as XGBoost, PyTorch, Tensorflow/Keras, Prophet, etc.
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Exceptional problem-solving skills, a keen curiosity about recent advances in the field, and the ability to apply innovative solutions to real-world problems.


Preferred Skills:


Experience with Databricks platform for collaborative ML development and data engineering.
Experience with MLOps practices, model monitoring, and CI/CD for ML projects.
Demonstrated Projects & Contributions - a portfolio showcasing examples of your work is highly valued.



About Us


Our team is at the forefront of digital transformation, heading initiatives such as Falck Data Platform and FalckGPT (our internal LLM powered platform). We believe in fostering talent and building a strong pipeline of future leaders. Join us and be part of a team where your ideas and skills can make a significant impact.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We're looking for a hands-on Data Platform Engineer to join a high-impact team building a scalable AWS-based data platform for a trailblazer in AI governance and analytics. You’ll collaborate across engineering, DevOps, and compliance teams to drive performance, observability, and data integrity across systems.




Responsibilities

Architect and evolve a scalable, high-availability cloud infrastructure on AWS
Build robust data platforms to support large-scale analytics and governance tools
Implement automation through Infrastructure as Code and CI/CD workflows
Lead container orchestration with Kubernetes, Docker, Helm, and ArgoCD
Support data infrastructure compliance, performance tuning, and reliability
Ensure alignment with cloud security and data governance standards




Ideal Candidate

3+ years of AWS infrastructure and DevOps experience
Deep expertise with Kubernetes, Docker, and tools like Terraform or Pulumi
Programming experience in Python and Typescript
Familiarity with distributed data systems and SQL optimisation
Fluent in English
Problem-solver with a collaborative and pragmatic mindset




This role offers a competitive salary, flexible hybrid working, and a chance to grow within an innovative company shaping the future of trustworthy AI and data infrastructure.

Show more

  • Architect and evolve a scalable, high-availability cloud infrastructure on AWS

  • Implement automation through Infrastructure as Code and CI/CD workflows

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Vi arbejder kontinuerligt på at være en endnu mere datadreven organisation, og nu kan du være med på rejsen! Her får du muligheden for at blive en af vores eksperter i Power BI og spille en nøglerolle i udviklingen af fremtidens rapportering og i rådgivning af kollegaer på tværs af hele lufthavnen.

Du bliver en del af Data & Analytics, hvor vi er Center of Excellence med ansvar for analyse- og Power BI governance. Vi samarbejder tæt med dygtige analytikere i forretningen, som selv udvikler mange af deres løsninger. Vores rolle er at sikre kvalitet, ensartethed og støtte med rådgivning, undervisning og sparring.

Om at være Senior Data Analyst

Som Senior Data Analyst er du vores go-to person, når rapportering skal gå på tværs af forretningen, eller når ingen andre har taget bolden. Du planlægger og faciliterer workshops, hvor du med nysgerrighed og skarpe spørgsmål hjælper forretningen med at finde ud af, hvad de egentlig har brug for. Du er ikke bange for at udfordre, og du sørger for, at intet bliver overset.

Vi arbejder agilt med en dedikeret Product Owner, der holder styr på backloggen, prioriterer opgaver og sikrer fremdrift via Azure DevOps.

Derudover arbejder vi strategisk med citizen development for at demokratisere rapportering og data, og enable vores kollegaer til selv at udvikle løsninger i Power BI. Det gør vi også i høj grad med vores data community, DataHub, hvor du sammen med teamet har en vigtig rolle i at drive det til næste niveau og sikre udbredelse af best practices og viden på tværs i lufthavnen.

Vi ser frem til, at du bidrager med at

✈️Udvikle Power BI løsninger – især de større og koncernkritiske

✈️Drive vores Community of practice DataHub – inkl. oplæg og community engagement

✈️Sikre fremdrift i vores data literacy indsatser og identificere nye

✈️Definere og dokumentere best practices for udvikling, test og dokumentation af Power BI rapporter

✈️Udarbejde guidelines og undervise forretningen i brugen af Power BI.

Om hvordan du lykkes i jobbet

Du lykkes på den korte bane, når du forstår forretningens behov og kan lave Power BI løsningen ud fra hvad de har behov for og ikke ”bare”, hvad de vil have.

På den længere bane lykkes du, når du bidrager med din store erfaring og udvikler dig til vores absolutte ekspert ved løbende at holde dig opdateret på nye Power BI features og har lysten til at prøve dem af.

Du har formentlig en uddannelse indenfor IT eller dataanalyse, men det er ikke et krav. Det vigtigste er, at du har solid erfaring med Power BI og en stærk interesse for at arbejde med data.

Du motiveres af at gøre en forskel, både gennem dine egne løsninger og ved at hjælpe andre med at lykkes. Du trives med at dele din viden bl.a. gennem undervisning og community-aktiviteter.

Om afdelingen

Vi er et nyere, stadigt voksende team med en central rolle i at løfte datamodenheden.

Teamet består af både erfarne og nye kollegaer, og vi prioriterer både faglighed og fællesskab. Udviklingen i vores branche går stærkt, og derfor investerer vi løbende i kompetenceudvikling, bl.a. gennem konferencer, hackathons og interne læringsinitiativer.

Samtidig har vi det sjovt sammen på teamevents og torsdagsbarer, og vi tror på at stærke relationer skaber bedre resultater.

Om Sofie, din nye leder

Din nye leder er selv ny i CPH med opstart 1. oktober, men du vil møde hende til samtalerne så I lærer hinanden at kende. Her er, hvad hun siger om sig selv og sin ledelsesstil:

”Det er vigtigt for mig at have en åben og ærlig dialog med mine medarbejdere, med et særligt fokus på, at teamet selvstændigt skal kunne levere resultater. For mig betyder det, at du får meget ansvar og ejerskab for det du har lyst til at udvikle dig indenfor, både personligt og fagligt. Samtidig vægter jeg, at vi har det godt, så jeg gør en del ud af at sætte trivslen højt bl.a. ved at være tilgængelig når du har brug for det. ”

Om os | Hvad tilbyder vi

Du bliver en del af en helt særlig atmosfære og en organisation, der hver dag arbejder engageret for, at vores passagerer får den bedste rejseoplevelse.

Udover pension og IT-udstyr tilbyder vi

✈️Frihed til planlægning af dine opgaver – med mulighed for at arbejde hjemmefra efter aftale med din leder

✈️Fri parkering, cykelservice, bilrengøring og rabataftaler

✈️Fysioterapi og træningslokale, yoga, rådgivning fra træner mv.

✈️Sundhedssikring – børn er dækket automatisk

✈️Individuelle check-in samtaler.

Om ansøgningen | Stig ombord på dit nye job

Vi ser frem til at læse din ansøgning, så send den gerne snarest muligt. Vi ansætter når den rette kandidat lander i indbakken.

Ansøgninger modtages kun via vores rekrutteringssystem.

Har du spørgsmål til jobbet inden da, kan sende en mail til Tenna Ørum Kristensen, Director – Data & Analytics - tenna.oerum-kristensen@cph.dk.

Det er en forudsætning for ansættelse, at du kan blive politigodkendt, ligesom du skal kunne opretholde politigodkendelsen gennem hele din ansættelse.
Show more
HTML:

Her får du muligheden for at blive en af vores eksperter i Power BI og spille en nøglerolle i udviklingen af fremtidens rapportering og i rådgivning af kollegaer på tværs af hele lufthavnen.

Title: Register in our candidate data base
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Veo is a global leader in AI-based sports camera technology. Our innovative, fully automatic camera solution enables sports teams to record matches and training sessions without a camera operator. We’re democratizing the world of sports by granting video analysis for teams on all levels—a privilege that used to be only for the few. More than 40,000 clubs in 90+ countries record their games every week.

Growing as fast as we do in Veo means that every day is different, exciting, and challenging, both on the front line and in the back office.

But that’s not the most remarkable thing about us.

The coolest thing is our people. We’ve attracted some of the brightest minds in the industry. They are the reason we can create a great product and do it while enjoying ourselves.

Does your dream job at Veo not appear on the list, then sign up in our candidate data base and we will get in contact with you if the right opportunity arises for you.

At Veo, you'll be part of a thriving work environment where every day brings new excitement. Our rapid growth ensures a diverse and ever-changing atmosphere. We believe in work-life balance and providing a positive culture that allows you to thrive personally and professionally.

Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology – with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

Diversity and differences are valuable assets for us. We value diversity and inclusion and welcome people from all backgrounds. If you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we still encourage you to apply.

Values We Hold at Veo:

Dare - We take initiative, stay curious, and challenge the status quo in our work.

Own it - We drive impact by identifying opportunities, taking responsibility, and confidently executing.

Level up - We embrace growth, continuously learning and shaping our skills.

Play as a team - We collaborate across a diverse organization, leveraging shared insights for stronger outcomes.

Customer Centric - We deliver value by having close partnerships and a deep understanding of our customers (internally and externally)

We’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. And you may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
I have a new role for an experienced Data Engineer to work for a leading digital transformation partner, driving innovation with tailored IT solutions, expert consulting, and secure technology for businesses across diverse industries worldwide, who are going through an exciting growth phase.




There are based both in Denmark and this is a Hybrid position.




Responsibilities:

Create and optimize data platforms: Microsoft Fabric and Azure
Help future-proof customers' data platforms through cloud migration projects.
Use various technologies and resources to achieve desired results: SQL Server, Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Data Lake, Lakehouse, etc.
Collaborate throughout the development cycle – from ideation and requirements to development, testing and delivery, to ensure the Business Intelligence of the future.




Tech Stack - Microsoft Technologies




Salary - Up to 70,000 SEK p/m Depending on experience




Qualifications:

Minimum 5 years experience as a Data Engineer
Experience with Microsoft tool (Power BI / SQL / Databricks / Azure / Fabric)
Fluent Danish & English




This is a great opportunity for anyone that's looking for growth opportunities with one of the worlds biggest consultancies

Show more

  • Create and optimize data platforms: Microsoft Fabric and Azure
  • Help future-proof customers' data platforms through cloud migration projects.

Title: Student Assistant, Enterprise BI, Hørsholm
Place: Hørsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity’s biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It’s how we've gotten so far. And it’s how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We’re here to better our world with biology.

Join us as our new Student Assistant – Enterprise BI

Welcome to Enterprise BI

The Enterprise BI team work with enterprise business intelligence, data modelling, data warehousing reporting, planning, analytics and consolidation. We supply our many stakeholders across the business with high quality trusted data, provide a solid data foundation for analytics at all levels across Novonesis, and supply data for external reporting such as financials for the annual report and ESG.

You will be part of a team of skilled BI professionals with a broad portfolio of projects across all business areas, for you to contribute to.

To Succeed


You are a student of DTU, ITU, CBS or another relevant field
You have a background in IT, Computer Science, Business Administration or Mathematics
You have a strong analytical mind-set and a structured approach to problem solving
You have basic experience and interest in Business Intelligence and Analytics
Your should have some knowledge of database structure, data wrangling and data science either through your studies or from a relevant student job


Application deadline: 29th August 2025

Contact details: KMRA@novonesis.com

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is dedicated to fostering a unique community by embracing and respecting differences. We make all employment decisions based on business needs, ensuring that every individual can thrive, regardless of identity or background such as ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.

Stay alert: Avoid recruitment scams

At Novonesis, We Are Committed To Maintaining a Safe And Transparent Recruitment Process. Please Be Aware Of Potential Scams Targeting Job Seekers And Take Note Of The Following


Novonesis will never ask for sensitive personal information, such as bank account details, Social Security numbers, or passwords, at any stage of the hiring process.
Novonesis does not make employment offers without conducting interviews with candidates.


If you receive suspicious communication claiming to be from Novonesis, please do not share any personal or financial information. We encourage you to verify the legitimacy of the message by contacting us directly through our official channels.
Show more

Title: AI Trainer - Freelance Data Annotator
Description:
At Toloka, we connect smart, curious people from around the world with freelance online tasks that train and improve artificial intelligence.

What We Do

Toloka connects individuals with Generative AI projects from leading tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the full potential of AI by involving real people from around the world in the development process.

About The Role

Annotation is what helps AI make sense of the world. As an annotator, you may be invited to take part in online projects such as rating AI-generated content, evaluating factual accuracy, or comparing responses — when projects are available.

Responsibilities:


Carefully review provided data (text, images, or videos)
Label or classify content based on project guidelines
Identify and flag factually incorrect, sensitive, inappropriate, or unclear material


Important note: This is project-based work. Tasks are available only when projects are active. You may be invited to one or more projects depending on your profile and current opportunities.

Requirements


Bachelor's degree in any discipline
Advanced level of English (C1 or above), both written and spoken
Logical thinking, fact-checking and reasoning abilities
Strong attention to detail and ability to understand and follow complex instructions
Strong communication skills, including the ability to ask clarifying questions when needed
Genuine interest in technology and artificial intelligence


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Location: Copenhagen, Denmark

Job Type: Permanent

Industry: Financial Services / Capital Markets

Work Mode: Hybrid (On-site 4 days/week)




About the Client:

We have partnered with a Danish company specialising in Algorithmic Trading. The company has been the market leader in automating financial markets since 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.




About the role:

As part of this role, you’ll help design, optimize, and implement calibration and benchmarking frameworks, establish best practices for data processing pipelines, and prototype innovative predictive time-series models. With short feedback cycles, direct deployment, and minimal bureaucracy, your work will have immediate impact.




Team Environment:

You'll join a collaborative, intellectually curious team that values technical input and personal initiative. The group is composed of highly qualified researchers with deep experience in statistics, modelling, and machine learning, working closely with software engineering and trading teams. Knowledge-sharing is integral, and all members contribute code, ensuring mutual understanding across specialties.




Candidate Profile:

PhD or MSc in a quantitative discipline (engineering, physics, computer science, mathematics, or related fields)
3+ years of experience
Strong foundation in mathematics and statistics
Experience with the full machine learning development cycle—from data processing to deployment and monitoring
Proficiency in Python, especially for data processing and numerical analysis
Solid grasp of computer science principles
Analytical, scientific mindset
Right to work in Denmark(We can't offer sponsorship)




Bonus skills:

Experience handling large, complex datasets
Familiarity with frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, XGBoost, or CatBoost
Additional programming experience in languages like C# or C/C++




What’s offered:

Flat organizational structure fostering trust and autonomy
Challenging, interesting problems to solve
Supportive and highly skilled team
Modern workspace with a hybrid work model
Comprehensive benefits including pension, health insurance, and generous leave
Show more
