As part of this role, you’ll help design, optimize, and implement calibration and benchmarking frameworks, establish best practices for data processing pipelines, and prototype innovative predictive time-series models. With short feedback cycles, direct deployment, and minimal bureaucracy, your work will have immediate impact.


Team Environment:

You'll join a collaborative, intellectually curious team that values technical input and personal initiative. The group is composed of highly qualified researchers with deep experience in statistics, modelling, and machine learning, working closely with software engineering and trading teams. Knowledge-sharing is integral, and all members contribute code, ensuring mutual understanding across specialties.


Candidate Profile:

  • PhD or MSc in a quantitative discipline (engineering, physics, computer science, mathematics, or related fields)
  • 3+ years of experience
  • Strong foundation in mathematics and statistics
  • Experience with the full machine learning development cycle—from data processing to deployment and monitoring
  • Proficiency in Python, especially for data processing and numerical analysis
  • Solid grasp of computer science principles
  • Analytical, scientific mindset
  • Right to work in Denmark(We can't offer sponsorship)


Bonus skills:

  • Experience handling large, complex datasets
  • Familiarity with frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, XGBoost, or CatBoost
  • Additional programming experience in languages like C# or C/C++


What’s offered:

  • Flat organizational structure fostering trust and autonomy
  • Challenging, interesting problems to solve
  • Supportive and highly skilled team
  • Modern workspace with a hybrid work model
  • Comprehensive benefits including pension, health insurance, and generous leave

Title: Analytics Engineer Consultant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
📢 Join Our Data Consultancy Team! 📢




Are you an experienced and passionate data expert looking for your next challenge? Pyne is seeking an Analytics Engineer Consultant to join our innovative and growing team. At Pyne, you’ll have the opportunity to make a significant impact while working in a fast-paced and forward-thinking environment.




Who are we?




Mission:

We started on a mission to deliver great work with effective tooling. From day one, we’ve built rock-solid data foundations, enabling companies to improve with data quickly. Now, as AI reshapes every industry, we help businesses stay globally competitive by embedding AI-powered workflows where they matter most.




Vision:

Rethinking Workflows for the Age of AI. We see a future where data engineering, analytics, and AI converge seamlessly with human creativity and critical thinking. By re-imagining processes end-to-end, we enable organizations to scale more sustainably and intentionally – automating where it makes sense, and amplifying human insight where it doesn’t.




Responsibilities:

Work closely with our clients to understand their business needs, scope requirements, and identify opportunities where data and AI can create value.
Lead and manage projects from scoping to delivery, ensuring impactful outcomes and smarter solutions than our clients initially imagined.
Develop business-directed reports, apps, and models that optimise workflows and drive decision-making
Contribute to a learning culture and stay ahead of emerging tools and methods




Requirements

Strong business acumen.
Ability to take ownership of app and dashboard scoping and design in collaboration with clients, ensuring the final product meets their real needs, even when that means challenging their initial ideas.
Experience with BI tools and frameworks (e.g., Power BI, Steep, Metabase, Looker, Streamlit, etc.).
Experience with SQL and dbt.
Proactive communication and self-starter mentality.
Ability to manage multiple clients/projects in a dynamic environment.
Experience with Python and data platforms like Snowflake, BigQuery, Databricks, and Fabric are a plus.
Understanding of data modeling and warehousing best practices. Strong data engineering skills are a plus. 
Familiarity with AI and automation frameworks (e.g., GPT, MCP, Streamlit, Pydantic AI, LangChain, Ollama, etc.) are a plus.
Danish is a plus.




If you don’t tick every box but are excited about the role, we still encourage you to apply! We value curiosity, potential, and drive.




What we offer:

Competitive salary, reflecting your skills and experience level.
Flexible work arrangements, including remote work options.
Extra perks such as team trips abroad and events to foster a fun and engaging work environment.
Work from our office in SOHO Kødbyen, a dynamic office environment with lunch, snacks of your choice, protein bars, and coffee on Pyne.
Opportunity to work closely with a talented and diverse team of data professionals.
Exciting challenges and opportunities to grow together with this young company.
A supportive and inclusive company culture that values diversity and encourages continuous professional development.




Ready to take your data expertise to the next level? Join us in shaping the future of data consultancy! Send your resume and a brief cover letter highlighting your passion for data and relevant experiences to elin@pyne.dk. 




We can't wait to hear from you!




Learn more about us at https://pyne.dk

Title: Graduate Data Scientist
Place: Vester Hassing, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
The Company

Veovo is a market leader in Airport Smart Technology. With a global footprint of customers and capabilities that cover Airport Operations, Revenue management and Passenger Flow. Some of the world’s largest airports rely on Veovo.  Focused on driving airport performance, our solutions enable airports to handle more aircraft and more passengers, with less delays and less queues. Our platforms are built on a modern tech stack, often delivered from the cloud as SaaS and leveraging intelligence to enable our customer to “go brilliantly”.

Our clients span continents, but all share one thing in common~ they’re big names in airport excellence, with even bigger digital goals. With offices in the UK, Poland, Denmark, New Zealand and the US, Veovo offers a world of opportunity

At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports. At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports.

The Opportunity

We focus on solutions in the analysis of queue and movement patterns as well as capacity forecasts. Our product, is cloud-based system that collects and analyzes data via proprietary (Bluetooth / WiFi) sensors, as well as third-party data sources such as camera, radar, infrared counters, coils, boarding cards, calendars, etc.

The solution primarily helps airports to forecast passenger appearance, optimize staff resources, reduce queue and travel times, and improve the experience for the passengers. In addition, we also create solutions for road traffic, railway stations, ports, ski resorts and amusement parks, with similar work and end-results.

Are you ready to be part of the team that brings our brilliant solutions "live" around the world?

The size of our installations are growing rapidly, and we are therefore seeking a skilled analytical person, who can help implement our solutions to help airports predict passenger arrival and flow. The implementation covers requirements, design, and calibration of the system. The calibration is carried out in-house via the setup of our filtering engine.

The Specifics


Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
Combine models through ensemble modeling
Present information using data visualization techniques
Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges
Collaborate with engineering and product development teams


What we are looking for


Knowledge of R, SQL and Python; familiarity with Scala, Java or C++ is an asset
BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field
Analytical mind and business acumen
Experience in data mining
Problem-solving aptitude
Excellent communication and presentation skills


What we offer in return


A job in a growing industry.
Employment immediately or by agreement.
An exciting position in a company with good working conditions with an open, direct and informal tone
A company where ideas are accelerated into action, and everyone can play a part in the development.
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development through independent work assignments.
Workplace~ Hækken 2, Vester Hassing, 9310 Vodskov
37 hours working week

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst & Product Owner
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Aiming for new heights

At Scalepoint, we aim for the stars. Our ambition is clear: we want to conquer the world. We successfully help insurers help their customers. We support 26 insurers in five countries around Europe.




We’re on the lookout for a Business Intelligence Analyst & Product Owner who can combine analytical skills with the ability to prioritise, align stakeholders, and drive delivery for our BI-focused development team.




You’ll be part of our BI department, working alongside and collaborating closely with our Data Science colleagues, our Head of BI, and our development teams. Your role will be a mix of hands-on analysis, building internal reporting solutions, and acting as the link between business needs and technical execution—making sure the right things get built, and that they create real value inside the organisation.




What kind of geek are you?

At Scalepoint, you will meet other geeks. They love to go to work – just like you. We’ll be looking forward to working with you if you are a world champion when it comes to:




Business & data translator

You bridge the gap between business needs and technical delivery. You quickly grasp the essence of a request, challenge assumptions when needed, and turn it into clear, prioritised backlog items that our development team can execute on.




Adaptive learner

New domains, systems, and processes don’t intimidate you—you’re curious to understand them and skilled at asking the right questions. Whether it’s a new tool in our stack or a complex business workflow, you learn fast and apply your knowledge effectively.




Facilitator & decision-maker

You create clarity where there’s ambiguity. You’re comfortable leading discussions, aligning stakeholders, and making prioritisation calls that keep delivery moving—while ensuring the right people are informed at the right time.







What to dive into

At Scalepoint, we value people who take ownership and can both think strategically and deliver hands-on results. In this role, you will:




Act as Product Owner for our BI-focused development team—owning the backlog, refining requirements, and aligning delivery with the organisation’s priorities.
Lead the design and implementation of internal BI solutions that improve workflows, automate manual processes, and ensure data is reliable and accessible.
Develop and maintain reporting in Power BI and Fabric to support budgeting, invoicing, and operational decision-making.
Take responsibility for key BI processes such as budget cycles, month-end reporting, and yearly reviews—ensuring they run smoothly and deliver high-quality outputs.
Foster a culture of transparency and knowledge sharing so best practices and insights flow freely across teams and departments.




Are you ready to jump on our ride? Submit your application and CV now. We will review the applications and conduct interviews continuously.




If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact Head of Business Intelligence Morten Vang-Pedersen by phone at +45 27908047.







Would you like to join the journey?

You must be able to read & write Danish and English. You have preferably worked in a similar role, but most importantly you have something unique to offer and a drive to make a difference at Scalepoint.




Send your application and CV as soon as possible to job@scalepoint.com. Applications and interviews will be handled on a continuous basis, and we will close the position when we have found the right candidate.




If you have any questions, please feel free to Morten Vang-Pedersen on phone +45 27 90 80 47




About us

Scalepoint spirit in everyday life

Come as you are. That’s how we prefer it. You can easily leave dress codes, permanent lunch buddies, and corporate business attitudes at home. Our office is filled with kudos and high fives – and we believe that everyone is doing their best.




We have employees from 11 nationalities across our offices in Copenhagen, Poland and Switzerland. 63% of us ride a cycle to work. 42% eat vegetarian meals during lunch. 38% are parents. And 52% don't regularly work out. But our sport and events team tries to keep us moving by offering activities such as climbing, mountain biking, running and padel tennis. However, we cannot change the fact that we have a very generous attitude to sweets and cake. But that’s ok; there's a lot to celebrate at Scalepoint.




We look forward to hearing from you!




Show more

Title: Internship (Project - Data Collection and Analysis for AI-based ANC system)
Place: Kvistgård, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to work for some of the world’s leading audio brands? Become a part of the HARMAN team and get to work for JBL and Harman/Kardon.

By joining HARMAN, you'll dive headfirst into the exciting world of headphones, home speakers, portable speakers, party boxes and related audio technologies, and contribute to the success of Harman Lifestyle Consumer Audio business. The consumer audio industry is fast paced, fun and dynamic and we’re looking for someone who is proactive, loves to work with a lot of different stakeholders from all over Europe and has creative ideas.

You will join our global New Technology & Innovation (NT&I) team within Harman Lifestyle Consumer Audio, based in Kvistgaard, Denmark in the position of:

Internship (Data Collection & Analysis for AI-based ANC System)

Introduction: A Career at HARMAN Lifestyle

We’re a global, multi-disciplinary team that’s putting the innovative power of technology to work and transforming tomorrow. As a member of HARMAN Lifestyle, you connect consumers with the power of superior sound.


Contribute your talents to high-end, esteemed brands like JBL, Harman Kardon, Mark Levinson and Revel.
Unite your passion for audio innovation with high-tech product development.
Create pitch-perfect, cutting-edge technology that elevates listening experience.


About the Role:

The global New Technology & Innovation (NT&I) team is at the center of audio technology support in Harman’s innovative products. The team is seeking a talented and motivated student to join us for a six-month project on Data Collection & Analysis for AI-based ANC System.

What You Will Do:

Modern ANC systems are commonly based on using adaptive filters to react to variations in noise characteristics, wearing conditions and environments. We are now advancing to explore how we can use AI in ANC systems and to enable that, a database is needed. The scope of this project is primarily to build the database that can be used for exploring the AI solutions.

The main task of this project is to build a database of ANC related recordings and transfer functions measured on at least 20 people, and on multiple formfactors.


Perform recordings of different noise types in multiple conditions, using headphone prototypes equipped with transducers.
Analyze the data, deriving the relevant transfer functions and performing statistics.
Organize the dataset for convenient use.
Analyze whether the secondary path can be parameterized, and whether this is sensitive in terms of formfactor.
Hands-on ANC tuning based on the data gathered.
Additional work: Support in setting up automated tests for adaptive ANC.


What You Need to Be Successful:

We are looking for a motivated individual with the following qualifications.


Master’s student with good grades in audio signal processing and mathematics.
Strong programming skill in MATLAB and Python.
Experience with using audio hardware and audio laboratories.
Excellent communication skills.
Excellent written and spoken English, ability to work as part of an international team.


Even though the work is in applied research area, we expect an analytical mindset, ability to learn quickly, work independently, and being able to identify problems and find solutions.

What We Offer:


HARMAN offers a diverse and inclusive work environment that fosters and encourages career development opportunities, professional training and competitive market base compensation. You will also receive top-notch employee discounts on world-class Harman and Samsung products (JBL, HARMAN Kardon, AKG, etc.)
Flexible work schedule with a culture encouraging work life integration and collaboration in a global friendly working atmosphere and good work-life-balance.
Professional development opportunities through HARMAN University’s business and leadership academies.
Competitive wellness benefits.
Tuition Reimbursement.
Internal talent management leadership acceleration programs.
“Be Brilliant” employee recognition and rewards program.
A unique opportunity to contribute to drive revenue growth and nurture strategic trust-based relationships.
The chance to work with on complex problems and continues improvement.

Title: Data Center Engineer
Place: Nørre Nebel, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Deployment / In-Scope Configuration Items




Servers (Virtual & Physical)
Storage & Backup Devices
Server Appliances
Hyper Converged Infrastructure (E.g. Nutanix, Cisco UCS)
Tape Storage Units
Power Distribution Units rated 3KVA and below
SAN Fabric Switches
Network Switches
KVM Units
WAN Optimization Devices
Firewalls
Access Points
Routers
Physical Cabling
Cable Management
Cables which connect the device to itself, a peripheral, or a power/network port

Power Cycling
Running Diagnostics Commands
Conducting whole unit replacement
Inserting/Removing Media
Replacing Defective Components
Assist with fault diagnosis and investigation
Configuring Remote Access
Basic Storage Array Configuration
Replacing faulty cables
Tape Management and Maintenance
Rebooting routers, servers, storage devices or other equipment
Providing loop-back cables in order to test circuits remotely
Re-seating or replacing components or cables
Cleaning fibers
Identify/Analyze fiber issues by using OTDR/LSPM/VFL
Installing loop backs
Racking and de-racking and upgrade of any device installed.

Place: Viborg Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark

Title: Data Center Engineer
Description:
Job Requirements:




1. Good general understanding of IT principles such as Networks, Hardware and Domains.

2. Knowledge of Infrastructure (Data Center and Network) hardware architecture as to understand the procedure shared by L3 teams during troubleshooting, H&E support.

3. Knowledge of server/client operations in a domain environment including Active Directory.

4. Understanding of current and legacy hardware Infrastructure platforms.

5. Hands-on experience in installation and troubleshooting Infrastructure (DC & Network) equipment's, Rack and Stack of the equipment/cable.

6. Good Hands-on Experience in IMAC and Break-fix activities related to Infrastructure environment.

7. Ability to identify Excellent the right defective spares and replace them with provided good spares as instructed and by physical observations.

8. Knowledge of TCP/I P standards and networking.

9. Experience with Tape Management activities.

10. Excellent knowledge of best practices around management, control, and monitoring of server infrastructure.

11. Familiarity with backup and recovery software and methodologies.

12. Updating and Recording of activities in relevant IT Ticket Management System.

13. Coordinating and agreeing attendance time and date with key stakeholders.

14. Provide support either through phone, remote tools, or in person at onsite.

15. Perform installation as needed either through physical or network medium.

16. Coordinate actual activity date and timings including arrival and departure times.

17. Carry all necessary tools, laptops etc. which might be needed to support issues in the infrastructure environment.

18. Labelling, Patching and Asset Tagging activities.







Deployment / In-Scope Configuration Items




• Servers (Virtual & Physical)

• Storage & Backup Devices

• Hyper Converged Infrastructure (E.g. Nutanix, Cisco UCS)

Title: Football Statistician (Data Collection)
Place: Aarhus Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
JOIN OUR TEAM AT GENIUS SPORTS!




WHO ARE WE?




Genius Sports is the official data, technology, and commercial partner driving the connection between sports, betting, and media on a global scale. Our mission is to create a more sustainable sports data network powered by rich, official live data. To achieve this, we're seeking enthusiastic Statisticians to join our team and collect match data while attending live sporting events.




ARE YOU PASSIONATE ABOUT FOOTBALL?




If you love football and want to be part of the action while getting paid, this is your opportunity! We are looking for individuals in the Aarhus area to collect official in-game statistics from football events in Superliga; 1st Division; 2nd Division, 3rd Division and the Danish Cup.




As a Statistician, you will use our user-friendly smartphone-enabled software to report live events, including every shot, goal, tackle, and save. Don’t worry if you lack previous reporting experience - we provide comprehensive e-learning courses and practical training to ensure you’re fully prepared to cover live games. This is the perfect chance for sports enthusiasts to earn extra income while doing something they love.




WHAT WE OFFER:

Guaranteed base pay of €70 per game
A performance-based reward system
Coverage of travel expenses

If you’re eager to immerse yourself in the world of sports and want to be part of our global network of statisticians, we want to hear from you!




JOB REQUIREMENTS:

Basic level in English
Regular availability for a few hours on weekends and weekday evenings
Familiarity with using a smartphone
Willingness to travel
A strong knowledge of football
Reliability, commitment, organization, and integrity
Exceptional attention to detail




GET TO KNOW US:

For more information about our mission and values, visit: Genius Sports




ARE YOU READY TO JOIN THE GENIUS SPORTS TEAM?

If you’re excited about this opportunity, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now and become a vital part of our team!

Title: Senior Product Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Scheduling isn't simply filling shifts. It's finding the sweet spot that enables businesses to grow and team members to enjoy the perfect work/life balance.






At Planday from Xero, we aim to use Agentic AI to build a future where managers can seamlessly free up invaluable time for their business and teams. We're not just building software: we're on a mission to make shift work more human, to change work/life balance from a luxury to a reality for all shift workers. We're using advanced technology to help humans reach their full potential. At work and in life.






Founded in 2004, Planday is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark and helps create perfect schedules for hundreds of thousands of users across the world.






As a Senior Product Analyst, you'll play a strategic role in transforming complex data into actionable insights that directly fuel our business growth and critical decisions. In this role, you'll bejoining our Data & Analytics team and will be reporting to our Head of Data.






You'll craft compelling data narratives, turning raw information into valuable assets that guide product development and key strategic choices. Collaborating across teams, you'll uncover pivotal metrics and deep customer insights, empowering informed decisions throughout Planday. Through impactful visualizations and persuasive communication, you'll ensure these insights resonate with stakeholders at all levels. Furthermore, you'll leverage advanced analytical techniques to pioneer predictive modeling and automation, fostering a culture of data-driven innovation that is central to Planday's continued success.







What you'll do

Collaborate cross-functionally with product, commercial, and leadership teams to define, track, and report critical metrics, delivering comprehensive customer insights.
Design and maintain robust data models that transform raw data into high-value assets, ensuring accuracy and quality.
Develop impactful, hands-on solutions, visualizations, and dashboards across the business, primarily utilizing Tableau to communicate insights effectively.
Leverage expert proficiency in Python, R, and SQL for advanced data manipulation, statistical analysis, and ensuring high data quality.
Apply advanced statistical analysis techniques for summarizing, interpreting, and predicting data, alongside machine learning concepts for predictive modeling techniques.
Translate complex data into clear, actionable narratives through compelling data storytelling, impactful presentations, and strong interpersonal communication.







Success looks like

Creating exceptional data models that consistently deliver accurate, high-quality data assets, underpinning strategic initiatives.
Proactively delivering actionable insights and critical metrics that directly lead to informed decisions and tangible business improvements for product and commercial teams.
Developing and implementing intuitive and highly impactful visualizations and dashboards that significantly elevate data-driven decision-making across Planday.
Providing insights and recommendations that are consistently trusted and acted upon by product and commercial teams, stemming from rigorous analysis and robust data practices.
Communicating complex data insights clearly, fostering understanding and alignment among stakeholders, resulting in measurable positive business impact.
Solving problems proactively and addressing data-related challenges, leading to continuous improvement and advancement in our analytical capabilities.
Sucessfully exploring and implementing advanced analytical techniques, including machine learning, to unlock new opportunities and generate groundbreaking insights.







What you'll bring with you

Proven expertise in Python, R, and advanced SQL (including window functions, CTEs) for advanced data management and statistical analysis.
Proficiency in crafting compelling data stories, leveraging visualization tools like Tableau to transform complex datasets into clear, impactful visualizations that resonate with diverse stakeholders.
Proven capability in product opportunity sizing, metric development, and building robust metric trees to guide product strategy and evaluation.
Mastery of advanced statistical analysis techniques, including hypothesis testing, various regression models, and time series analysis for forecasting.
Solid understanding and practical experience with user activity tracking tools like Mixpanel, Amplitude, or similar product analytics platforms.
Demonstrated ability to lead and optimize data wrangling and cleaning processes across multiple, complex projects.
Experience in designing and analyzing experiments (e.g., A/B tests) to establish causal relationships and inform data-driven decision-making.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of translating complex data insights into compelling narratives through data storytelling and high-impact presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.
A highly analytical mindset, consistently identifying and solving complex data challenges with innovative solutions that directly drive data-driven strategic decisions.
Practical application of machine learning fundamentals to solve specific business problems through predictive modeling.







At Planday, we offer you

Benefits like pension, health insurance, inclusive support for new parents and generous vacation
On top of your annual base salary, you are offered to be part of an Employee Share Plan
Growth and progression opportunities – we want you to grow with us
Flexible remote work
Strong social culture with lots of team and company activities
Meaningful work – everyone at Planday contributes to improving the lives of shift workers around the globe
Healthy work-life balance and autonomous approach to work. We trust in you and your abilities







Finally, our offices are not just workplaces (although they are pretty nice and well-located, we have to say!). Plandayers are open and welcoming and at Planday, everyone has the freedom and support to show their true self at work.






At Planday, we firmly believe that diversity and inclusion are the cornerstones of innovation and a vibrant workplace culture, and we highly value the strength that diverse backgrounds offer.






As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to create an equitable experience for all our candidates throughout the process. Please let us know if you need reasonable accommodation during the application or interview process.






All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to any personal characteristics.

Show more

Title: Data Center Engineer
Description:
Job Responsibilities:

Cleaning tools testing, reporting, install cables or optics for new circuits. physical cabling, cable management, northbound cabling, (Fiber/Copper/Power).
Support network and server teams by assisting with rack and stack and running cables. Planned/Predictive maintenance or circuit migration support
Labelling, patching, and asset tagging activities, perform installation as needed either through physical or network medium.
Follow specific task instructions and provision necessary reporting as necessary and support either through phone, remote tools, or in person at onsite.
Conduct failure analysis, perform functional testing of entire system/Identify failed Component, planned maintenance or circuit migration support.
Reseating or swapping new line cards
Making, crimping and testing RJ45 Copper Cables

BreakFix/Technical Task List:

Cleaning fibers, replace the faulty optical cable. Installing loopbacks, BER testing
Inserting/removing/replacing defective components. Linecards, Fibers, etc... Assist with fault diagnosis and investigation with RMA Processing.
Configuring remote access, basic storage array configuration, replacing faulty cables.
Rebooting linecards, chassis or reseating of cards/optics
Providing loop-back cables to test circuits remotely, re-seating or replacing components or cables
Power cycling, and conducting whole unit replacement.




Preferred Skillsets: Technical Experience:

hands-on experience in installation and troubleshooting Infrastructure (DC & Network) equipment's, rack, and stack of the equipment/cable.
Infrastructure (Data center and network) hardware architecture as to understand the procedure shared by L3 teams during troubleshooting, HS&E support.
Knowledge of Nokia, Ciena Hardware.
Understanding of ILA Hut jobsites
Good understanding of IT principles such as networks, hardware.
Fiber/Data/Copper cable installation and maintaining; include working with MPO fibers.
Hands-on experiences in IMAC and break-fix activities related to infrastructure environment.
Ability to identify defective spares and replace them with provided good spares as instructed and by physical observations.

Job Responsibilities:

  1. Cleaning tools testing, reporting, install cables or optics for new circuits. physical cabling, cable management, northbound cabling, (Fiber/Copper/Power).
  2. Support network and server teams by assisting with rack and stack and running cables. Planned/Predictive maintenance or circuit migration support
  3. Labelling, patching, and asset tagging activities, perform installation as needed either through physical or network medium.

  5. Conduct failure analysis, perform functional testing of entire system/Identify failed Component, planned maintenance or circuit migration support.

  7. Making, crimping and testing RJ45 Copper Cables

Title: Deputy Data Director
Place: Listed, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Position Summary

Mission for Arizona, the 2020 Arizona Democratic Coordinated Campaign, is seeking a highly motivated and organized Deputy Data Director for our statewide program. The AZ Coordinated Campaign will play a critical role in electing Mark Kelly, and Democrats up and down the ballot including U.S. House and State Legislative districts across the state.

Key Responsibilities


Work with in-state and national stakeholders to accomplish the following:
Design and build reports and tools for the Arizona Coordinated team in line with key programmatic priorities, including, but not limited to Organizing, Mobilization, and Voter Protection teams
Assist in developing targeting and resource allocation
Create and maintain data standards to ensure data capture and hygiene
Develop and present VAN | Votebuilder training materials to the Organizing Team in statewide, small group and one-on-one settings
Respond to data support requests and flags
Support other members of the Data Team to complete projects as necessary


Preferred Skills & Qualifications


Willingness to learn and adapt to new skills and platforms used by other team members
Ability to communicate effectively within teams and across departments
A desire to thrive in a fast-paced work environment and implement creative solutions to unique problems
A technical skillset that includes familiarity or proficiency in a variety of programming languages/software such as (but not limited to) MS Excel, Google Suite, SQL, Tableau, Python, QGIS and R
One previous cycle of campaign experience or equivalent political experience in a technical role and familiarity with Votebuilder / VAN preferred
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail

The AZ Coordinated Campaign will play a critical role in electing Mark Kelly, and Democrats up and down the ballot including U.S. House and State Legislative districts across the state.

Key Responsibilities

  • Work with in-state and national stakeholders to accomplish the following:
  • Design and build reports and tools for the Arizona Coordinated team in line with key programmatic priorities, including, but not limited to Organizing, Mobilization, and Voter Protection teams
  • Assist in developing targeting and resource allocation
  • Create and maintain data standards to ensure data capture and hygiene
  • Develop and present VAN | Votebuilder training materials to the Organizing Team in statewide, small group and one-on-one settings
  • Respond to data support requests and flags
  • Support other members of the Data Team to complete projects as necessary

Preferred Skills & Qualifications

  • Willingness to learn and adapt to new skills and platforms used by other team members
  • Ability to communicate effectively within teams and across departments
  • A desire to thrive in a fast-paced work environment and implement creative solutions to unique problems
  • A technical skillset that includes familiarity or proficiency in a variety of programming languages/software such as (but not limited to) MS Excel, Google Suite, SQL, Tableau, Python, QGIS and R
  • One previous cycle of campaign experience or equivalent political experience in a technical role and familiarity with Votebuilder / VAN preferred
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new Data Engineer

In MFT Energy we trade energy to make markets efficient and to facilitate the green transition. We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our ambitious Data Value team with experienced colleagues who strive to be the best every day.

The Job as Data Engineer

As our new Data Engineer, you will be part of a passionate Data Value team dedicated to making it easy, efficient, and enjoyable to work with data at MFT Energy. In this role, you will help design, develop, and maintain the data platforms that serve as the backbone of our trading operations. You will work closely with business and back-office teams, acting as an internal consultant to guide them in implementing new platforms and adopting data-driven practices. Beyond building systems, you will empower colleagues by facilitating internal courses, knowledge-sharing data communities, and introducing innovative tools and technologies.

Our team of six brings together diverse expertise in data engineering, business intelligence, data science, and finance. Together, we thrive on curiosity, collaboration, and a shared commitment to exploring new technologies. The current tech stack at MFT Energy includes Azure SQL Database, Dagster, Databricks, StarRocks, Azure Data Explorer, and Power BI. But the landscape is always evolving, as new tech is evaluated and incorporated, and old or obsolete platforms are removed.

You will report directly to our Head of Data Value, Janus Søndergaard.

Your Key Responsibilities


Empower our business teams to make smarter, faster decisions with data
Build, evolve, and keep our platforms rock-solid and scalable
Turn bold ideas into reality by driving proof-of-concepts for new solutions
Stay curious - spot, test, and champion new tech that fits MFT Energy’s ambitions
Be a key player in the Data Value team, contributing your unique strengths and raising the bar for everyone


Your Qualifications And Personal Skills


Minimum 3 years of experience from a similar role
Self driven
Strong SQL skills
Strong Python skills
Experience with data orchestration platforms
Experience with Power BI
Excellent communication skills and a proactive approach
Strong analytic skills and an eye for detail
The ability to work independently and structure your workload
A positive and competitive attitude, but at the same time a valued team player
Fluent in English, both spoken and written, as our company language is English.


Working in MFT Energy

At MFT Energy, we combine a startup mindset with the strength of a global organization. We believe in empowering individuals to make data-driven decisions in a fast-paced environment where collaboration, innovation, and entrepreneurial thinking are the cornerstones of our success. We are around 200 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C, and from our international offices in Turkey, Australia, New York, Singapore, Japan, and several remote colleagues working from all over the world.

We Offer


A fast-paced, global environment where entrepreneurial thinking is celebrated
A people-centered leadership approach with a flat organizational structure
The chance to one day become partner
Great employee benefits and a strong focus on employee wellbeing
High degree of flexibility and the autonomy to make an impact


Make the Most of Your Talent! Join us!

If you think there is a fit between our values and your aspirations, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with a short cover letter and CV. For questions, please write to career@mft-energy.com

We will be screening and interviewing candidates on an ongoing basis.

As a global and independent energy trading hub, we specialize in power, gas, and environmentals trading 24/7 in 41 countries. At MFT Energy, we innovate energy trading through our people and technology, supported by our unique partner model. Our belief is that fostering a sense of ownership among employees is the most effective way to advance our business.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
At Vipps MobilePay, we’re simplifying life for millions of people across the Nordics, and data is at the heart of making that happen. As a Data Engineer in our friendly and ambitious Aarhus team, you’ll play a key role in making data accessible, trusted, and impactful — helping millions of people in the Nordics enjoy simpler lives, while working closely with colleagues across teams, locations, and disciplines.

This is a great opportunity if you’ve got a few years of experience and are ready to take the next step, growing your skills, solving meaningful challenges, and making a real impact on one of the most loved digital products in the Nordics.







💡 What you’ll be doing

You’ll be part of the Data Product Hub in the Data & Insights area, collaborating with 17 data professionals across Aarhus, Copenhagen, and Oslo, and partnering with colleagues across the business to turn data into insights and solutions that make a real difference for our users

.We build the platform, tools, and models that make data accessible, discoverable, and trusted across the company. By enabling teams to easily consume and use data—from infrastructure and data modeling to analysis, we enable smarter, data-informed decisions in daily work and product development, helping shape better experiences for millions of users.







Some of the things you’ll get to do:

Develop, build and maintain data pipelines and data models using tools like dbt, Databricks, SQL, and Python.
Ensure data is accurate, trusted, and easy to find — enabling smart, data-driven decisions company-wide.
Collaborate with colleagues across disciplines, from product managers to analysts, developers, and sales, to understand needs and turn them into valuable data solutions.
Take on challenges ranging from improving how we measure product performance to enabling smoother customer journeys through data.
Share knowledge through pair programming, technical discussions, and contributing to our internal data community.
Contribute to a culture of continuous improvement, celebrating wins, running retros, and always looking for ways to work smarter.
Experiment and grow, try new things with the support of your team




This is a hands-on role with room to expand your skills and influence how we work and evolve our data platform over time.




🧠 Who we’re looking for

We believe great engineers are made through experience and curiosity. You don’t need to know everything, but you should be eager to learn, proactive in finding solutions, and comfortable working closely with people as much as with technology.




You might be a great fit if you:

Are comfortable working with data tools and concepts and working with tools like SQL, Python, dbt and cloud platforms. Experience using Databricks and Azure is a plus, but not a requirement.
Enjoy working closely with others — across technical and non-technical teams. You are not afraid to ask questions, share ideas, or offer help.
Have experience creating and/or evolving data models and/or a data platform to support a variety of user needs.
Are motivated by solving problems for your users, creating a great user experience and seeing the results of your work in action.
You want to improve over time and are open to feedback and not afraid to try, experiment and learn.
Communicate clearly and enjoy turning complexity into something understandable and usable.
Ideally, you’ll bring around 3 years of hands-on experience in data engineering or a similar role — but if you have a bit less and can demonstrate strong skills, drive, and a learning mindset, we’d still love to hear from you.
Are fluent in English — our everyday working language.




Bonus points if you:

Like talking to stakeholders, understanding needs, and helping shape roadmaps.
Have experience building scalable data products to support things like product analytics or personalization.




✨ What you’ll get from us

Real responsibility from day one, the support to grow with it and a voice in shaping how we work and evolve our data platform.
The opportunity to help build one of the most loved digital products in the Nordics.
Learning and development alongside experienced colleagues across Denmark and Norway.
A social, down-to-earth team that cares about the work and each other.
Hybrid setup: Work from our beautiful Aarhus office, with the flexibility to work up to 2 days from home.
Friday bars, hikes, ping pong, padle tennis, and more.
Work-life balance: We work smart and keep wellbeing in focus.




📬 How to apply

Click the button, answer a few quick questions, and you’re all set. We review applications continuously. We’d love to hear from you.




About the company

We’re one Nordic mobile wallet that was once two: Vipps from Norway and MobilePay from Denmark. Now, we’re united with a shared goal: to make payments easy, smart, and accessible. We serve over 12 million users and 500,000 points of sale across the Nordics — and process more than 1.3 billion transactions every year.

We’re proud of our culture, where #oneteam, #keepitsimple, and #noworries are more than just hashtags. We believe diversity makes us better and welcome everyone, regardless of background or identity.

Show more

Title: Student Assistant for advanced analytics
Place: Fredericia, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us in this role where you’ll help develop data and statistically driven tools for our trading floor. You’ll influence decisions and handle tasks on your own, thereby contributing with your knowledge and expertise.

Welcome to Bioenergy

You’ll be part of Advanced Analytics where you, together with your colleagues, will will develop forecasts, analyses, and dashboards which provide our trading floor with a strong basis for data and statistical driven decision making in the daily operation at our Danish power stations, wind turbines, solar PV, electric boilers, heat pumps, and P2X. As a team, we continuously strive to do better and develop our skillset. We have an informal and very open culture and you’ll always be able to get help and learn from your colleagues.

You’ll play an important role in:


developing and implementing performance tracking
developing dashboards to visualise decision support and performance tracking
developing and implementing forecasting models using AI/ML/DL, incl. stochastic modelling and statistical data analysis
communicating and collaborating with internal and external stakeholders, i.e., team members, traders, etc.


To succeed in the role, you:


are currently studying data science, applied mathematics, or another relevant course within analytics and/or engineering
have at least two years left before graduating
are a strong Python programmer
have experience with writing and reviewing maintainable and testable code
are familiar with machine-learning concepts (supervised and unsupervised learning) and data analytics
have knowledge of Azure DevOps, Docker & Kubernetes, or electricity markets as a plus.


Maybe you’ve read the above and can see you have some transferable skills, even though they don’t quite match all the points. If you think you can bring something to the team, we still encourage you to apply.

Shape the future with us

Send your application and CV to us as soon as possible. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we’ve found the right candidate.

As an applicant or employee, you may request reasonable work and position accommodation or adjustments via accommodation@orsted.com.

Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country. We don't take applications or inquiries from external recruiters or agencies into account for this position.
Show more

Title: Consultant - McKinsey Digital
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have:


Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.


Your Impact

As a junior associate, you will join a client service team and take ownership of a workstream to solve some of the toughest challenges our clients face. And these aren’t just any clients—they're some of the most influential organizations around, from Fortune 500 giants to innovative startups. We will expect you to go the extra mile, delivering solutions that solve immediate problems and drive long-term change. And we’ll rely on your judgment and integrity to ensure our recommendations are effective and long-lasting.

You will take on a role that goes beyond advising. You’ll be at the heart of the action—helping to uncover the true challenges behind a client’s strategy and creating actionable plans that drive real change. Working alongside clients and other McKinsey colleagues, you’ll combine research, analyzing data, interviews, and brainstorming to generate fresh insights and breakthrough solutions. Your commitment to our values will be crucial in earning our clients' trust and delivering results that matter.

As you collaborate directly with clients, you’ll help them solve problems, refine strategies, and implement transformations. By equipping them with the tools and knowledge to continue innovating and improving after we’ve left, you’ll ensure the impact of our work endures. In doing so, you’ll uphold McKinsey’s commitment to making a meaningful difference in the industries and communities we serve.

Read more about McKinsey Digital here.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Degree in a technical subject such as computer science, engineering, IT, hard sciences or mathematics; advanced degree is a plus
Excellent organization capabilities, including the ability to initiate tasks independently and see them through to completion.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, in English and local office language(s), with the ability to adjust your style to suit different perspectives and seniority levels.
Proficient in rational decision making based on data, facts, and logical reasoning.
Ability to create work product-focused materials / outputs, which may include PowerPoint decks, Excel models, articles, or other written deliverables.
Exceptional time management to meet your responsibilities in a complex and largely autonomous work environment.
Ability to work or attend meetings outside of traditional business hours or take on projects with limited or no notice at times.
Ability to travel to and work in varying environments that may be challenging and/or not accessible (e.g., factories, hospitals, mines).
Show more

Title: Analyst
Description:
Do you enjoy simplifying complexity, working with many stakeholders, and helping people succeed through better digital tools? Are you able to listen, challenge, and guide decision-making in areas where opinions are strong and diverse? Do you see the value in working with data?

If so, BESTSELLER TECH is looking for you to join our Master Data team as our new Analyst.

YOUR TEAM

Join BESTSELLER TECH’s Master Data team – a dedicated and collaborative group based in Brande and Aarhus. We meet weekly in person, thrive on strong partnerships, and take pride in building and owning our own systems. Together, we make sure data is structured, governed and geared for the future.

You’ll work closely with teams across sourcing, retail coordination, country admin, TECH and finance. Our current priorities include improving data quality, reducing duplicates, cleaning up outdated processes, and assigning clear ownership across core entities. Long-term, we’ll also explore new technologies to strengthen our foundation further.

YOUR ROLE

As our new Analyst, you will bridge business and technology to improve the way BESTSELLER handles its most critical data—covering customers, suppliers, users, and locations. Your core mission will be to understand how our business works, identify where we can do better, and collaborate with developers to create sustainable and scalable solutions.

You will take part in the entire lifecycle: from early dialogue and process understanding to defining user stories, supporting testing, and guiding rollouts. You'll help us turn manual, fragmented work into structured, automated processes that support our brands and functions worldwide.

More specifically, you will


Analyze business needs and system landscapes to propose efficient, scalable solutions.
Collaborate across global teams to align on priorities and outcomes.
Participate in or lead workshops to align expectations, challenge assumptions, and uncover root causes of data challenges.
Support the delivery and rollout of features, including communication, documentation, and change support.
Help drive a more data-driven culture through knowledge sharing, training, and structured guidance with our stakeholders.
Assist in driving and expanding a shared Data Governance framework across Master Data entities.


YOUR PROFILE

You are a people-oriented problem solver with a curious mindset and a passion for meaningful change. You thrive in complex environments and feel energised by the opportunity to improve how things work – and how they could work better. You’re confident facilitating dialogue across diverse teams and turning input into action. You ask the right questions, challenge assumptions, and make progress – even when perspectives vary.

We imagine you bring:


Experience working with data – such as modeling, structuring, and organizing complex datasets.
A strong analytical mindset and the ability to uncover improvement opportunities through business process analysis.
Solid communication skills and an ability to guide stakeholders.
Comfortable educating users and stakeholders about master data management principles and how to apply them in daily operations.
Experience with SQL and process design or system development is an advantage.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.


WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU

If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact Jacob Zachariasen at +45 52 15 10 61. To apply, send us your CV as soon as possible and no later than 1st of September 2025. We review and interview candidates on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to close the job ad once we find the right candidate.

Location: Brande or Aarhus.

About Bestseller Tech

We are more than 400 people strong, located in Denmark, Spain and Rwanda. We are excited about what we do, but there’s more to us than our tech stack. We are young at heart and thrive in a flat organization. Our teams are agile and empowered with end-to-end responsibility. We want to be at the forefront of the newest technologies, and we move forward together. Every day. If you want to play a significant part in empowering our business, then welcome to BESTSELLER TECH. BESTSELLER TECH is part of the worldwide fashion company BESTSELLER. For more information, please go to www.bestseller.com.

HTML:
Do you enjoy simplifying complexity, working with many stakeholders, and helping people succeed through better digital tools? Are you able to listen, challenge, and guide decision-making in areas where opinions are strong and diverse? Do you see the value in working with data?

If so, BESTSELLER TECH is looking for you to join our Master Data team as our new Analyst.

YOUR TEAM

Join BESTSELLER TECH’s Master Data team – a dedicated and collaborative group based in Brande and Aarhus. We meet weekly in person, thrive on strong partnerships, and take pride in building and owning our own systems. Together, we make sure data is structured, governed and geared for the future.

You’ll work closely with teams across sourcing, retail coordination, country admin, TECH and finance. Our current priorities include improving data quality, reducing duplicates, cleaning up outdated processes, and assigning clear ownership across core entities. Long-term, we’ll also explore new technologies to strengthen our foundation further.

YOUR ROLE

As our new Analyst, you will bridge business and technology to improve the way BESTSELLER handles its most critical data—covering customers, suppliers, users, and locations. Your core mission will be to understand how our business works, identify where we can do better, and collaborate with developers to create sustainable and scalable solutions.

You will take part in the entire lifecycle: from early dialogue and process understanding to defining user stories, supporting testing, and guiding rollouts. You'll help us turn manual, fragmented work into structured, automated processes that support our brands and functions worldwide.

More specifically, you will

  • Analyze business needs and system landscapes to propose efficient, scalable solutions.
  • Collaborate across global teams to align on priorities and outcomes.
  • Participate in or lead workshops to align expectations, challenge assumptions, and uncover root causes of data challenges.
  • Support the delivery and rollout of features, including communication, documentation, and change support.
  • Help drive a more data-driven culture through knowledge sharing, training, and structured guidance with our stakeholders.
  • Assist in driving and expanding a shared Data Governance framework across Master Data entities.

YOUR PROFILE

You are a people-oriented problem solver with a curious mindset and a passion for meaningful change. You thrive in complex environments and feel energised by the opportunity to improve how things work – and how they could work better. You’re confident facilitating dialogue across diverse teams and turning input into action. You ask the right questions, challenge assumptions, and make progress – even when perspectives vary.

We imagine you bring:

  • Experience working with data – such as modeling, structuring, and organizing complex datasets.
  • A strong analytical mindset and the ability to uncover improvement opportunities through business process analysis.
  • Solid communication skills and an ability to guide stakeholders.
  • Comfortable educating users and stakeholders about master data management principles and how to apply them in daily operations.
  • Experience with SQL and process design or system development is an advantage.
  • Fluent in English, both written and spoken.

WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU

If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact Jacob Zachariasen at +45 52 15 10 61. To apply, send us your CV as soon as possible and no later than 1st of September 2025. We review and interview candidates on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to close the job ad once we find the right candidate.

Location: Brande or Aarhus.

About Bestseller Tech

We are more than 400 people strong, located in Denmark, Spain and Rwanda. We are excited about what we do, but there’s more to us than our tech stack. We are young at heart and thrive in a flat organization. Our teams are agile and empowered with end-to-end responsibility. We want to be at the forefront of the newest technologies, and we move forward together. Every day. If you want to play a significant part in empowering our business, then welcome to BESTSELLER TECH. BESTSELLER TECH is part of the worldwide fashion company BESTSELLER. For more information, please go to www.bestseller.com.

Title: Freelance AI Agent Assistant
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

If you're a professional who works with AI Data Annotation and friendly user of LLMs, Mindrift offers a unique opportunity to apply your editing, annotating, fact-checking and creative skills to an AI training project.

This is a freelance role for a project, and your typical tasks may include:


Conduct high-quality web searches to verify facts, gather supporting data, and cross-check AI responses.
Perform fact-checking and intent verification to ensure AI responses align with the user's goals.
Carefully review and flag any inaccuracies, inconsistencies, or irrelevant answers.
Provide structured feedback on AI-generated content to help improve model performance.
Work effectively with large language models (LLMs), understanding their capabilities and limitations, and applying best practices when interacting with them
Prompt generation with a purpose to receive the best quality result of LLMs


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You are currently enrolled in or completed a Bachelor's degree or higher
You have professional and/or educational experience in data annotation, demonstrate a deeper-than-user-level interest in AI, and possess intellectual breadth and curiosity
You are skilled in web searching, fact-checking, intent-checking, able to work with LLMs and have great attention to detail
Your level of English is upper-intermediate (B2) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Standard IT Supporter
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are a $13+ billion global technology company, home to more than 224,000 people across 60 countries, delivering industry-leading capabilities centered around digital, engineering, cloud, and AI, powered by a broad portfolio of technology services and products.

HCLTech is a globally recognized leader in the Tech and IT industry, but we’ve never forgotten the startup mindset that got us here. We’ve always approached our work with an idea-first attitude because every one of our accomplishments —no matter how big or small —can be traced back to an idea’s single spark.

It’s that spark —that inner drive —that sets our people apart from our competitors. It enables us not just to pull off game-changing feat after game-changing feat but to better our world in the process. We want you to find your spark. Because that’s what drives you to be better, be more and ultimately, be more fulfilled.




Standard IT Supporter




We are looking for Standard IT supporter who will be delivering onsite IT support & services to all users of our client. The client’s location is in Copenhagen, Denmark.




The Standard IT supporter is a team player with good communication skills and with a focus on end user experience, willing to learn and share knowledge.




The support is delivered both as walk-in support and on-site support upon demand, and supporters work with all assigned tasks respectively. The support is highly based on collaboration and participating in coordination and stand-ups is an obligatory part of ensuring high quality towards end-users. We work in a global environment, where tickets are handling in a global setup and there is close collaboration with ServiceDesk and other on-site support-teams across the globe.




Principal Responsibilities




Perform the On-Site IT services and support (walk-in and on-site support)
Support the local IT infrastructure
Collaborate and engage with different business teams on IT related matters
Provide user training and on-boarding
Support meeting rooms and AV equipment
Support end-user equipment as per client’s standards
Assist and collaborate in IT project implementation as assigned by Lead or IT Operations manager
Perform visits to remote/ dispatched sites when applicable
Perform troubleshooting for all Laptop related queries which may also include Microsoft product suite related queries
Browser troubleshooting
Re-imaging laptops
Maintaining inventory of equipment
Recording all support incidents in Service-Now and work towards achieving the response and resolution KPIs
Keep aging incidents under check
Provide reports of open incidents and actions being taken to resolve those incidents.




Experience / Education




Standard : Minimum a Degree in IT/Computer Science or within relevant field and minimum of 3-6 years of IT support related experience is required.




Fluent in oral and written English and its good to have some skills in Danish
Appropriate service management program (ITIL foundation certification preferred, but not a requirement, as this can be provided)
Experience with ITSM tools like ServiceNow and ticket handling
Experience with KCS is an asset
Good technical knowledge in Microsoft, Window 10, Windows 11, 0365 environment, hardware; infrastructure. IOS devices and MacOS
If possible, experience with AV (audio/visio) equipment support (e.g. meeting rooms, videoconferencing, MS teams)
Experience working in an international environment is an asset
Previous experience working in a 24/7 organization & willingness to travel on regular basis
Knowledge of agile working method and maybe experience with KANBAN board metho




We Offer:




Competitive salary and performance bonuses
Opportunity for career progression
International and vibrant team environment, that appreciates team work and embraces knowledge sharing
Professional on-boarding and on-going trainings
Health insurance

Show more
HTML:
We are a $13+ billion global technology company, home to more than 224,000 people across 60 countries, delivering industry-leading capabilities centered around digital, engineering, cloud, and AI, powered by a broad portfolio of technology services and products.

HCLTech is a globally recognized leader in the Tech and IT industry, but we’ve never forgotten the startup mindset that got us here. We’ve always approached our work with an idea-first attitude because every one of our accomplishments —no matter how big or small —can be traced back to an idea’s single spark.

It’s that spark —that inner drive —that sets our people apart from our competitors. It enables us not just to pull off game-changing feat after game-changing feat but to better our world in the process. We want you to find your spark. Because that’s what drives you to be better, be more and ultimately, be more fulfilled.


Standard IT Supporter


We are looking for Standard IT supporter who will be delivering onsite IT support & services to all users of our client. The client’s location is in Copenhagen, Denmark.


The Standard IT supporter is a team player with good communication skills and with a focus on end user experience, willing to learn and share knowledge.


The support is delivered both as walk-in support and on-site support upon demand, and supporters work with all assigned tasks respectively. The support is highly based on collaboration and participating in coordination and stand-ups is an obligatory part of ensuring high quality towards end-users. We work in a global environment, where tickets are handling in a global setup and there is close collaboration with ServiceDesk and other on-site support-teams across the globe.


Principal Responsibilities


  1. Perform the On-Site IT services and support (walk-in and on-site support)
  2. Support the local IT infrastructure
  3. Collaborate and engage with different business teams on IT related matters
  4. Provide user training and on-boarding
  5. Support meeting rooms and AV equipment
  6. Support end-user equipment as per client’s standards
  7. Assist and collaborate in IT project implementation as assigned by Lead or IT Operations manager
  8. Perform visits to remote/ dispatched sites when applicable
  9. Perform troubleshooting for all Laptop related queries which may also include Microsoft product suite related queries
  10. Browser troubleshooting
  11. Re-imaging laptops
  12. Maintaining inventory of equipment
  13. Recording all support incidents in Service-Now and work towards achieving the response and resolution KPIs
  14. Keep aging incidents under check
  15. Provide reports of open incidents and actions being taken to resolve those incidents.


Experience / Education


Standard : Minimum a Degree in IT/Computer Science or within relevant field and minimum of 3-6 years of IT support related experience is required.


  • Fluent in oral and written English and its good to have some skills in Danish
  • Appropriate service management program (ITIL foundation certification preferred, but not a requirement, as this can be provided)
  • Experience with ITSM tools like ServiceNow and ticket handling
  • Experience with KCS is an asset
  • Good technical knowledge in Microsoft, Window 10, Windows 11, 0365 environment, hardware; infrastructure. IOS devices and MacOS
  • If possible, experience with AV (audio/visio) equipment support (e.g. meeting rooms, videoconferencing, MS teams)
  • Experience working in an international environment is an asset
  • Previous experience working in a 24/7 organization & willingness to travel on regular basis
  • Knowledge of agile working method and maybe experience with KANBAN board metho


We Offer:


  1. Competitive salary and performance bonuses
  2. Opportunity for career progression
  3. International and vibrant team environment, that appreciates team work and embraces knowledge sharing
  4. Professional on-boarding and on-going trainings
  5. Health insurance

Title: Market analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
NTU International A/S is leading a consortium for the implementation of the EIB funded project called: Global Gateway private sector digital infrastructure project delivery advisory services and is searching for experts to support the core team during the implementation of this project.




The overall objective of this assignment is to provide digital infrastructure promoters comprehensive advisory services to secure and deploy financing from EIB and co-financers for projects contributing to the EC’s Global Gateway.




Duration: The intended start date is October 2025, and the period of implementation of the contract will be 48 months from this date.




Key Expert: Market analyst




☝️ Qualifications and skills:

University degree in a relevant discipline (Economics, Law, Finance or Engineering or other relevant field). Master’s degree would be an advantage;
Fluency in oral and written English;
Working knowledge of French will be considered as an asset.




☝️ General professional experience:

10 years’ experience in the digital / telecom sector;
5 years’ experience in market analysis in the digital economy/telecom sector.




☝️ Specific professional experience:

Experience of market analysis in developing countries and least developed countries, as demonstrated by the expert’s involvement in projects involving telecom operators fundraising, mergers and acquisition;
Experience of market analysis delivered for financial institutions (commercial banks or development banks);
Experience of market analysis in sub-Saharan Africa involving market review, competitive analysis, financial projects and risk analysis.




If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply and upload your CV via LinkedIn or sent to recruitment@ntu.eu. Due to the large number of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Show more

  • Experience of market analysis in sub-Saharan Africa involving market review, competitive analysis, financial projects and risk analysis.


If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply and upload your CV via LinkedIn or sent to recruitment@ntu.eu. Due to the large number of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Title: Founder’s Assistant at fast-growing AI startup
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Copli

Copli is a fast-growing GenAI software company transforming content creation workflows for the world’s largest pharmaceutical companies. Over the past 12 months, we’ve established ourselves as a trusted partner, collaborating with many of the top pharma companies globally - and we are growing at a rapid pace.

We are building an innovative, agentic system that pushes the boundaries of what GenAI can do - redefining the “Medical, Legal, and Regulatory” (MLR) review process for promotional materials. This process is currently conducted 100% manually and requires specialized expertise. At Copli, we’re automating it, saving days of manual work for our users.

Our founders are ex-BCG, ex-Accura, and top AI engineers. We operate with the same analytical rigor and strategic thinking you’d find in top-tier consulting firms. If your goal is to work at a MBB (McKinsey, BCG, Bain) or in a top-tier strategy role, this is the perfect training ground.

About The Role

We are looking for a CEO/Founder’s Assistant to work directly with the CEO and COO across a wide range of strategic and operational activities. This is a unique opportunity to work side-by-side with the leadership team, gaining insight into how enterprise sales, large-scale customer projects, and financial strategy come together in a high-growth startup.

You will be exposed to diverse areas of the business, from sales and customer engagement to financial modelling and operational execution.

What You Will Work On


Sales-related tasks: Outreach to prospects, joining sales calls, preparing proposals, and managing follow-up actions.
Enterprise project management: Coordinating ongoing projects with large corporate customers.
Financial modelling: Supporting cash-flow and scenario planning for the business.
Ad hoc strategic and operational tasks: From research and analysis to preparing presentations and helping drive new initiatives forward.


You Are a Great Fit If You


Have strong analytical skills
Are proactive, organized, and comfortable managing multiple priorities.
Believe that LLMs can improve every task, or have experience/strong interest in GenAI.
Are curious about business strategy, sales, and technology, and eager to learn quickly.
Want to experience firsthand how to build and scale a tech company


What We Offer


Direct exposure to the decision-making of a scaling tech startup.
Mentorship from founders with backgrounds in top-tier management consulting, law, and AI innovation.
A role where your work will have tangible, immediate impact.
Flexible working hours (approx. 20 hours/week) to fit around your studies.
Excellent breakfast, chef-prepared lunch, and great coffee at our Copenhagen office.


How To Apply

Email Jacob (CEO, co-founder) at hello@copli.io with your CV and a note about your motivation.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We're looking for a hands-on Data Platform Engineer to join a high-impact team building a scalable AWS-based data platform for a trailblazer in AI governance and analytics. You’ll collaborate across engineering, DevOps, and compliance teams to drive performance, observability, and data integrity across systems.




Responsibilities

Architect and evolve a scalable, high-availability cloud infrastructure on AWS
Build robust data platforms to support large-scale analytics and governance tools
Implement automation through Infrastructure as Code and CI/CD workflows
Lead container orchestration with Kubernetes, Docker, Helm, and ArgoCD
Support data infrastructure compliance, performance tuning, and reliability
Ensure alignment with cloud security and data governance standards




Ideal Candidate

3+ years of AWS infrastructure and DevOps experience
Deep expertise with Kubernetes, Docker, and tools like Terraform or Pulumi
Programming experience in Python and Typescript
Familiarity with distributed data systems and SQL optimisation
Fluent in English
Problem-solver with a collaborative and pragmatic mindset




This role offers a competitive salary, flexible hybrid working, and a chance to grow within an innovative company shaping the future of trustworthy AI and data infrastructure.
